original: mtshungs ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa ni /
analyzed: mtshungs ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa ni /
translated: The second is the excessive adherence to sameness.

original: rnam pa gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: The attachment to sameness is the attachment to a single aspect.

original: rnam pa gcig pa de yang brdzun pa'i phyir phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa de yang brdzun pa'i phyir phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: That single aspect is false, and therefore it is erroneous.

original: de skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pa yang de las gzhan pa yongs su spong ba'i brjod par 'dod pa'i don las gzhan pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩrnam par gcad pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pa yang de las gzhan pa yongs su spong ba'i brjod par 'dod pa'i don las gzhan pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te / rnam par gcad pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word that produces it is the word that excludes what is other than that, because it is the part that excludes what is other than the object that is intended to be expressed.

original: rnam par gcad pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the exclusion.

original: don dam par dngos su de las tha dad pa'i don dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las tha dad pa dag la mi slu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par dngos su de las tha dad pa'i don dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las tha dad pa dag la mi slu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Ultimately, it is nondeceptive with regard to things that are different from it, and it is different from that which is not its effect.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag ba nyid dang byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mnyan pa rtag pa las log pa'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta bu bzhin gyi ldog pa la brten nas brdar btags pa pa rnams ni tha snyad kyi tshe yang de lta
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag ba nyid dang byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mnyan pa rtag pa las log pa'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta bu bzhin gyi ldog pa la brten nas brdar btags pa pa rnams ni tha snyad kyi tshe yang de lta
translated: Thus, the terms ‚Äúimpermanence,‚Äù ‚Äúproduced,‚Äù and so on are nominally imputed in dependence on the negation of the opposite of permanence, etc.,

original: bu'i gzhan yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bos 'thob pa'i rgyu dag tu 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam par bcad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin pa las mnyan pa de brdar btags pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la yod pa yin pas 'di tsam gyi shan gyis mi slu ba yin gyi sgra rnams la du ba la sogs pa bzhin du dngos
analyzed: bu'i gzhan yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bos 'thob pa'i rgyu dag tu 'gyur ro // rnam par bcad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin pa las mnyan pa de brdar btags pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la yod pa yin pas 'di tsam gyi shan gyis mi slu ba yin gyi sgra rnams la du ba la sogs pa bzhin du dngos
translated: and they are causes that are obtained by the nature of the aspect of the exclusion of other, even at the time of conventional expression.üîΩSince the terms are in the correct negation, they exist in things that are nominally imputed, etc., and they are nondeceptive by the power of this alone.

original: po dang 'brel pa nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: po dang 'brel pa nges pa ni med de /
translated: But, like smoke, etc., they are not ascertained to be related to things by means of a real entity.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa tsam las rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa tsam las rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are dependent on mere desire.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is thus,‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad pa rnam par gcod pa de ni dngos po de dag la yang dag pa yin zhing bden ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam par gcod pa de ni dngos po de dag la yang dag pa yin zhing bden ba yin no //
translated: That exclusion of difference is real and true in regard to those entities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs po smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs po smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the non-transgression of exclusion in every way,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te spyi khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: gal te spyi khas len kyang rung /
translated: Whether or not one accepts a universal,

original: 'on te mi len kyang rung rnam pa thams cad du rnam par bcad pa de las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te mi len kyang rung rnam pa thams cad du rnam par bcad pa de las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one cannot transgress that exclusion in every way.

original: tshad ma yang gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshad ma yang gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
translated: The measure of that has been explained above.

original: gal te spyi'i bdag nyid kyang de la yang dag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i bdag nyid kyang de la yang dag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal nature is real in that,

original: tha dad pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhether different from the particulars, etc.‚Äù

original: bye brag la sogs pa dag gi ltar spyi'i dngos po gcig gsal ba las tha dad pa 'am grang can pa rnams kyi ltar ba mi @130a * //üîΩdad pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: bye brag la sogs pa dag gi ltar spyi'i dngos po gcig gsal ba las tha dad pa 'am grang can pa rnams kyi ltar ba mi @130a * //üîΩdad pa'ang rung ste /
translated: According to the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc., the universal is one entity that is different from the particulars.üîΩAccording to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, etc., it is not different from the particulars.

original: de rnams la yang dag pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams la yang dag pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not real‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam pa thams cad du gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'ong bas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par mi rung ba'i phyir te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'ong bas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par mi rung ba'i phyir te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for them to be either different or non-different, since there is no valid cognition that perceives them as such.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ni sngar yang bshad zin la 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ni sngar yang bshad zin la 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The valid cognition that refutes this has already been explained and will be explained again.

original: yang gal te spyi de lta bu yang sgras brjod na ni de'i tshe spyi yod pa ma yin pa de dngos po la 'god cing sgras yul du byed par khas len na ni dngos po thag bsring ba kho nar te shin tu rgyangs bcad pa kho nar 'gyur
analyzed: yang gal te spyi de lta bu yang sgras brjod na ni de'i tshe spyi yod pa ma yin pa de dngos po la 'god cing sgras yul du byed par khas len na ni dngos po thag bsring ba kho nar te shin tu rgyangs bcad pa kho nar 'gyur
translated: If a word expresses such a universal, then when one asserts that a nonexistent universal is posited in relation to a thing and is made an object by a word, then the thing is removed, that is, it is very far away.

original: ro // gang las she na sgra dang shes pa dag las te sgra dang des bslang ba'i shes pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro // gang las she na sgra dang shes pa dag las te sgra dang des bslang ba'i shes pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From what? From words and consciousnesses, that is, from words and the consciousnesses that are elicited by them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i yul du 'dod pa sgra dang shes pa'i yul du 'dod pa de zhes bya ba'i spyi'i dngos po rnams la med pa'i phyir dang spyi la ma gtogs pa dngos po'i chos gzhan yang 'ga' la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul du 'dod pa sgra dang shes pa'i yul du 'dod pa de zhes bya ba'i spyi'i dngos po rnams la med pa'i phyir dang spyi la ma gtogs pa dngos po'i chos gzhan yang 'ga' la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of that, i.e., the object of the word and the cognition, is not a universal entity, and because no other property of an entity is found anywhere apart from the universal.

original: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i ltar na ni sgra log pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / de yang dngos po rnams la yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang shes pa dag las dngos po thag pa srid ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i ltar na ni sgra log pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / de yang dngos po rnams la yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang shes pa dag las dngos po thag pa srid ba ma yin no //
translated: But according to the theory of apoha, the word is not a negation because it is a negation of the unreal, and because that is real in regard to entities, it is not the case that the entity is remote from the word and cognition.

original: de byed pa dang de la brten pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de byed pa dang de la brten pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the cause of the entity and the basis of the entity.

original: gzhan las log cing rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i don rnams la bye brag med par zhes bya bar ni rigs mi mthun pa las log pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan las log cing rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i don rnams la bye brag med par zhes bya bar ni rigs mi mthun pa las log pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: In regard to the meaning of ‚Äúwithout distinction among the things that are the exclusions of other and the exclusions of the heterogeneous,‚Äù it is because it exists in all exclusions of the heterogeneous.

original: khyad par me dpar de la brtan nas so //
analyzed: khyad par me dpar de la brtan nas so //
translated: The distinction is based on that.

original: ldog pa'i khyad par rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas gsal ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la sgra 'god pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i khyad par rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas gsal ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la sgra 'god pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the word is applied to all the homogeneous classes in dependence upon the specific difference which is the characteristic of the exclusion of heterogeneous classes.

original: brdar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention is made.

original: 'dis ni mnyan pa gzhan sel ba la brten pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba la brten pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mnyan pa gzhan sel ba la brten pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba la brten pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: This explains that the word is based on the exclusion of other because it is based on the listener's exclusion of other.

original: gzhan spangs nas zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa spangs nas te /
analyzed: gzhan spangs nas zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa spangs nas te /
translated: Having excluded other means having excluded the heterogeneous class.

original: 'dis ni mnyan pa gzhan sel ba'i byed pa po'i ngo bo yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mnyan pa gzhan sel ba'i byed pa po'i ngo bo yin par bshad do //
translated: This explains that the word is the nature of the agent of the listener's exclusion of other.

original: shing ma yin pa las log par ni zhes bya ba la sogs bas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: shing ma yin pa las log par ni zhes bya ba la sogs bas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: The phrase from the opposite of non-tree and so on anticipates an objection.

original: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i ltar na sgrub pa'i ngo bor ni shing yang mi 'dzin la shing ma yin pa yang mi 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i ltar na sgrub pa'i ngo bor ni shing yang mi 'dzin la shing ma yin pa yang mi 'dzin gyi /
translated: According to the proponents of the exclusion of other, a tree is not apprehended as the nature of the affirmation, nor is non-tree apprehended.

original: 'on kyang gzhan @130b rnam par gcod pas 'dzin to zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan @130b rnam par gcod pas 'dzin to zhes grag go //
translated: However, it is said that it is apprehended by the exclusion of other.

original: de la shing ma yin las 'dog  par ni shing don 'dzin na shing zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de 'dzin par khas len na shing dang shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa gnyis po ni phan tshun rten pa yin zhing gcig la gcig brten pa
analyzed: de la shing ma yin las 'dog  par ni shing don 'dzin na shing zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de 'dzin par khas len na shing dang shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa gnyis po ni phan tshun rten pa yin zhing gcig la gcig brten pa
translated: In response to that, if one asserts that the meaning of the term tree is apprehended when the meaning of tree is apprehended, then the two, the apprehension of tree and the apprehension of non-tree, are mutually dependent and are dependent on one another.

original: yin te 'di ltar shing ma yin pa rnam par gcog pas ni shing gi don 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: yin te 'di ltar shing ma yin pa rnam par gcog pas ni shing gi don 'dzin pa yin /
translated: This is because the meaning of tree is apprehended by the exclusion of non-tree.

original: shing 'dzin pa shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin par khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: shing 'dzin pa shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin par khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: One must accept that the apprehension of tree is preceded by the apprehension of non-tree,

original: shing ma yin pa ma bzung ba ni rnam par bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: shing ma yin pa ma bzung ba ni rnam par bcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: because without apprehending non-tree, it is impossible to exclude it.

original: shing ma yin pa yang shing rnam par bcad pas 'dzin na de la yang shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa ni shing 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing ma yin pa yang shing rnam par bcad pas 'dzin na de la yang shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa ni shing 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If non-tree is also apprehended by the exclusion of tree, then in that case the apprehension of non-tree would be preceded by the apprehension of tree,üîΩbecause without apprehending tree, it is impossible to exclude it.

original: shing ma bzung bar de rnam par bcad pas shing ma yin pa'i don rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing ma bzung bar de rnam par bcad pas shing ma yin pa'i don rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without apprehending the tree, it is impossible to posit the meaning of non-tree by way of the exclusion of that.

original: de ltar na shing dang shing ma yin pa dag gi nang nas shing dang shing ma yin pa gcig 'dzin pa med na gnyis mi 'dzin gang gi phyir gnyi ga yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyu de'i phyir gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i don la sgra brdar gdags par
analyzed: de ltar na shing dang shing ma yin pa dag gi nang nas shing dang shing ma yin pa gcig 'dzin pa med na gnyis mi 'dzin gang gi phyir gnyi ga yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyu de'i phyir gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i don la sgra brdar gdags par
translated: Thus, if one does not apprehend either the tree or the non-tree from among the tree and the non-tree, one does not apprehend both. Because one does not apprehend both, the meaning of the exclusion of the other, which is the basis for the designation of the word,

original: bshad pa gang yin pa de mi srid do zhes gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa kha cig smra ste /
analyzed: bshad pa gang yin pa de mi srid do zhes gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa kha cig smra ste /
translated: is impossible. For that reason, some, such as Kumarila, say that the explanation is impossible.

original: de lta bas na de ni spyi gang la bsgrub pa'i ngo bo kho nar brdar gdags pa dngos por gyur pa zhig 'dod par bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni spyi gang la bsgrub pa'i ngo bo kho nar brdar gdags pa dngos por gyur pa zhig 'dod par bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, they think that one should accept that the universal is a real entity that is the basis for the designation of the word.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
translated: Some say that the word is applied to the individual through the universal.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shing te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shing te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the tree that is characterized by being different from the non-tree.

original: de ltar na re zhig shing 'dzin pa med do ;
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig shing 'dzin pa med do ;
translated: Thus, first of all, there is no apprehension of a tree.

original: / shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa yang med par shing ma shes pa can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: / shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa yang med par shing ma shes pa can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And there is no apprehension of a non-tree, as stated in the line, ‚Äúby one who does not know a tree.‚Äù

original: skyes bu gang la shing ma shes pa yod pa des so //
analyzed: skyes bu gang la shing ma shes pa yod pa des so //
translated: The person who does not know a tree.

original: de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shing rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni shing rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: The nature of the exclusion of that is the exclusion of a tree.

original: blo la mi gnas pa'i don la zhes bya ba ni gal te shing dang shing ma yin pa dag blo la gnas pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas shing gi don la brdar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: blo la mi gnas pa'i don la zhes bya ba ni gal te shing dang shing ma yin pa dag blo la gnas pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas shing gi don la brdar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot present in the mind‚Äù is this: if a tree and a non-tree were present in the mind, then, having excluded a non-tree, one could affix the name tree to the object.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan la yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid du bsten te /üîΩdes na de'i lan gang yin pa bdag @131a * //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan la yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid du bsten te / des na de'i lan gang yin pa bdag @131a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthese same‚Äù and so on indicates that the same error applies to other cases as well.

original: gis yang de kho na yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gis yang de kho na yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever reply he might have, I think it is just the same as before.

original: gang dag de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: Those who say ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on explain.

original: smra ba gang dag de ltar spyi dngos po gcig khas blangs nas gzhan rnam par gcod pas brdar 'dogs par byed pa la phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa yin par rgol ba de dag gi shing nyid kyi spyi de lta bu de la yang brdar byed pa na
analyzed: smra ba gang dag de ltar spyi dngos po gcig khas blangs nas gzhan rnam par gcod pas brdar 'dogs par byed pa la phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa yin par rgol ba de dag gi shing nyid kyi spyi de lta bu de la yang brdar byed pa na
translated: Those who say that a single universal is accepted in that way and that the designation of conventions by the exclusion of other is the error of mutual dependence, in that case, the universal tree is also designated as a convention.

original: shing ma yin pa rnam par gcod dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par brtags pa gnyis so //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa rnam par gcod dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par brtags pa gnyis so //
translated: It is analyzed as to whether or not it excludes non-tree.

original: gal te rnam par gcod pa yin na de'i tshe mi shes pa rnams la rnam par gcod pa mi srid pa de'i phyir de dag shes par khas blang dgos na de dag shes pa de yang med do //üîΩde nyid gal te rnam gcod shing gi don //
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod pa yin na de'i tshe mi shes pa rnams la rnam par gcod pa mi srid pa de'i phyir de dag shes par khas blang dgos na de dag shes pa de yang med do // de nyid gal te rnam gcod shing gi don //
translated: If it excludes, then in that case, since it is impossible for those who do not know to exclude, therefore it must be accepted that they know it, but that knowledge of them does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That very point is indicated by ‚ÄúIf it is the exclusion of tree‚Äù and so on.

original: shing gi don 'dzin pa med na ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha yin no //
analyzed: shing gi don 'dzin pa med na ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha yin no //
translated: The phrase if there were no apprehension of the referent of the word is part of the verse.

original: mdun na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spel mar bshad pa las ma smos te /
analyzed: mdun na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spel mar bshad pa las ma smos te /
translated: The word in front is not mentioned in the alternate explanation.

original: shing gi don 'dzin pa med par shing 'dzin pa'i mdun rol na shing ma yin pa dag ji ltar shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing gi don 'dzin pa med par shing 'dzin pa'i mdun rol na shing ma yin pa dag ji ltar shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if there were no apprehension of the referent of the word tree, how could one know non-trees prior to the apprehension of the tree?

original: gang dag tshig le'ur byas pa la mdun na zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don pa de dag gis ni don ces bya ba'i sgra 'don par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag tshig le'ur byas pa la mdun na zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don pa de dag gis ni don ces bya ba'i sgra 'don par mi bya'o //
translated: Those who recite the word in front in the verse should not recite the word meaning.

original: shing ma yin pa nges pa'i dus na shing gi don 'dzin pa med de shing 'dzin pa ni shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa nges pa'i dus na shing gi don 'dzin pa med de shing 'dzin pa ni shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of ascertaining non-tree, there is no apprehension of the referent of the word tree, because the apprehension of tree is preceded by the apprehension of non-tree.

original: shing nges pa med par ma yin pa'i don 'dzin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing nges pa med par ma yin pa'i don 'dzin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the apprehension of non-tree occurs without the ascertainment of tree,

original: de yang yang shing 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang yang shing 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that also is preceded by the apprehension of tree.

original: de nyid de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is indicated by ‚Äúat that time‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi dus su'o //
translated: At that time is the time of the convention.

original: rtogs pa pos zhes bya ba ni gang gi ched du brdar byed pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa pos zhes bya ba ni gang gi ched du brdar byed pas so //
translated: The one who understands is the one for whose sake the convention is made.

original: ci'i phyir mi shes she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi shes she na /
translated: Why is it not known?

original: de shes par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de shes par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of knowing that‚Äù and so on.

original: shing dang shing ma yin pa de shes par bya ba kho na'i phyir ji ltar na brda las dus phyis shing dang shing ma yin pa dag shes par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: shing dang shing ma yin pa de shes par bya ba kho na'i phyir ji ltar na brda las dus phyis shing dang shing ma yin pa dag shes par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Since the tree and the non-tree are known, how can the tree and the non-tree be known later from the convention?

original: de don du gnyer ba nyid du brda don du gnyer ba nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir te sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba nyid du brda don du gnyer ba nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir te sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the one who seeks the object, the one who seeks the meaning of the convention, it approaches, it is established.

original: des na tha snyad kyi dus na rtogs pa po la shing dang shing ma yin pa shes pa med do //
analyzed: des na tha snyad kyi dus na rtogs pa po la shing dang shing ma yin pa shes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, at the time of the convention, the one who understands does not know the tree and the non-tree.

original: shing dang shing ma yin pa mi shes pa des ji ltar brda la shing @131b ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa rtogs par 'gyur te rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: shing dang shing ma yin pa mi shes pa des ji ltar brda la shing @131b ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa rtogs par 'gyur te rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: How can one who does not know a tree and what is not a tree understand the exclusion of what is not a tree in a sign? He does understand it.

original: shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa mi rtog pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa mi rtog pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: Even though he does not understand the exclusion of what is not a tree,

original: shing gi don gang la de las gzhan pa shing de las gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa rnam par ma bcad pa yod pa de ni de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can no //
analyzed: shing gi don gang la de las gzhan pa shing de las gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa rnam par ma bcad pa yod pa de ni de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can no //
translated: that which has the meaning of a tree, which is not the exclusion of what is not a tree, which is not the exclusion of what is other than that, is said to have what is other than that unexcluded.

original: de la 'god cing brdar 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'god cing brdar 'dogs pa ste /
translated: It is that which is designated as a sign.

original: sgra gang la de yod pa zhes ldan pa'i don du bya'o //
analyzed: sgra gang la de yod pa zhes ldan pa'i don du bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving that‚Äù is the meaning of possession.

original: yang na 'di la de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can la 'god pa'i dang tshul yod ba zhes bya bar tshig bsdu ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di la de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can la 'god pa'i dang tshul yod ba zhes bya bar tshig bsdu ste /
translated: Or else, the meaning of ‚Äúhaving that‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded other.‚Äù

original: shing yin pa las rnam par ma bcad pa'i the tshom can gyi ngo bo la brdar btags pa can las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shing yin pa las rnam par ma bcad pa'i the tshom can gyi ngo bo la brdar btags pa can las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded other‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of positing what has the unexcluded non-tree.‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äú

original: rnam pa gzhan du na de las gzhan pa ni shing las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na de las gzhan pa ni shing las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be different from the tree.

original: de la 'god pa brdar 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'god pa brdar 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The expression of the word is the designation of the convention.

original: 'di ni de las gzhan pa la 'god pa yang yin la yongs su ma spangs pa yang yin pas shes las 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de las gzhan pa la 'god pa yang yin la yongs su ma spangs pa yang yin pas shes las 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: It is the expression of the word in regard to that which is different from the tree, and it is not the exclusion of that.

original: de shing zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la yod pa zhes snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: de shing zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la yod pa zhes snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the word tree is the tree itself, as before.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni shing gi don shing ma yin pa las rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir de la brdar gdags pa'i sgra shing gi khyad par dgal gzhan du shing ma yin pa la yang 'god par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni shing gi don shing ma yin pa las rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir de la brdar gdags pa'i sgra shing gi khyad par dgal gzhan du shing ma yin pa la yang 'god par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the compound is this: the word that designates the tree is also expressed in regard to that which is different from the tree, because the meaning of the word tree is not distinguished from that which is not the tree.

original: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra de lta bu las ni tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skyes bu rnams tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na de yongs su spangs nas shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra de lta bu las ni tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skyes bu rnams tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na de yongs su spangs nas shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas /
translated: But when people who use the word tree employ the word, they do so by excluding that which is not the tree.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan par nges pa la 'jug par ni mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang par par shing dang shing ma yin pa dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan par nges pa la 'jug par ni mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang par par shing dang shing ma yin pa dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: but it does not engage in the determination that it possesses branches, etc. Rather, it engages in the determination of tree and non-tree.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: shing gi khyad par bzhin te /
analyzed: shing gi khyad par bzhin te /
translated: Like the determination of a particular tree.

original: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs la sogs pa dang bral ba las ni /
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs la sogs pa dang bral ba las ni /
translated: The word tree, when not associated with a context, etc.,

original: shing gi khyad par seng ldeng la sogs pa la de las gzhan pa'i shing gi khyad par yongs su spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing gi khyad par seng ldeng la sogs pa la de las gzhan pa'i shing gi khyad par yongs su spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: does not engage in the determination of a particular tree, such as a teak tree, etc., by excluding other particular trees,

original: brda'i dus na de dag rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda'i dus na de dag rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not distinguished at the time of the convention.

original: brda'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: brda'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with, ‚ÄúAt the time of the convention,‚Äù etc.

original: brda zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brda'i dus yin par bstan to //
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brda'i dus yin par bstan to //
translated: The word convention indicates that it is the time of the convention.

original: gzhan rnam par ma bcad par zhes bya ba'i ni gzhan shing ma yin pa las shing gi don rnam par ma bcad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par ma bcad par zhes bya ba'i ni gzhan shing ma yin pa las shing gi don rnam par ma bcad par ro //
translated: Without the exclusion of other means without the exclusion of the meaning of tree from other, i.e., non-tree.

original: rnam par bshad pa gnyis @132a * //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa gnyis @132a * //
translated: Two explanations.

original: pa la gzhan shing ma yin pa la shing zhes bya ba'i sgra rnam par ma bcad par zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: pa la gzhan shing ma yin pa la shing zhes bya ba'i sgra rnam par ma bcad par zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: and the word tree is not excluded with respect to what is not a tree.

original: bkod pa ni brdar btags pa'o //
analyzed: bkod pa ni brdar btags pa'o //
translated: An arrangement is a conventional symbol.

original: de yongs su spangs nas zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas so //üîΩshing gi khyad par bzhin zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩshing sha pa la sogs pa nyid khyad par yin no zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs nas zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas so // shing gi khyad par bzhin zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te / shing sha pa la sogs pa nyid khyad par yin no zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu'o //
translated: Having completely abandoned that means having completely abandoned what is not a tree.üîΩLike a particular tree means like a particular shinshapa tree and so on.üîΩThe term particular tree is included in the term particular.

original: mdo las shing gi khyad par bzhin zhes drug pa'i tshig bsdu ba byas pa shing sha pa la sogs pa nyid shing gi khyad par yin pas 'grel pa dang mthun pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mdo las shing gi khyad par bzhin zhes drug pa'i tshig bsdu ba byas pa shing sha pa la sogs pa nyid shing gi khyad par yin pas 'grel pa dang mthun pa kho na yin te /
translated: The sutra uses the term like a particular tree, which is a genitive tatpurusa compound, but since a particular shinshapa tree and so on is a particular tree, it is a locative tatpurusa compound, which is consistent with the commentary.

original: de dag la ji ltar shing zhes bya ba'i sgra las phan tshun rnam par gcod pas mi 'jug pa de ltar ni mdo rnam par dbye ba nyid las bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag la ji ltar shing zhes bya ba'i sgra las phan tshun rnam par gcod pas mi 'jug pa de ltar ni mdo rnam par dbye ba nyid las bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained in the Analysis of the Discourses that, just as the word ‚Äútree‚Äù does not apply by way of mutual exclusion, so too the word ‚Äúperson‚Äù does not apply by way of mutual exclusion.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúBut if . . .‚Äù and so on anticipates an objection from the opponent.

original: kha cig ni brdar gdags pa'i yul yang mi sgrub la /üîΩde las gzhan pa yang mi dgag par zhes bya ba yin par gal te mi bsgrub gzhan mi dgag ces dgag pa gnyis 'don to //
analyzed: kha cig ni brdar gdags pa'i yul yang mi sgrub la / de las gzhan pa yang mi dgag par zhes bya ba yin par gal te mi bsgrub gzhan mi dgag ces dgag pa gnyis 'don to //
translated: Some say that the object of conventional designation is not established,üîΩand that it is not the case that something other than that is refuted.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: If you say that it is not established and that something other is not refuted, you are making two negations.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ma gtogs par sgra 'jug par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ; mdun gnas gcig cig rab bstan nas //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ma gtogs par sgra 'jug par mi srid pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ; mdun gnas gcig cig rab bstan nas //
translated: That is not reasonable, because it is impossible for a word to apply without affirmation and negation.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang nyams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang nyams te /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚ÄúHaving indicated one thing that is present‚Äù is undermined.

original: de ston par smra bas ni bsgrub pa khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ston par smra bas ni bsgrub pa khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Because the one who speaks of indicating that accepts the affirmation.

original: de bas na sgrub par yang mi byed par rab tu bstan pa yang byas na zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par yang mi byed par rab tu bstan pa yang byas na zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be contradictory to say, ‚ÄúIf one does not establish, one should teach.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na mi bsgrub par zhes bya ba 'di kho na la dgag pa lta bar bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi bsgrub par zhes bya ba 'di kho na la dgag pa lta bar bya ba yin pas /
translated: Thus, one should understand that the negation is only in regard to this phrase, ‚Äúone does not establish.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan bkag mi bsgrub par zhes gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan bkag mi bsgrub par zhes gdon par bya'o //
translated: If one negates the other, one should say, ‚Äúone does not establish.‚Äù

original: sngar gzhan bkag nas de rnam par bcad pas brda'i yul gzhan mi sgrub par te /
analyzed: sngar gzhan bkag nas de rnam par bcad pas brda'i yul gzhan mi sgrub par te /
translated: Having previously negated the other, by the exclusion of that, one does not establish the other object of convention.

original: dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sgrub pa ma byas par bsgrub pa tsam 'ba' zhig byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sgrub pa ma byas par bsgrub pa tsam 'ba' zhig byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not perform the mere establishment alone, without performing the establishment that is preceded by the negation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mdun gnas gcig cig rab bstan nas //
analyzed: mdun gnas gcig cig rab bstan nas //
translated: having indicated one that is present in front,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: one should say,

original: 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: As the commentary also says,

original: 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad gcig brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bsgrub pa kho na 'god @132b cing bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad gcig brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dgag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bsgrub pa kho na 'god @132b cing bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: But it is not that something is expressed by the exclusion of some other thing.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni spyi ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni spyi ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù is a universal.

original: 'di ni spyi la brdar byas pa'i phyir gsal ba thams cad la brdar byas pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi la brdar byas pa'i phyir gsal ba thams cad la brdar byas pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that this is a convention that is made with respect to a universal, and so it is a convention that is made with respect to all instances.

original: 'di shing yin zhes bya ba'i ni brda'i rang gi ngo bo ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di shing yin zhes bya ba'i ni brda'i rang gi ngo bo ston pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is a tree‚Äù shows the nature of a convention.

original: dngos pa gang zhig rab tu bstan nas brdar byas pa ni /
analyzed: dngos pa gang zhig rab tu bstan nas brdar byas pa ni /
translated: When a particular is shown and a convention is made with respect to it,üîΩthen that particular is understood when a convention is made with respect to it.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na yang de rtogs par 'gyur te rgyu de'i phyir spyi dngos por smra ba la bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'di med snyam na'o //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na yang de rtogs par 'gyur te rgyu de'i phyir spyi dngos por smra ba la bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'di med snyam na'o //
translated: Therefore, those who maintain that universals are real think that the previously mentioned error does not apply to them.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i don kho na zhes bya ba ni gang la brdar byas pa yin pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i don kho na zhes bya ba ni gang la brdar byas pa yin pa'i spyi'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe object that is seen‚Äù refers to a universal, which is the object with respect to which a convention is made.

original: de dang 'brel pa can ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gyi rten no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gyi rten no //
translated: The basis of the relation is the universal.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig gis brdar byed pa la yang brtags pa gnyis te /üîΩ'di ni shing yin no zhes brdar byed pas 'di yang shing yin zhes brjod pa'am /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig gis brdar byed pa la yang brtags pa gnyis te / 'di ni shing yin no zhes brdar byed pas 'di yang shing yin zhes brjod pa'am /
translated: In the case of the relation, there are two kinds of designations:üîΩby the designation ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù one says ‚ÄúThat is a tree,‚Äù

original: 'di kho na shing yin zhes brjod grang /
analyzed: 'di kho na shing yin zhes brjod grang /
translated: or one says ‚ÄúThis is a tree.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang po ltar na ni gzhan yang shing nyid yin pa ma bkag pas tha snyad kyi tshe nges pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thal ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na ni gzhan yang shing nyid yin pa ma bkag pas tha snyad kyi tshe nges pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thal ba de nyid yin no //
translated: In the first case, since it is not denied that the other is also a tree, the consequence is that, at the time of designation, there is no engagement by way of ascertainment.

original: 'on te 'di kho na shing yin no zhes brjod na ni de'i tshe de nyid shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad par khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'di kho na shing yin no zhes brjod na ni de'i tshe de nyid shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad par khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: But if one says ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù then at that time one accepts that it is a tree, and that it is not a non-tree.

original: de bas na tha snyad kyi tshe brtan par bya bas shing dang shing ma yin pa dag ji ltar shes te /
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad kyi tshe brtan par bya bas shing dang shing ma yin pa dag ji ltar shes te /
translated: Therefore, at the time of designation, how can one know that it is a tree and not a non-tree?

original: thal ba de'i so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: thal ba de'i so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: The consequence remains.

original: de nyid bstan par thal ba ldog pa med ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par thal ba ldog pa med ces bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said that the consequence of the teaching of that is unavoidable.

original: gcig rab tu bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /üîΩ'di yang shing yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: gcig rab tu bstan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de / 'di yang shing yin no zhe 'am /
translated: He explains with Having taught one... and so on.

original: 'di kho na shing yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di kho na shing yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is also a tree or This alone is a tree.

original: tshul ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tshul ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The manner is the aspect.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyi ga la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyi ga la yang ngo //
translated: And in those means in both aspects.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says from the seeing of another... and so on.

original: rnam pa gang zhig mthong zhing nyams su myong ba de las bzlog pa de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni shes par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gang zhig mthong zhing nyams su myong ba de las bzlog pa de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni shes par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easy to understand that which is contrary to that aspect which is seen and experienced, that which is incompatible with that characteristic.

original: mdor gzhag pa'i tshig 'di nyid gcig 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad de /
analyzed: mdor gzhag pa'i tshig 'di nyid gcig 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad de /
translated: He explains this very statement of the summary with one... and so on.

original: shing nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gcig 'ga' zhig mthong zhing /
analyzed: shing nyid la sogs pa'i spyi gcig 'ga' zhig mthong zhing /
translated: Having seen one universal such as treeness,

original: spyi de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan la de'i rnam pas dben pa'i ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo @133a * //
analyzed: spyi de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dngos po gzhan la de'i rnam pas dben pa'i ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo @133a * //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of the object that is seen as being devoid of that universal, and that has the aspect of the thing that is different in nature from that universal,

original: nyams su myong ba'i skyes bu la ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i skyes bu la ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin /
translated: is the cognition that is experienced by the person who has the experience, just as it is experienced.

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba de las gzhan no snyam pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba de las gzhan no snyam pa /
translated: It is the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is different from what is seen.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i chos mi mthun pa nges pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gtan la 'bebs pa skye ste 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos mi mthun pa nges pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gtan la 'bebs pa skye ste 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor bshad do //
translated: The ascertainment of the thing that is different in nature from that is born in this way. This is the nature of the ascertainment of the thing that is different in nature from that.

original: de las 'byed pa zhes bya bas ni las bstan to //
analyzed: de las 'byed pa zhes bya bas ni las bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúdistinguishes‚Äù in the root text shows the action.

original: sngon mthong ba'i don las rnam par 'byed cing tha dad pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i don las rnam par 'byed cing tha dad pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the cognition that distinguishes and posits the thing that is different from the object that was seen previously.

original: de las gzhan no snyam pa 'di kho nas de las 'byed pa nyid du grub pa las yang smos pa ni ci nas kyang sgra'i byed pa med par de'i ngo bor nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de ngo bo ma yin pa'i dngos po rnam par 'byed parüîΩbyed pa chos mi mthun pa'i nges pa skye bar go bar 'gyur ba lhur byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan no snyam pa 'di kho nas de las 'byed pa nyid du grub pa las yang smos pa ni ci nas kyang sgra'i byed pa med par de'i ngo bor nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de ngo bo ma yin pa'i dngos po rnam par 'byed par byed pa chos mi mthun pa'i nges pa skye bar go bar 'gyur ba lhur byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere thought ‚ÄúIt is different from that‚Äù establishes that it is differentiated from that. The statement ‚ÄúIt is not that‚Äù is for the sake of understanding that the ascertainment of a dissimilar instance arises through the experience of the nature of that object, differentiating it from things that are not that nature.

original: rim pa de ltar 'dug pa dang / ji ltar nyams su myong ba gzhan chos mi mthun pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa po des ni yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don spyi khyad par can dang ldan pa rnam pa gzhan las rnam par dbye bar bya ba gang yin pa deüîΩmngon du byas te /
analyzed: rim pa de ltar 'dug pa dang / ji ltar nyams su myong ba gzhan chos mi mthun pa nges pa dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa po des ni yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don spyi khyad par can dang ldan pa rnam pa gzhan las rnam par dbye bar bya ba gang yin pa de mngon du byas te /
translated: The order of the words is arranged in that way, and the one who understands the ascertainment of a dissimilar instance in accordance with the experience of that object, which possesses a special universal that possesses branches and so on, differentiates it from other aspects.üîΩThat object is actualized.

original: 'di kho na shing yin no zhes rab tu bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di kho na shing yin no zhes rab tu bstan nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThis alone is a tree.‚Äù

original: bye brag shes par byas shing brdar gzung ste /
analyzed: bye brag shes par byas shing brdar gzung ste /
translated: Having taught that, the difference is understood and the convention is apprehended.

original: gang kho na la brda dang mthun pa'i spyi'i bdag nyid de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par rang nyid kyis sgra'i byed pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang kho na la brda dang mthun pa'i spyi'i bdag nyid de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par rang nyid kyis sgra'i byed pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would understand that the tree is not that very thing which does not appear as the universal that is in accord with the convention.

original: de ltar na rang nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan las phye ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rang nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan las phye ste /
translated: Thus, one would distinguish it from other things by oneself.

original: nges par gzung ba'i spyi'i bdag nyid la brten nas brdar byas na gsal ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la brdar byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i spyi'i bdag nyid la brten nas brdar byas na gsal ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la brdar byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one makes a convention in dependence on a universal that is ascertained, then the convention would be made in regard to all similar instances.

original: spyi ni thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is subsequent to all.

original: 'dis kho na zhes nges par gzung bas brdar byas na mthong ba las zlog pa shes par sla ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa la shing ma yin no snyam pa'i nges pa 'byung bas ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dis kho na zhes nges par gzung bas brdar byas na mthong ba las zlog pa shes par sla ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa la shing ma yin no snyam pa'i nges pa 'byung bas ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If one makes a convention by ascertaining just this, then it is easy to understand the opposite of what is seen. Therefore, since the ascertainment that it is not a tree arises in regard to what is other than that, there is no fault as has been explained.

original: gal te gzhan sel bar smra ba la yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na rnam par gcod par smra ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel bar smra ba la yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na rnam par gcod par smra ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: If you say that the same is true of the theory of apoha, then we reply that the theory of exclusion is not like that, etc.

original: brda'i dus gcig na thun mong ma yin pa mthong ba'i ngo bo ni gang la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda'i dus gcig na thun mong ma yin pa mthong ba'i ngo bo ni gang la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of the convention, the nature of the perception of the uncommon is not seen in anything.

original: de bas na brda'i dus na shing yin no zhes de ltar gzung ba'i khyad par @133b gang yin pa de gzhan na mthong ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na brda'i dus na shing yin no zhes de ltar gzung ba'i khyad par @133b gang yin pa de gzhan na mthong ba med do //
translated: Therefore, at the time of the convention, the difference that is apprehended as ‚ÄúIt is a tree‚Äù is not seen elsewhere.

original: de la brda'i dus na mthong ba dang / phyis snang ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid la tha dad pa snang ba'i mthong ba skyes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyus shing dang shing ma yin pa dag rtogs par byed pa ni gsal ba gzhan la yang shing gi khyad par gzhan la yang de ltar shing yin noüîΩzhes bya bar rtogs par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la brda'i dus na mthong ba dang / phyis snang ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid la tha dad pa snang ba'i mthong ba skyes pa gang yin pa de'i rgyus shing dang shing ma yin pa dag rtogs par byed pa ni gsal ba gzhan la yang shing gi khyad par gzhan la yang de ltar shing yin noüîΩzhes bya bar rtogs par mi 'gyur te //
translated: At the time of the convention, the perception of the appearance of the specific property of the tree and the perception of the appearance of the difference in the later appearance of the specific property of the tree are produced by the same cause. The cause of the perception of the tree and the non-tree is the perception of the specific property of the tree at the time of the convention.üîΩThe perception of the specific property of the tree at the time of the convention is not the cause of the perception of the difference in the later appearance of the specific property of the tree.üîΩThe perception of the specific property of the tree at the time of the convention is not the cause of the perception of the difference in the later appearance of the specific property of the tree.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar brda'i dus na shing gi khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa de las bum pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ltar /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar brda'i dus na shing gi khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa de las bum pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ltar /
translated: Just as at the time of the convention, a particular tree is seen, and from that, a vase and so on, which are dissimilar characteristics,

original: shing gi khyad par gzhan yang de dang 'dra bas ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la shing yin no snyam pa'i rtogs pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du shing gi khyad par dag la yang mi 'byung gi /
analyzed: shing gi khyad par gzhan yang de dang 'dra bas ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la shing yin no snyam pa'i rtogs pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du shing gi khyad par dag la yang mi 'byung gi /
translated: are understood, so too, other particular trees are understood in the same way. Just as the thought ‚ÄúIt is a tree‚Äù does not arise with regard to a vase and so on, so too, it does not arise with regard to particular trees.

original: 'on kyang shing ma yin no snyam pa de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang shing ma yin no snyam pa de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, the thought ‚ÄúIt is not a tree‚Äù does arise. This is the meaning.

original: slob dpon gyis de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúIf that is so, then,‚Äù and so on.

original: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa'i lan 'di ni de la yang zhes bya ba gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i yul can gyi brdal yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa'i lan 'di ni de la yang zhes bya ba gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i yul can gyi brdal yang mtshungs so //
translated: This reply to the error of mutual dependence is the same for the convention that excludes other.

original: gcig rtogs zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rigs mthun pa rnams la rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig rtogs zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rigs mthun pa rnams la rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Understanding one‚Äù means the cognition of a single aspect with regard to similar types of manifestations.

original: gang la ming de skad ces bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la ming de skad ces bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is so-called exists as such.

original: 'dis ni gsal ba tha dad pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra bas gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsal ba tha dad pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra bas gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: This explains that, even with respect to different manifestations, one superimposes identity by way of the cognition of a single aspect, and by way of similarity in having a single effect.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i gsal ba rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig la brdar byas na thams cad la brdar byas par 'gyur bas 'di'i sa bon bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i gsal ba rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig la brdar byas na thams cad la brdar byas par 'gyur bas 'di'i sa bon bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since one would be making a convention with respect to any one of the manifestations that are superimposed as identical by conceptualization, one would be making a convention with respect to all of them. This is the explanation of the seed.

original: gcig la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gcig la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabiding in one‚Äù indicates the ascertainment of the aspect of the cognition, which is empty of the aspect of apprehending things of a different type.

original: dngos po rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam pa las log pas rigs mthun pa thams cad la gcig par rtogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam pa las log pas rigs mthun pa thams cad la gcig par rtogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cognition that, by excluding the aspects of dissimilar things, realizes all similar things as one is called ‚Äúabiding.‚Äù

original: 'dis kyang dngos po rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa rnam par 'byed pa'i sa bon bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dngos po rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa rnam par 'byed pa'i sa bon bshad do //
translated: This also explains the seed that distinguishes similar and dissimilar things.

original: de nyid de dang de min rgyu don rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba la @134a * //
analyzed: de nyid de dang de min rgyu don rnams // zhes bya ba la @134a * //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ‚Äúnot that‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: sogs pas ston te /
translated: This is taught by the verse that begins:

original: de zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtogs pa gcig bsdus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù includes a single realization.

original: de min zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de las bzlog pa'o /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de las bzlog pa'o /
translated: The word ‚Äúnot that‚Äù is the opposite of that.

original: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de min dag go //
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de min dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat and not that‚Äù are ‚Äúthat and not that.‚Äù

original: de dag gi rgyu rnams ni de dang de min rgyu ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu rnams ni de dang de min rgyu ste /
translated: The causes of those are ‚Äúthe causes of that and not that.‚Äù

original: de dag brda'i mdun rol du yang bdag nyid rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: de dag brda'i mdun rol du yang bdag nyid rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: Those distinguish themselves even before the convention.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa gcig gi rgyu de dang de las bzlog pa tha dad du 'byed do //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa gcig gi rgyu de dang de las bzlog pa tha dad du 'byed do //
translated: The cause of a single cognition that has the aspect of possessing branches, etc. is distinguished from that which is the opposite of that.

original: 'di ni gong du /
analyzed: 'di ni gong du /
translated: This has already been explained above,

original: gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa'i //
translated: in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe cognition of one thing is not the cognition of another,‚Äù

original: don gcig bsgrub la zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
analyzed: don gcig bsgrub la zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
translated: up to the passage, ‚Äúin order to accomplish a single purpose.‚Äù

original: spyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa bkag pa dang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis tha dad cing ngo bo nyid kho nas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa bkag pa dang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis tha dad cing ngo bo nyid kho nas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Since the denial of the difference and non-difference of universals has been refuted and will be refuted again, these things are different by intrinsic nature and have different characteristics by intrinsic identity.

original: kha cig kho nas byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig kho nas byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: One thing alone is the cause of a single effect, not another,

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis de dang de ma yin pa bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis de dang de ma yin pa bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are by intrinsic nature the generators of that and not that.

original: shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu chu ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu chu ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Cognition, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes water, the moon in water, etc.

original: rtogs pa po 'dis de la dngos po de rnams sgra'i byed pa med par bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye zhing bye brag tu phye nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'dis de la dngos po de rnams sgra'i byed pa med par bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye zhing bye brag tu phye nas /
translated: This cognizer, without the operation of words, by himself analyzes and differentiates those things.

original: de'i rgyu dang de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He understands their causes and their non-causes.

original: rtogs pa po de'i ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa po de'i ste /
translated: The cognizer'süîΩmind that is, the mind that, having differentiated the causes of that from its non-causes, posits the causes of that.

original: blo de la ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las de'i rgyu rnams rnam par phye nas 'jog par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni blo de ste /üîΩde la yod pa ni de la snang ba'o //
analyzed: blo de la ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las de'i rgyu rnams rnam par phye nas 'jog par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni blo de ste / de la yod pa ni de la snang ba'o //
translated: That which exists for that mind, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i rgyu nyid snang zhing mngon pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i rgyu nyid snang zhing mngon pa ste /
translated: That which appears and is evident as the cause of a conceptual mind.

original: 'og nas 'dra bar zhes 'byung ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu nyid 'dra bar snang ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'og nas 'dra bar zhes 'byung ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu nyid 'dra bar snang ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'i /
translated: Since the word similar will appear below, one should understand the appearance of a similar cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba de rnams rgyu nyid du ma yin te de rnams phyi rol na med pa'i phyir rtogs pa po de ltar lhag par zhen pa kho nas de skad du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba de rnams rgyu nyid du ma yin te de rnams phyi rol na med pa'i phyir rtogs pa po de ltar lhag par zhen pa kho nas de skad du bshad par zad do //
translated: Those appearances to thought are not the cause itself, because they do not exist externally. The thinker has only the excessive adherence to them, and so it is explained in that way.

original: rgyu min dngos po bral ba dang // zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'dra bar zhes bya ba dang / snang zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyu min dngos po bral ba dang // zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'dra bar zhes bya ba dang / snang zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the line ‚Äúfree from the thing that is not the cause,‚Äù the words ‚Äúlikewise‚Äù and ‚Äúappear‚Äù are to be supplied, as before.

original: gang dag rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i blo'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag gi ngo bo dang bral ba 'dra @134b bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i blo'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag gi ngo bo dang bral ba 'dra @134b bar snang ba'o //
translated: The appearances are free from the nature of those that are not the cause of the cognition that realizes them in one way.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya pa dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dang lhan cig ngo bo gcig pa 'dra bar te 'dir yang snang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya pa dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dang lhan cig ngo bo gcig pa 'dra bar te 'dir yang snang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because the appearances and the objects of investigation are made one, they are like the external ones, having the same nature. Here also, the word ‚Äúappear‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: brda'i 'og rol gyi dus su yang bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: brda'i 'og rol gyi dus su yang bdag nyid kyis /
translated: Even after the convention is established, the thing itself

original: dngos po de rnams de mi byed pa dag las /
analyzed: dngos po de rnams de mi byed pa dag las /
translated: is not produced from those that are not its cause.

original: tha dad par ni shes 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gzhan sel ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa la skad ces bya ba sgra sbyor zhing brdar 'dogs so //üîΩskad de las tha snyad kyi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i gzhan sel ba de rtogs shing khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i blo de ni 'khrul pas dngos po gcig ltar rtogs rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba de nyid phyi rol gyi gsal ba rigs
analyzed: tha dad par ni shes 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gzhan sel ba rigs mthun pa thams cad la gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa la skad ces bya ba sgra sbyor zhing brdar 'dogs so // skad de las tha snyad kyi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i gzhan sel ba de rtogs shing khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i blo de ni 'khrul pas dngos po gcig ltar rtogs rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba de nyid phyi rol gyi gsal ba rigs
translated: In order to make it known that they are different, the name ‚Äútree‚Äù is applied to all the exclusions of other that appear to the conceptual consciousness, and it is imputed to them as if they were the same.

original: mthun pa rnams la sgro btags nas dngos po gcig pa lta bur rtog go //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams la sgro btags nas dngos po gcig pa lta bur rtog go //
translated: When the convention is used, the mind that understands and comprehends the exclusion of other as it has been explained arises in error, as if it were a single thing. That conceptual consciousness appears to be a single thing, and it imputes that to all the similar external things.

original: de'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu thams cad la shing ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu thams cad la shing ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the cognition of a single thing is the cognition of all of them as ‚Äútree.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni mthong bas rtogs na ni gsal ba gzhan la yang de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong bas rtogs na ni gsal ba gzhan la yang de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de spangs pa yin te /
translated: This refutes the statement, ‚ÄúIf one understands by seeing, then one would not understand in that way with respect to another clear object.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las rnam par phye ba de'i rgyu rnams la gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i shing la brdar byas pa de'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin pa rnams ni shing ma yin no zhes bya bar bdag nyid kyis rtogs par
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las rnam par phye ba de'i rgyu rnams la gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i shing la brdar byas pa de'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin pa rnams ni shing ma yin no zhes bya bar bdag nyid kyis rtogs par
translated: Because of the fact that they are distinguished from those that are not its causes, one imputes the identity of cause to those that are its causes. Therefore, one understands by oneself that those that are not its causes are not the wood.

original: 'gyur ro // de bas na phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bas na phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of mutual dependence.

original: de rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: de rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston te /
translated: The meaning of the verses is taught by ‚Äúthose,‚Äù etc.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù means those that are distinguished from things that are not of the same type.

original: rang bzhin kho nas ngo bo nyid kyis yin gyi spyi gcig dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho nas ngo bo nyid kyis yin gyi spyi gcig dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are by their own nature, by their own essence, and not by possessing a single universal.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir dus thams cad du rtogs pa skyed par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir dus thams cad du rtogs pa skyed par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why then do they not always produce understanding?

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúdue to the power of conditions,‚Äù etc.

original: rkyen ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: Conditions are the cognitions of experience,

original: de'i sgo nas de dag la rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de dag la rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they generate the conceptual thoughts of those.

original: gcig tu rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rgyu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rgyu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: The causes of such conceptual thoughts, which have the nature of a single understanding, are subsequent.

original: ji ltar shing gi khyad par gcig rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i @135a * //
analyzed: ji ltar shing gi khyad par gcig rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i @135a * //
translated: Just as the particularities of a tree are the causes of a single conceptual thought by nature,

original: rgyu yin pa ltar gnyis pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bas rnam pa 'dis rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa ltar gnyis pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bas rnam pa 'dis rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: so too are the second and subsequent ones. Thus, they are subsequent by this aspect.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gcig cig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gcig cig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist as a single thing with a universal nature.

original: rjes su 'gro ba de'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba de'i phyir te /
translated: Because of that subsequent nature.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen par rung ba rnams kun du brtan nas zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen par rung ba rnams kun du brtan nas zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is ‚Äúhaving ascertained those that are suitable to be conceived as one due to having one effect.‚Äù

original: shes pa de yi rgyu nyid dang // zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang / de las gzhan pa las ldog pa rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa'i rgyu rnams las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa'i de lta bu'i rgyu ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag las ldog pas de lta bu ma yin yang ste /üîΩrnam par rtog pa la snang ba de dag ni phyi rol na med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa de yi rgyu nyid dang // zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang / de las gzhan pa las ldog pa rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa'i rgyu rnams las gzhan pa rnam par rtog pa'i de lta bu'i rgyu ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag las ldog pas de lta bu ma yin yang ste /üîΩrnam par rtog pa la snang ba de dag ni phyi rol na med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú The cause of that cognition‚Äù means the cause of the cognition that is different from that.üîΩ‚Äú The

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyang med da /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyang med da /
translated: Therefore, the absence of the nature of a non-cause also does not exist.

original: de dag dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those do not exist.

original: 'on kyang de lta bur lhag par zhen cing shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang de las gzhan pa la ldog par sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bur lhag par zhen cing shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang de las gzhan pa la ldog par sgro btags pa ste /
translated: However, there is the superimposition of the cause of that cognition and the exclusion of what is other than that.üîΩThis explains the statement:üîΩThe appearance as the cause of cognition,

original: 'dis ni / blo'i rgyu nyid du snang ba dang // rgyu min ngo bo bral ba dang // zhes bya ba rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni / blo'i rgyu nyid du snang ba dang // rgyu min ngo bo bral ba dang // zhes bya ba rnam par bshad do //
translated: and the absence of the nature of a non-cause.üîΩThose who do not distinguish between external and internal...

original: phyi dang nang gi khyad par rnam par ma phye ba can rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni ngo bo gcig 'drar zhes bya ba 'di bshad de /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi khyad par rnam par ma phye ba can rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni ngo bo gcig 'drar zhes bya ba 'di bshad de /
translated: This explains the statement: ...the same nature is imagined.

original: gang dag la phyi'i dang nang gi khyad par rnam par ma phye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang dag la phyi'i dang nang gi khyad par rnam par ma phye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase those who do not distinguish between external and internal is to be supplied.

original: snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba dag gcig tu byed pas gzung ba rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba dag gcig tu byed pas gzung ba rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they make appearances and what is to be imagined into one, they are called graspers. This is the meaning of the term.

original: gang gi ched du brdar bya ba'i rtogs pa po rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pa des rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na de'i rtogs pa ci 'dra ba ste /üîΩdngos po rgyu ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba rnam pa gcig cing ngo bo tha dad pa 'di dag la shing zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di brdar brtags pas de lta bas na 'di dag ni shing yin no snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can de'i
analyzed: gang gi ched du brdar bya ba'i rtogs pa po rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pa des rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na de'i rtogs pa ci 'dra ba ste / dngos po rgyu ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba rnam pa gcig cing ngo bo tha dad pa 'di dag la shing zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di brdar brtags pas de lta bas na 'di dag ni shing yin no snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can de'i
