translated: The one who creates the sign is a conceptual thought that is based on the realization of the sign.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúthat which follows the realization‚Äù means that at the time of the sign, the realization is of the form ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù which is a single aspect that is free of the nature of being a cause and is a different entity from the sign.üîΩTherefore, the conceptual thought that follows that realization and recalls it thinks, ‚ÄúThese are trees.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'brangs shing dran par byas nas tha snyad kyi dus na yang 'di @135b dag ni shing yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa'i sgo nas kyang ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po de dag rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu yin par de las ldog pa dag
analyzed: rjes su 'brangs shing dran par byas nas tha snyad kyi dus na yang 'di @135b dag ni shing yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa'i sgo nas kyang ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po de dag rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu yin par de las ldog pa dag
translated: At the time of the convention, the conceptual thought that thinks, ‚ÄúThese are trees,‚Äù is caused by the words ‚ÄúThese are trees.‚Äù

original: las tha dad par shes par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las tha dad cing rnam par gcod pa blo la snang ba'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa la brdar 'dogs pa po skad sbyor ro //
analyzed: las tha dad par shes par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las tha dad cing rnam par gcod pa blo la snang ba'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa la brdar 'dogs pa po skad sbyor ro //
translated: The one who makes the convention, thinking, ‚ÄúI will understand the difference of the action,‚Äù indicates the difference from that which is not its cause, and the exclusion, which is the characteristic of the appearance to the awareness, as explained above.

original: ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
translated: How does he make the convention?

original: rnag dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnag dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe pus and the other,‚Äù and so on.üîΩHaving indicated the object of the convention, which is the appearance as one aspect by the reason of error, which has the characteristic of producing one effect in the conceptual thought that understands the self and the other,

original: rang dang gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa la 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i brda'i yul kun tu bstan nas te ji ltar rtogs par byed pa po la de dang rigs mi mthun
analyzed: rang dang gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa la 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i brda'i yul kun tu bstan nas te ji ltar rtogs par byed pa po la de dang rigs mi mthun
translated: the one who makes the convention, thinking, ‚ÄúI will understand the difference of the action,‚Äù indicates the difference from that which is not its cause, and the exclusion, which is the characteristic of the appearance to the awareness, as explained above.

original: pa las log pa rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams la rnam pa gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba ltar rtogs par bya ba la yang de dang 'dra ba ji ltar sbyor bar byed pa po gcig
analyzed: pa las log pa rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams la rnam pa gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba ltar rtogs par bya ba la yang de dang 'dra ba ji ltar sbyor bar byed pa po gcig
translated: The reason for the arising of the thought that conceives of the many as one is the similarity of the aspects of the many that are the causes of the cognition of one aspect.

original: pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i sgo nas thams cad la brdar gdags so snyam du sems pa ltar rtogs pa po yang de kho na bzhin du sems so //
analyzed: pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i sgo nas thams cad la brdar gdags so snyam du sems pa ltar rtogs pa po yang de kho na bzhin du sems so //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the person is imputed to all things in the same way that the word is imputed to all things, by the superimposition of oneness.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni sgra las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni sgra las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the word.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnam par gcod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the exclusion of other.

original: sgra spyi dngos por gyur pa dang bral ba de kho na las rang bzhin gyis gcig byed pa'i don dmigs nas bdag nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas te /
analyzed: sgra spyi dngos por gyur pa dang bral ba de kho na las rang bzhin gyis gcig byed pa'i don dmigs nas bdag nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas te /
translated: Having observed the object that is the cause of the single nature of that word, which is devoid of the real universal, one should distinguish it from those that do not have that as their effect.

original: tshoms gnyis su rnam par 'jog par byed pas de'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: tshoms gnyis su rnam par 'jog par byed pas de'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Since the two collections are posited in dependence on each other, therefore there is no error of mutual dependence.

original: spyi dngos por gyur pa la brten nas shing dang shing ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi dngos por gyur pa la brten nas shing dang shing ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba ji ltar mi rung ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it is untenable to distinguish trees and non-trees in dependence on a real universal, he says:üîΩJust as a vase and so on are different from the particular trees, so too smoke and so on are different from each other.

original: ji ltar shing gi khyad par dag las bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa ltar shing du ba la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bas phan tshun tha dad pa de mthong yang spyi gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis gang la spyi 'di
analyzed: ji ltar shing gi khyad par dag las bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa ltar shing du ba la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra bas phan tshun tha dad pa de mthong yang spyi gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis gang la spyi 'di
translated: Although you see that they are different from each other, you see a universal in some and do not see it in others.

original: snang ba des ni shing yin la /
analyzed: snang ba des ni shing yin la /
translated: By that which sees the universal, that is a tree.üîΩBy that which does not see the universal, that is not a tree.

original: gang la mi snang ba de ni shing ma yin no zhes shing dang shing ma yin pa 'di rnam par dbye pa'i spyi dngos po ltar rung ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid nyid kyir gyur pa gcig ni med do /
analyzed: gang la mi snang ba de ni shing ma yin no zhes shing dang shing ma yin pa 'di rnam par dbye pa'i spyi dngos po ltar rung ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid nyid kyir gyur pa gcig ni med do /
translated: Thus it is not tenable that there is a single universal that is a real entity, the characteristic of which is the observation of that which is suitable to be distinguished as trees and non-trees.

original: @136a * // ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: @136a * // ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is it not?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat is not so, etc.‚Äù

original: spyi tha dad pa ni yal ga la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa ni yal ga la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: A different universal is not apprehended as different from the appearance of branches, etc.

original: shing la sogs pa la blo ya la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gcig dang / yal ga la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa cig shos dang gnyis su snang ba ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa la blo ya la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gcig dang / yal ga la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa cig shos dang gnyis su snang ba ni mi dmigs so //
translated: The cognition of a tree, etc., does not appear in two ways, as having the aspect of branches, etc., and as not having the aspect of branches, etc.

original: khar ba thogs pa la khar ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: khar ba thogs pa la khar ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: Like a stick-holder with a stick, etc. is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: ji ltar khar ba thogs pa la khar ba tha dad par 'dzin pa ltar spyi ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khar ba thogs pa la khar ba tha dad par 'dzin pa ltar spyi ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Just as a stick-holder is apprehended as different from a stick, a universal is not like that.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par gzhan las tha dad par ma bzung ba'i spyi yang gsal ba rnams la mi mngon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par gzhan las tha dad par ma bzung ba'i spyi yang gsal ba rnams la mi mngon pa'i phyir te /
translated: A universal is not apprehended as different from another particular that possesses branches, etc., because the universal is not manifest in the particulars.

original: gzhan zhig rang gi ngo bor dmigs pa ni mngon pa yin na de yang bdag nyid du ma bzung ba la ji ltar yod par 'gyur spyi don gzhan ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang /
analyzed: gzhan zhig rang gi ngo bor dmigs pa ni mngon pa yin na de yang bdag nyid du ma bzung ba la ji ltar yod par 'gyur spyi don gzhan ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang /
translated: If the other is observed as its own nature, it is manifest. But how could it exist without being grasped as the self?

original: rnam pa gsal ba'i gcig la mthong ba yang rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na dang 'dra bar gsal pa'i khyad par gzhan la blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsal ba'i gcig la mthong ba yang rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na dang 'dra bar gsal pa'i khyad par gzhan la blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even according to the view that the universal is not a different object, since the single appearance is not different from its own characteristic, it is not possible to see another distinct appearance that is just like that.

original: de bas na tha snyad kyi dus na 'dra ba gcig cig mthong ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ni shing yin la de ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni shing ma yin no zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad kyi dus na 'dra ba gcig cig mthong ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa ni shing yin la de ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni shing ma yin no zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, at the time of convention, whatever is seen as a single similarity is a tree if it possesses that, and it is not a tree if it does not possess that.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid na gsal ba gcig kho na zhes bya ba brda'i dus nas mthong ba kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid na gsal ba gcig kho na zhes bya ba brda'i dus nas mthong ba kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since a tree and a non-tree are respectively just a single appearance, only what is seen from the time of the convention becomes a tree.

original: tha snyad kyi dus na snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an appearance at the time of convention.

original: brda'i dus na snang ba'i rnam pa gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda'i dus na snang ba'i rnam pa gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the sign, the aspect of appearance does not appear as another.

original: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba la gzhan dag gis ma khyab pa nyid du gleng ba gang yin pa de yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba la gzhan dag gis ma khyab pa nyid du gleng ba gang yin pa de yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
translated: In order to completely abandon the non-pervasion by others of the exclusion of other in terms of the meaning of words,

original: re zhig phyogs snga ma phyogs tsam zhig dgod par bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad dang / ril dang brjod bya dang / gzhal bya zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: re zhig phyogs snga ma phyogs tsam zhig dgod par bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad dang / ril dang brjod bya dang / gzhal bya zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams bsdu'o //
translated: he states, ‚ÄúFirst, in order to set forth the mere position of the opponent,‚Äù and so on. The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the words ‚Äúall,‚Äù ‚Äúeverything,‚Äù ‚Äúthe expressed,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe object of comprehension.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de dag la don gzhan rnam par gcod pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag la don gzhan rnam par gcod pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no exclusion of other objects in those?

original: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni shes bya @136b ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni shes bya @136b ma yin pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what‚Äù means from the object of knowledge.

original: gal te ci'i phyir shes bya ma yin pa med ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir shes bya ma yin pa med ce na /
translated: If it is asked why the object of knowledge does not exist,

original: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFrom that,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par gcod par smra bas ni shes bya ma yin pa las shes bya tha dad par yul du byed par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcod par smra bas ni shes bya ma yin pa las shes bya tha dad par yul du byed par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: The proponents of exclusion must accept that the object of comprehension is made an object by being differentiated from the nonobject of comprehension.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ji ltar shes bya ma yin pa la shes bya rnam par gcod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ji ltar shes bya ma yin pa la shes bya rnam par gcod /
translated: Otherwise, how could the object of comprehension be excluded from the nonobject of comprehension?

original: des na shes bya ma yin pa las shes bya tha dad par yul du byed pa nyid kyis shes bya ma yin par 'dod pa de shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na shes bya ma yin pa las shes bya tha dad par yul du byed pa nyid kyis shes bya ma yin par 'dod pa de shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension is asserted to be an object of comprehension by virtue of being made an object by being differentiated from the nonobject of comprehension, because it is an object of comprehension,

original: yul du ma byas pa las rnam par gcod pa bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa las rnam par gcod pa bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not possible to teach exclusion from that which is not made an object.

original: de ni nyes pa med de 'di ltar the tshom dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i blo'i the tshom can don 'ga' las rnam par bzlog nas blo de nyid rnam par nges pa'i don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir ston par byed pa pos sgra 'ga' zhig rab tu sbyorüîΩbar byed do //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de 'di ltar the tshom dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i blo'i the tshom can don 'ga' las rnam par bzlog nas blo de nyid rnam par nges pa'i don 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir ston par byed pa pos sgra 'ga' zhig rab tu sbyorüîΩbar byed do //
translated: That is not a fault because in this way, the speaker, having reversed the mind of a person who has doubt about some object, engages that very mind in some object of ascertained meaning, and therefore the speaker applies some term.

original: 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bshad la /üîΩ'ga' las rnam par ldog nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bshad la / 'ga' las rnam par ldog nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
translated: The phrase because it engages some explains concomitance.üîΩ The phrase having turned away from some explains the counter-pervasion.

original: ci'i phyir sgra 'ga' zhig las bzlog pas 'ga' zhig la 'jug par byed kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra 'ga' zhig las bzlog pas 'ga' zhig la 'jug par byed kyi /
translated: Why does it engage some by turning away from some?

original: sgrub pa kho nas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa kho nas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established by mere affirmation?

original: de'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, Because of the meaning of that...

original: sgra'i don nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i don nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the word is ascertained.

original: gzhan du na ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na ste /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te sgra des 'ga' yang rnam par gcod par mi byed na sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra des 'ga' yang rnam par gcod par mi byed na sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if that word does not eliminate anything, the use of the word would be pointless.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad dang ril zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad dang ril zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bsdu'o //
translated: Because that is so, therefore, the phrase therefore, that... and so on. The phrase and so on includes words such as all and entire.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: tha snyad du ni gtogs rnams la'ang //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni gtogs rnams la'ang //
translated: Even conventionally, for those included,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩtha snyad ni sgras bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / tha snyad ni sgras bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: He says:

original: de'i don du gtogs pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: de'i don du gtogs pa rnams la ste /
translated: Convention is the characteristic of affirmation and negation by means of words.üîΩIt belongs to the referents of words,

original: 'jig rten pa'i sbyor ba la gnas te rnams la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sbyor ba la gnas te rnams la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is based on worldly usage.

original: tha snyad kyis na yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa de dag la rnam par gcod pa ni 'ga' zhig yod do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyis na yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa de dag la rnam par gcod pa ni 'ga' zhig yod do //
translated: Conventionally, there is a division of those things called ‚Äúparts,‚Äù etc.

original: sgra rab tu sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad @137a * //üîΩpar byed de /
analyzed: sgra rab tu sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad @137a * // par byed de /
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúThe application of words, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad la ni skyes bu'am 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa po'o //
analyzed: thams cad la ni skyes bu'am 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa po'o //
translated: The person or the worldly thinker is in all cases.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'da' zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'da' zhe na /
translated: Why is it not transcended?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚ÄúThat, etc.‚Äù

original: sgra de'i 'bras bu ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin pa'i phyir te 'ga' zhig las bzlog nas 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra de'i 'bras bu ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin pa'i phyir te 'ga' zhig las bzlog nas 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the result of that word is engagement and disengagement, i.e., the meaning is that it is the engagement in some after turning away from some.

original: de lta ma yin na sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgra sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the application of the word would be pointless.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsmra ba po 'dis bstan par bya ba 'ga'i blo yang mi 'dod pa 'ga' las kyang ldog par mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / smra ba po 'dis bstan par bya ba 'ga'i blo yang mi 'dod pa 'ga' las kyang ldog par mi byed pa'am /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúIf one says, ‚ÄòThis is not that‚Äô . . .‚ÄùüîΩThis speaker does not assert any object of expression, and he does not cause anyone to turn away from anything.

original: de las bzlog nas kyang 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du snang pa'i phyir te /üîΩsgras ni ji ltar sgra sbyor ba'i sngon rol na rtogs pa po la don la the tshom za ba'i ngo bo yod pa de lta bur snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las bzlog nas kyang 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du snang pa'i phyir te / sgras ni ji ltar sgra sbyor ba'i sngon rol na rtogs pa po la don la the tshom za ba'i ngo bo yod pa de lta bur snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúIf one does not assert that the object of expression is the referent of the cognition, nor does one negate that it is other than that, nor does one affirm that it is that, then at that time, it appears just as it is.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that the object appears to the one who understands just as the word is applied.

original: don ci 'dra bar yang rung bar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don ci 'dra bar yang rung bar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is, it appears as if it were any kind of object.

original: tha snyad thams cad la tshig 'ga' yang tha snyad gdags shing brjod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad la tshig 'ga' yang tha snyad gdags shing brjod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not designate any term for any object, then one will not express any term.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra'i tha snyad ni nges par gzung ba med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad ni nges par gzung ba med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the designation of a term is not possible without the ascertainment of the referent.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For example, etc.

original: 'dir chu 'on cig ces bya ba 'dis byed pa tsam 'phangs pa la byed pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bum pa zhes bya ba brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir chu 'on cig ces bya ba 'dis byed pa tsam 'phangs pa la byed pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bum pa zhes bya ba brjod de /
translated: Here, when one is told to bring water, the mere act is implied, and in order to understand the particular agent, the word pot is used.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni snyim pa la sogs pa rnam par gcad pas rnam par nges pa'i don la blo skyed par byed na 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni snyim pa la sogs pa rnam par gcad pas rnam par nges pa'i don la blo skyed par byed na 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word pot produces an understanding of the object as qualified by the exclusion of the winnowing basket, etc., then it will have an effect.

original: gal te bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if the word pot is used,

original: gzhan rnam par gcad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir bum pa dang snyim pas zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshon par zad de /
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir bum pa dang snyim pas zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshon par zad de /
translated: the phrase pot and winnowing basket is merely illustrative, because it is not intended to exclude the others.

original: de bzhin du byed pa gzhan gyis chu len pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa gzhan gyis chu len pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: In the same way, the bringing of water by another is also included.

original: ci 'dra yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni chu'i tshad nyung ngu mang po zhes bya ba de la mi ltos par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci 'dra yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni chu'i tshad nyung ngu mang po zhes bya ba de la mi ltos par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Whatever it may be is synonymous with not depending on the amount of water, whether little or much.

original: chu zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gal te las gzhan rnam par gcod pa las khyad par can la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: chu zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gal te las gzhan rnam par gcod pa las khyad par can la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no /
translated: The word ‚Äúwater‚Äù also, if it does not cause one to understand a particular by the exclusion of other actions,

original: de'i tshe de sbyor ba yang don med pas de bzhin du zhes bya ba la @137b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de sbyor ba yang don med pas de bzhin du zhes bya ba la @137b sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the addition of ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on is meaningless.

original: 'on cig ces bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on cig ces bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would only say ‚Äúbring.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind?

original: byed pa dang las ma 'phangs pa can te 'on cig bya ba 'di tsam gyi tshig gang la byed pa bum pa zhes bya ba dang las chu zhes bya ba ma 'phangs shing bye brag tu ma brten pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang las ma 'phangs pa can te 'on cig bya ba 'di tsam gyi tshig gang la byed pa bum pa zhes bya ba dang las chu zhes bya ba ma 'phangs shing bye brag tu ma brten pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has an action and object not specified, that is, that which has the mere words ‚Äúbring‚Äù and does not specify the action, ‚Äúpot,‚Äù and the object, ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du khyer te mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyer te mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: Similarly, one would not say ‚Äúbring thus.‚Äù

original: byed pa gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i skyes bu la /
analyzed: byed pa gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i skyes bu la /
translated: Or, if a person is occupied with another action,

original: gal te 'on cig ces bya ba 'dis khyer mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: gal te 'on cig ces bya ba 'dis khyer mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: one would not say ‚Äúbring thus‚Äù if he would not bring it.

original: byed pa gzhan rnam par gcod par mi byed na 'on cig ces bya ba yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa gzhan rnam par gcod par mi byed na 'on cig ces bya ba yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: If it does not exclude other activities, then one should not say ‚Äúbring it.‚Äù

original: de bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúSimilarly, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba 'on cig ces bya bas zas la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la rung bsgrub par bya ba yin pa gzhan cung zad cig ces bya ba 'bad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / blang bar bya ba ma yin pa ril yin par 'dod par gyur na ni de'i tshe byed pa'i tshig 'on cig ces bya ba yang brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba 'on cig ces bya bas zas la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la rung bsgrub par bya ba yin pa gzhan cung zad cig ces bya ba 'bad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / blang bar bya ba ma yin pa ril yin par 'dod par gyur na ni de'i tshe byed pa'i tshig 'on cig ces bya ba yang brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object to be accomplished, such as food, is to be accomplished by the word ‚Äúbring,‚Äù and if it is held that there is some other object to be accomplished that is not to be accomplished, that is, that is not to be striven for and not to be taken up, then at that time the word ‚Äúbring‚Äù would not be used.

original: de lta bas na bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra tha snyad du 'dogs pa rnams la rnam par gcod pa yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra tha snyad du 'dogs pa rnams la rnam par gcod pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, in the case of the conventional designations of such words as ‚Äúpot,‚Äù there is exclusion.

original: de dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra tha snyad du 'dogs pa rnams la yang rnam par gcad par bya ba shes bya ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la ji lta ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra tha snyad du 'dogs pa rnams la yang rnam par gcad par bya ba shes bya ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the case of expressions such as ‚Äúin that way,‚Äù etc., there would be some object of negation, such as ‚Äúnot an object of knowledge,‚Äù etc.

original: gzhan du dogs pa med pa na sbyor ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bya ma yin pa nyid la sogs par dogs pa ni gzhan du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du dogs pa med pa na sbyor ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bya ma yin pa nyid la sogs par dogs pa ni gzhan du dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not possible to apply a qualifier to something that is not suspected of being something else‚Äù means that the suspicion of being an object of knowledge, etc. is the suspicion of being something else.

original: de med par ni gzhan du dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de med par ni gzhan du dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout that‚Äù means without the suspicion of being something else.

original: shes bya ma yin pa nyid du dogs pa med na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bya ma yin pa nyid du dogs pa med na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the suspicion of being an object of knowledge‚Äù means without the suspicion of being an object of knowledge, etc.

original: 'di ltar sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor shes bya yin no zhes bya ba la the tshom za ba la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di rab tu sbyor ba de la ni mi rtag pa la
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor shes bya yin no zhes bya ba la the tshom za ba la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di rab tu sbyor ba de la ni mi rtag pa la
translated: Thus, when there is doubt about the nature of sound, such as whether it is impermanent, etc., and one applies the qualifier ‚Äúan object of knowledge‚Äù to it, then one applies the qualifier ‚Äúan object of knowledge‚Äù to the impermanent, etc.

original: sogs pa'i rnam par shes bya ma yin pa nyid du the tshom za ba gang yin pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //üîΩde bzhin du chos thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes bya yin no @138a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rnam par shes bya ma yin pa nyid du the tshom za ba gang yin pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no // de bzhin du chos thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes bya yin no @138a * //
translated: and so on, that is, the doubt that they are not objects of knowledge, is what is to be eliminated.

original: zhes bya ba de dag la yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la ltos nas shes bya ma yin pa nyid du the tshom tha ba gang yin pa de nyid du rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag la yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la ltos nas shes bya ma yin pa nyid du the tshom tha ba gang yin pa de nyid du rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, with regard to the statement, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are objects of knowledge of an omniscient one,‚Äù the doubt that they are not objects of knowledge in reliance on the wisdom of an omniscient one is what is to be eliminated.

original: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig na re dngos po med pa ni med pa'i phyir de la shes pa 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig na re dngos po med pa ni med pa'i phyir de la shes pa 'jug pa med do //
translated: Similarly, some say, ‚ÄúSince a non-thing does not exist, there is no engagement of consciousness in it.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni shes bya ma yin no zhes zer ba de la yang shes bya ma yin pa nyid du sgro btags pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni shes bya ma yin no zhes zer ba de la yang shes bya ma yin pa nyid du sgro btags pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not objects of knowledge.‚Äù In that case, the superimposition that they are not objects of knowledge is what is to be eliminated.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu kho nar med pa yang yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu kho nar med pa yang yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not exist‚Äù is also taken as an object in the same way.

original: de bzhin du shes bya'i sgra sbyor ba gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya'i sgra sbyor ba gzhan la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The same should be said of the other uses of the word j√±eya, the object of knowledge.

original: gzhal bya'i sgra la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i sgra la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the word prameya, the object of valid cognition.

original: yang de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba 'di la yang kha cig gis thams cad ma yin pa skad cig ma nyid du brtags kyi /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba 'di la yang kha cig gis thams cad ma yin pa skad cig ma nyid du brtags kyi /
translated: In the same way, when it is said that all formations are momentary, some imagine that not all are momentary,

original: thams cad ni ma yin pa de rnam par gcad par 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin pa de rnam par gcad par 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: so in order to eliminate that, it is said that all formations are momentary.üîΩIn the same way, when it is said that all have come or that all have arrived,

original: de bzhin du ci 'ga' zhig 'ongs sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci 'ga' zhig 'ongs sam /
translated: some doubt whether all have come or arrived.

original: thams cad lhags snyam du the tshom za ba la grod ba thams cad lhags so zhes bya bas /üîΩ'ga' zhig kho na'i lhags pa la the tshom za ba gang yin pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad lhags snyam du the tshom za ba la grod ba thams cad lhags so zhes bya bas /üîΩ'ga' zhig kho na'i lhags pa la the tshom za ba gang yin pa de nyid rnam par gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to eliminate that doubt, it is said that all have come or that all have arrived.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i sgra tha snyad du gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang skabs kyi dbang gis ci rigs par rnam par gcad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i sgra tha snyad du gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang skabs kyi dbang gis ci rigs par rnam par gcad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in the case of other sounds that are conventionally included in sound, exclusion should be expressed in the appropriate manner, depending on the context.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i zla bo dngos por gyur pa zhig tshoms gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas gzhan sel ba'i sgras brjod do zhe bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni blo tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i zla bo dngos por gyur pa zhig tshoms gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas gzhan sel ba'i sgras brjod do zhe bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the summary is not that a thing that is the counterpart of what is apprehended by a different cognition is posited in two collections and is expressed by the word exclusion of other.

original: 'on kyang nyan pa pos de lta bu ma yin pa la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa de yang sgras rnam par gcad par bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan pa pos de lta bu ma yin pa la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa de yang sgras rnam par gcad par bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: However, that which is superimposed by the hearer in the form of that which is not so is also just what is to be excluded by the word.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says, ‚ÄúIn that regard,‚Äù and so on.

original: bstan par bya ba blo gros rmongs pa'i gnas gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba blo gros rmongs pa'i gnas gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúthat which is to be indicated‚Äù and so on are not to be negated.

original: gal te nyan pa po ni 'ga' la yang the tshom med pa kho @138b na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa po ni 'ga' la yang the tshom med pa kho @138b na'o zhe na /
translated: If the listener is not at all doubtful,

original: 'on te dogs pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te dogs pa med na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then why does the speaker need to rely on the advice of others?

original: gal te 'di 'ga' la yang dogs pa med cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nges pa dang ldan pa yin na ni de'i tshe smra ba po gzhan gyis gdams pa la ca zhig ltos par 'gyur te mi 'gyur kho na'i snyam du bsams pa yin no
analyzed: gal te 'di 'ga' la yang dogs pa med cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nges pa dang ldan pa yin na ni de'i tshe smra ba po gzhan gyis gdams pa la ca zhig ltos par 'gyur te mi 'gyur kho na'i snyam du bsams pa yin no
translated: If the listener is not at all doubtful and is endowed with certainty that is in accordance with reality, then at that time, why does the speaker need to rely on the advice of others? He does not need to. This is the idea.

original: // nyan pa po'i 'byang bar byed pa ni the tshom sel ba'o //
analyzed: // nyan pa po'i 'byang bar byed pa ni the tshom sel ba'o //
translated: The listener‚Äôs purification is the removal of doubt.

original: tshig gang la de med pa de ni nyan pa po'i 'byang bar byed pa med pa can te /
analyzed: tshig gang la de med pa de ni nyan pa po'i 'byang bar byed pa med pa can te /
translated: That statement which lacks that is a statement that lacks the listener‚Äôs purification.

original: tshig de lta bu smra ba'i smra ba po yang ltar smyon pa ma yin pa 'gyur ba de lta bas na smra ba po ni nyan pa po the tshom dang ldan pa byang bar bya ba kho nar 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: tshig de lta bu smra ba'i smra ba po yang ltar smyon pa ma yin pa 'gyur ba de lta bas na smra ba po ni nyan pa po the tshom dang ldan pa byang bar bya ba kho nar 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The speaker who makes such a statement is not a speaker who is not insane. Therefore, the speaker, desiring to purify the listener who has doubt, connects the statement.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de 'byang bar bya ba kho na'i phyir nyan pa po 'byang bar bya ba kho na'i phyir sgra rnams brdar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dag la gnas pa tha snyad kyi don du gtogs pa rnams la ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam
analyzed: de 'byang bar bya ba kho na'i phyir nyan pa po 'byang bar bya ba kho na'i phyir sgra rnams brdar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dag la gnas pa tha snyad kyi don du gtogs pa rnams la ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam
translated: Because they are only to be mastered, sounds are conventionally designated for the sake of only mastering the listeners.üîΩThe words ‚Äúbecause they are only to be mastered‚Äù and so on are used.

original: par gcod pa yod grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras tha snyad du gtogs pa ma yin pa yan gar ba gang dag yin pa de dag la go ji ltar yod de de dag la ni rtogs pa po'i dogs pa'i gnas med do zhe na zhesüîΩbya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: par gcod pa yod grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras tha snyad du gtogs pa ma yin pa yan gar ba gang dag yin pa de dag la go ji ltar yod de de dag la ni rtogs pa po'i dogs pa'i gnas med do zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If the words that belong to the domain of conventional expressions have the exclusion that has been explained, then how can the words ‚Äúif the words that belong to the domain of conventional expressions have the exclusion that has been explained‚Äù and so on, which do not belong to the domain of conventional expressions, have it?üîΩThere is no basis for the doubt of the one who understands.

original: ngag rnams kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ngag rnams kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚ÄúThere is no expressive sound that is not included among the statements‚Äù is as follows.

original: sgra rnams ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis don dang ldan par shes la /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis don dang ldan par shes la /
translated: It is known that sounds have meaning by the power of application.

original: sbyor ba yang dag la gnas pa rnams kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba yang dag la gnas pa rnams kho na'i yin no //
translated: And application belongs only to those who abide in the truth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: ngag tu gtogs pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngag tu gtogs pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words in the domain of speech and so on are stated.

original: de kho na la don yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩbrda sprod pa pa rnams tshar dag gi nang du thams cad dang ril ces bya ba la sogs pa 'don pa'am /
analyzed: de kho na la don yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no // brda sprod pa pa rnams tshar dag gi nang du thams cad dang ril ces bya ba la sogs pa 'don pa'am /
translated: The thought is that because it has a meaning in reality.üîΩThe grammarians purify the internal structure of a verse by reciting sarva, sarva and so on, or by the analysis of the basic elements and the conditions.

original: gzhi po dang rkyen rnam par dbye bas sal gyis dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du nges pa'i tshig gi byed pa rnams sal gyis dag par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ba men ri mor bris pa lta bur tshig la gnas pa rnams kho na'i rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yin par blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: gzhi po dang rkyen rnam par dbye bas sal gyis dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du nges pa'i tshig gi byed pa rnams sal gyis dag par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ba men ri mor bris pa lta bur tshig la gnas pa rnams kho na'i rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yin par blta bar bya'i /
translated: And the purification of the functions of verbal derivation is also to be regarded as a means of understanding only for those who are attached to words, like a drawing on the surface of the water.

original: de dag la 'jig rten pa'i don ni 'ga' yang med do //üîΩde lta bas @139a * //
analyzed: de dag la 'jig rten pa'i don ni 'ga' yang med do // de lta bas @139a * //
translated: But they have no worldly meaning at all.

original: na ngag la gnas pa'i tshig gi don dag kho na don dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: na ngag la gnas pa'i tshig gi don dag kho na don dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words in the domain of speech is meaningful.

original: de kho na la gnas pa rnams kyi don sems par byed do //
analyzed: de kho na la gnas pa rnams kyi don sems par byed do //
translated: One should reflect on the meaning of those who are attached to reality.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúThose who do not rely on speech, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ngag la gnas pa gang dag yin pa ste sbyor ba'i yul bsam par bya ba la sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ngag la gnas pa gang dag yin pa ste sbyor ba'i yul bsam par bya ba la sgra'i don ni gzhan sel ba zhes brjod de /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to those who do not rely on speech. The object of application is the object of thought. The meaning of the term is the exclusion of other.

original: shes bya la sogs pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba la mi gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don mi srid pa'i phyir bsam pa nyid kyang med pas /
analyzed: shes bya la sogs pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba la mi gnas pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don mi srid pa'i phyir bsam pa nyid kyang med pas /
translated: Those who do not rely on the application of terms such as ‚Äúobject of knowledge,‚Äù etc., do not even have thoughts because the object is impossible.

original: sbyor ba bstan pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan pa med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe demonstration of application is not, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sbyor ba yang yin la de bzhin du bstan pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin par byas nas phyis med pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba yang yin la de bzhin du bstan pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin par byas nas phyis med pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: Since it is both an application and a demonstration in that way, having taken the affix, later it is connected with ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba smos pa med pa la shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra dag tu nye bar ma sbyar ba yan gar ba'i don ci yin zhes 'dri ba ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba smos pa med pa la shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra dag tu nye bar ma sbyar ba yan gar ba'i don ci yin zhes 'dri ba ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The question is: ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòobject of knowledge,‚Äô which is not applied to the term ‚Äòapplication‚Äô but is used alone?‚Äù

original: gal te ci'i phyir shes bya'i sgra yan gar ba la don med ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir shes bya'i sgra yan gar ba la don med ce na /
translated: If one asks why the term ‚Äúobject of knowledge‚Äù by itself has no meaning,

original: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause of that,‚Äù etc.

original: shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra de las dngos po 'ga' la yang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra de las dngos po 'ga' la yang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that term ‚Äúobject of knowledge,‚Äù there is no understanding of any thing.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i 'bras bu can gyi tha snyad la shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar ba sbyor ba med pa'i phyir de las don rtogs pa lta zhig ga la yod /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i 'bras bu can gyi tha snyad la shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar ba sbyor ba med pa'i phyir de las don rtogs pa lta zhig ga la yod /
translated: Since the term ‚Äúobject of knowledge‚Äù by itself is not used in conventions that have the effect of affirming or negating, how can there be understanding of the meaning from that?

original: gang gi tshe sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor shes bya yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor shes bya yin nam /
translated: When there is a context such as ‚ÄúIs sound impermanent, etc., an object of knowledge or not?‚Äù

original: 'on te shes bya ma yin pas zhes bya ba de lta bu'i skabs su shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar du sbyor ba de'i tshe yang don rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i sgra la sogs pa'i tshig skabs su bab pa la ltos te /
analyzed: 'on te shes bya ma yin pas zhes bya ba de lta bu'i skabs su shes bya zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar du sbyor ba de'i tshe yang don rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i sgra la sogs pa'i tshig skabs su bab pa la ltos te /
translated: or ‚ÄúIs it an object of knowledge or not?‚Äù even when the term ‚Äúobject of knowledge‚Äù is used by itself, the understanding of the meaning occurs only in dependence on the words, etc., of the context.

original: yin pas dag kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin pas dag kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it occurs only in those.

original: tshig gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshig ni ngag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshig ni ngag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a word is speech that is uttered together with other words.

original: de lta bas na tshig gzhan la mi ltos pa'i tshig yan gar ba las ni don rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshig gzhan la mi ltos pa'i tshig yan gar ba las ni don rtogs pa med do //
translated: Thus, the meaning is not understood from a word that is uttered alone, without regard to other words.

original: ji ltar shes bya la sogs pa'i tshig yan gar ba rnams la brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang med pa ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra yan gar ba rnams la yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩci bum pas chu blangs sam /üîΩ'on te snyim pas zhes bya ba'i skabs su bum pas so zhes rab tu sbyar ba @139b de la skabs shes pa dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa'i rtogs pa po des kyang bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar ba thos pa las bum pa'i rnam par
analyzed: ji ltar shes bya la sogs pa'i tshig yan gar ba rnams la brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang med pa ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra yan gar ba rnams la yang de dang 'dra'o // ci bum pas chu blangs sam / 'on te snyim pas zhes bya ba'i skabs su bum pas so zhes rab tu sbyar ba @139b de la skabs shes pa dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa'i rtogs pa po des kyang bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yan gar ba thos pa las bum pa'i rnam par
translated: Just as the words ‚Äúknowable,‚Äù etc., uttered alone have no meaning, so also the words ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc., uttered alone have no meaning.

original: rtog pa 'byung ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtog pa 'byung ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: In the context of the question, ‚ÄúDid the pot take the water or did the cupped hands take the water?‚Äù when the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is used, is it not the case that the hearer who does not understand the context understands the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù alone and then thinks, ‚ÄúThe pot took the water‚Äù?

original: gal te yan gar ba la don med na de'i tshe thos pa las ji ltar don rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te yan gar ba la don med na de'i tshe thos pa las ji ltar don rtogs she na /
translated: If a word has no meaning when uttered alone, then how is the meaning understood from hearing it?

original: skabs 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skabs 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In some cases, etc.

original: rtogs pa gang la shes par 'dod pa'i don de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yod pa de ni de'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pa can yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang la shes par 'dod pa'i don de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yod pa de ni de'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pa can yin no //
translated: That understanding which has the object that is desired to be known, but which is not complete, is one that has an incomplete object.

original: ji ltar de ni don yongs su ma rdzogs pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ni don yongs su ma rdzogs pa can yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it has an incomplete object?

original: sbyor ba mthong ba'i yul gyi rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthong ba'i yul gyi rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it follows the perception of the application,‚Äù etc.üîΩAs much as the speech that is engaged in the discussion of the activity of carrying away and bringing back, etc.,

original: phar khyer ba dang tshur khyer ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gleng ba la zhugs pa'i ngag ji snyed pa des bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba mthong ba de'i rjes su 'brang bas ngag gi don snga ma de snyed las rtog pa the tshom dang ldanüîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phar khyer ba dang tshur khyer ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gleng ba la zhugs pa'i ngag ji snyed pa des bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba mthong ba de'i rjes su 'brang bas ngag gi don snga ma de snyed las rtog pa the tshom dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: that much is the perception of the application of the word pot. Because it follows that, the understanding of the meaning of the speech is doubtful, up to that much.üîΩHow is that?

original: ji don 'di brjod par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ji don 'di brjod par 'dod dam /
translated: Is this the meaning that is desired to be expressed?

original: 'on te ci don 'di yin zhes de ltar the tshom dang bcas pa'i phyir gtol med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don ma rdzogs pa tsam yin pas bslang ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ci don 'di yin zhes de ltar the tshom dang bcas pa'i phyir gtol med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don ma rdzogs pa tsam yin pas bslang ba kho na yin te /
translated: But if it is incomplete because it is merely incomplete in meaning, since it is of the nature of being unintelligible due to having doubt, i.e., ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of this?,‚Äù then it is only a misperception.

original: 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is only a mistake.

original: 'di skad du sgra yan gar ba las thos pa tsam las don rtogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du sgra yan gar ba las thos pa tsam las don rtogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúThere is no understanding of the meaning from merely hearing a bare word.

original: 'on kyang gang la dmigs pa'i tshig don dang ldan pa dang 'dra bas blo phrag pa can la sgra yan gar ba thos pa las don rtogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang la dmigs pa'i tshig don dang ldan pa dang 'dra bas blo phrag pa can la sgra yan gar ba thos pa las don rtogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, for those with a biased mind, the conceit arises that they understand the meaning from hearing a bare word, since it is similar to a word that has a meaning that is observed.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sbyor ba mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig yan gar ba thos pa las don rtogs pa bslad pa de 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra la yang ji ltar mthong ba las ji ltar sbyor ba dmigs pa
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor ba mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig yan gar ba thos pa las don rtogs pa bslad pa de 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra la yang ji ltar mthong ba las ji ltar sbyor ba dmigs pa
translated: Just as the understanding of the meaning from hearing a bare word such as pot, due to following the observation of its application, is mistaken, so too it is for words such as ‚Äújust as‚Äù and so on. Just as it is observed, the application is observed.

original: las ngag ji snyed la shes bya'i sgra rab tu sbyor bar mthong ba de'i rjes su 'brang bas shes bya'i sgra yan gar ba thos pa'i tshig don rtogs pa bslad pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: las ngag ji snyed la shes bya'i sgra rab tu sbyor bar mthong ba de'i rjes su 'brang bas shes bya'i sgra yan gar ba thos pa'i tshig don rtogs pa bslad pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is seen that all verbal actions are applied to the words of the object of knowledge, the words of the object of knowledge that are heard separately are contaminated by the understanding of the meaning of the words that follow it.

original: 'dis ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i sgra rnam pa thams cad du mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i sgra rnam pa thams cad du mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the words pot and so on and the words object of knowledge and so on are exactly the same in every respect.

original: gang gi phyir ngag thams cad nges par gzung @140a * //üîΩba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngag thams cad nges par gzung @140a * // ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Since all speech is necessarily associated with words,

original: ngag la gnas pa'i tshig dag kho na don dang ldan pa yin pa de'i phyir sgra sbyor ba thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: ngag la gnas pa'i tshig dag kho na don dang ldan pa yin pa de'i phyir sgra sbyor ba thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: and only the words that are contained in the speech have meaning, he concludes with the words all applications of words and so on.

original: de ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba de 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba de 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a result means because that application of the word has a result.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgra thams cad kyi brjod par bya ba gzhan sel ba yin pa la gsal bar byed kyi ci gzhan sel ba brjod par bya ba'i don yin nam /üîΩ'on te brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig yin /üîΩgal te brjod par bya ba yin na de ci bsgrub pa'i ngo bor ram /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgra thams cad kyi brjod par bya ba gzhan sel ba yin pa la gsal bar byed kyi ci gzhan sel ba brjod par bya ba'i don yin nam / 'on te brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig yin / gal te brjod par bya ba yin na de ci bsgrub pa'i ngo bor ram /
translated: But is the exclusion of other the referent of a term or is it not?

original: 'on te rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bor yin /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bor yin /
translated: If it is the referent, is it the referent in the sense of being affirmed or in the sense of being eliminated?

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na mi mnyan pas gzhan sel par byed do zhes bya ba nyams te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na mi mnyan pas gzhan sel par byed do zhes bya ba nyams te /
translated: If it is the referent in the sense of being affirmed, then the statement ‚ÄúThe exclusion of other is taught‚Äù is undermined,

original: sgrub pa'i ngo bor gzhan sel ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i ngo bor gzhan sel ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the exclusion of other is taught in the sense of being affirmed.

original: gnyis pa ltar na yang gzhan sel ba yang gzhan rnam par gcad pas ston na de la yang gzhan sel ba gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni des legs par ma brtags par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na yang gzhan sel ba yang gzhan rnam par gcad pas ston na de la yang gzhan sel ba gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni des legs par ma brtags par smras pa yin no //
translated: If it is the referent in the sense of being eliminated, then since the exclusion of other is taught by the elimination of other, it would follow that the exclusion of other would require another exclusion of other, and so on, ad infinitum.üîΩThis is a case of your speaking without having analyzed the matter well.

original: 'di ltar re zhig gal te sum pa la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i gzhan rnam par gcod pa gzung nas de skad du rgol na ni de'i tshig tu mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig gal te sum pa la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i gzhan rnam par gcod pa gzung nas de skad du rgol na ni de'i tshig tu mi rung ste /
translated: In this way, if you argue that the object of expression is the exclusion of other, such as the word pot, then your words are not suitable.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nar bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i gzhan sel ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nar bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i gzhan sel ba yin na /
translated: In this way, if the object of expression of the word pot is the exclusion of other that is the entity that is the exclusion of nonpot,

original: de la gang gis na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i gzhan sel ba gzhan ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: de la gang gis na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i gzhan sel ba gzhan ci zhig dgos /
translated: then what other exclusion of other is necessary to prevent an infinite regress?

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras de ston pa na yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nas ston pas ji ltar sgra'i don bsgrub pa can yin /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras de ston pa na yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nas ston pas ji ltar sgra'i don bsgrub pa can yin /
translated: And when the word pot is used to indicate it, since it is indicated by the entity that is the exclusion of other, how can the meaning of the word be established?

original: 'on te gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba 'di kho na'i brjod par bya ba gnag yin pa gzhan sel ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba 'di kho na'i brjod par bya ba gnag yin pa gzhan sel ba yin la /
translated: But if you argue that the object of expression of the word exclusion of other is the exclusion of other,

original: de la brten nas rgol na ni tha snyad du gtogs pa de la yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas rgol na ni tha snyad du gtogs pa de la yang gzhan rnam par gcod pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: then even in terms of conventional usage, the exclusion of other exists.

original: sgras ni gzhan sel bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: sgras ni gzhan sel bar mi byed kyi /
translated: The word does not exclude anything else.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub pa kho nas don brjod do zhes de snyam du /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub pa kho nas don brjod do zhes de snyam du /
translated: However, the meaning is expressed only by the affirmation.

original: blo gros rmongs pa'i dogs pa gnas rnam par gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros rmongs pa'i dogs pa gnas rnam par gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the doubt of the confused mind should be completely eliminated.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa klan ka ngan pa rnams yongs su spangs @140b pa kho nar /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa klan ka ngan pa rnams yongs su spangs @140b pa kho nar /
translated: Having completely abandoned such bad objections,

original: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which is different from that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: shing gi don gang zhig shing ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa gang las tha dad pa shing ma yin pa de rnam par ldog nas shing zhes bya ba'i sgra 'god cing brdar byed par lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shing gi don gang zhig shing ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa gang las tha dad pa shing ma yin pa de rnam par ldog nas shing zhes bya ba'i sgra 'god cing brdar byed par lta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the word ‚Äútree‚Äù is applied and designated by excluding that which is not a tree, the meaning of ‚Äútree,‚Äù from that which is not a tree, such as a pot.

original: des ni las gzhan pa bzlog pa ma bsdus pa'i sgra kho na 'god do zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: des ni las gzhan pa bzlog pa ma bsdus pa'i sgra kho na 'god do zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: He explains that the word ‚Äútree‚Äù is applied only to that which is not included in the exclusion of other.

original: yang de gang du 'god ce na /
analyzed: yang de gang du 'god ce na /
translated: Where is it applied?

original: khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy the qualifier . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: shing gi khyad par rnams kyi de las tha dad pa ni shing ma yin pa de las tha dad pa gang yin pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: shing gi khyad par rnams kyi de las tha dad pa ni shing ma yin pa de las tha dad pa gang yin pa'o / // / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: The difference from the particular trees is the difference from what is not a tree.

original: ji ltar shing gi khyad par gcig shing ma yin pa de las tha dad pa ltar shing gi khyad par thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: ji ltar shing gi khyad par gcig shing ma yin pa de las tha dad pa ltar shing gi khyad par thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bas /
translated: Just as the difference of one particular tree is different from what is not a tree, so also is the difference of all particular trees.

original: de'i phyir shing de rnams las tha dad pa 'dis blo sa gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pas rnam pa ni mtshungs par snang ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing de rnams las tha dad pa 'dis blo sa gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pas rnam pa ni mtshungs par snang ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this difference from all those trees is the superimposition of a single cognition. Thus, the aspect appears as if it were the same.

original: tha dad pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can de la sgra 'god do //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can de la sgra 'god do //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated in regard to the difference that has the same aspect.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of exclusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa can la blo la snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can la blo la snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rab tu bshad do //
translated: The master DignƒÅga explained that very aspect that appears to the conceptual cognition.

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: How did he explain it?üîΩHe said:

original: smras pa gzhan las ldog pa yis //
analyzed: smras pa gzhan las ldog pa yis //
translated: By the exclusion of other.

original: dngos po de yi cha 'ga' zhig / rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis te /
analyzed: dngos po de yi cha 'ga' zhig / rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis te /
translated: The word ‚Äúrealized‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúa portion of the thing is realized‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúthis‚Äù .

original: 'di'i ste 'di'i don ni 'grel pa las gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ste 'di'i don ni 'grel pa las gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthis‚Äù is clarified in the commentary.

original: tha dad pa 'di la'ang ngo bo rang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul pa ma gtogs pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di la'ang ngo bo rang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul pa ma gtogs pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: This difference also has no essence of its own, except for error.

original: de bas na gsal byed kyis gal te gzhan las ldog pa thams cad la mtshungs shing rjes su yod pa yin na ming la mi 'dum par zad de /
analyzed: de bas na gsal byed kyis gal te gzhan las ldog pa thams cad la mtshungs shing rjes su yod pa yin na ming la mi 'dum par zad de /
translated: Therefore, if the illuminator is the same in all cases of the exclusion of other, and if it exists subsequently, then it is only a name that is not consistent.

original: spyi la ming gzhan du brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi la ming gzhan du brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: The statement that ‚Äúthe universal is expressed by another name‚Äù is clear.

original: sgra rnams las de nyid rtogs nyid kyis tha dad pa ji skad pa de rtogs pa nyid kyis gzhan bzlog pas ni rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra rnams las de nyid rtogs nyid kyis tha dad pa ji skad pa de rtogs pa nyid kyis gzhan bzlog pas ni rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: The exclusion of other is understood from the words themselves, because the exclusion of other is understood from the words themselves.

original: tha dad pa de ni gzhan zlog par byed pa 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa de ni gzhan zlog par byed pa 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference is implied by the exclusion of other.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gzhan sel ba de la ni gzhan bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi 'gas khyad par du @141a * //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gzhan sel ba de la ni gzhan bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi 'gas khyad par du @141a * //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the exclusion of other, and that is the universal that is defined in terms of the exclusion of other.üîΩ

original: byas pa'i rtogs par 'gyur ba gzhan zhes bya ba gzhan las bzlog pa'i don ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: byas pa'i rtogs par 'gyur ba gzhan zhes bya ba gzhan las bzlog pa'i don ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: In regard to that, in the case of the meaning of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù which is the exclusion of other, there is no other object that is the opposite of other, which is characterized as a universal that is distinguished by the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: sgras ni gnyis byed pa 'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgras ni gnyis byed pa 'ang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the word perform a double function,

original: rang gi don brjod pa dang / gzhan bzlog pa ni gnyis byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don brjod pa dang / gzhan bzlog pa ni gnyis byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because it does not perform a double function in expressing its own meaning and excluding other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun yod pa min phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun yod pa min phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist in mutual dependence.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is a reason.

original: gang gi phyir phan tshun med pa nyid kyis shing gi don yang shing ma yin pa med pa yin la shing ma yin pa yang de med pa yin pa de'i phyir shing gi don rtogs pa kho nas shugs kyis shing ma yin pa'i don bzlog par 'gyur bas
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan tshun med pa nyid kyis shing gi don yang shing ma yin pa med pa yin la shing ma yin pa yang de med pa yin pa de'i phyir shing gi don rtogs pa kho nas shugs kyis shing ma yin pa'i don bzlog par 'gyur bas
translated: Because they do not exist in mutual dependence, the meaning of ‚Äútree‚Äù is the absence of non-tree, and the meaning of non-tree is the absence of tree. Therefore, the meaning of tree is understood and the meaning of non-tree is excluded by implication.

original: sgra la byed pa gnyis ni med do //
analyzed: sgra la byed pa gnyis ni med do //
translated: Thus the word does not perform a double function.

original: gang la sgras brjod par bya ba'i tha dad pa ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sa rtogs par byed pas kyang rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang ldan pa yin no snyam du dogs pa de la de dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la sgras brjod par bya ba'i tha dad pa ni don byed pa don du gnyer bas brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sa rtogs par byed pas kyang rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang ldan pa yin no snyam du dogs pa de la de dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is not a thing,‚Äù etc.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the object that is expressed.

original: dngos med ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot a thing‚Äù means that it is essenceless.

original: dngos po med pa de la smra ba po dag gi snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas dngos po dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni blo'i bslad pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de la smra ba po dag gi snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas dngos po dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni blo'i bslad pa yin te /
translated: That which is not a thing, the appearance and the object of the word of the speakers, having been made one, is seen to be a thing. That is a corruption of the mind.

original: 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a mistake, is the meaning.

original: smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag gis rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos sgro btags pa kho na go rims bzhin du sgras kyang go bar byed cing de dag snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'khrul pa'i dbang gis
analyzed: smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag gis rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos sgro btags pa kho na go rims bzhin du sgras kyang go bar byed cing de dag snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'khrul pa'i dbang gis
translated: They engage in the appearance and the conceptualized object as if they were one, due to the power of delusion.

original: 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dgod par bya ba'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: dgod par bya ba'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
translated: By the words ‚Äúthe expression that is to be applied,‚Äù etc., he explains.

original: sgra gang dag gis de las gzhan pa ba zlog pas 'phangs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: sgra gang dag gis de las gzhan pa ba zlog pas 'phangs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The words by which the other is excluded are to be applied,üîΩas ‚Äúimplied.‚Äù

original: shing la sogs pa'i don gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de bzlog nas 'god do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i don gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de bzlog nas 'god do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That object, such as a tree, which is different from that, is to be excluded and applied.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: khyad par rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚Äúthe particulars,‚Äù etc.

original: don 'di ni tshig le'ur byas pa las rnam par phye zin to //
analyzed: don 'di ni tshig le'ur byas pa las rnam par phye zin to //
translated: This meaning has already been analyzed in the verses.

original: tha dad pa'i ngo bo mtshungs par @141b snang ba de nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos don gzhan ldog pas dngos po de'i cha 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sgras ni don gzhan las ldog pas khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po dag kho na brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan cing bshad do ;
analyzed: tha dad pa'i ngo bo mtshungs par @141b snang ba de nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos don gzhan ldog pas dngos po de'i cha 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sgras ni don gzhan las ldog pas khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po dag kho na brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan cing bshad do ;
translated: Master Dignaga taught and explained that very appearance of a different nature as similar by saying, ‚ÄúOne understands a part of that thing by the exclusion of other objects,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIn the same way, a word expresses only things distinguished by the exclusion of other objects.‚Äù

original: / stsogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra dang / don gzhan sel bar byed cing rang gi don rjod par byed do zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
analyzed: / stsogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra dang / don gzhan sel bar byed cing rang gi don rjod par byed do zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the statement, ‚ÄúA word and other objects express their own meaning by excluding other objects.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis is so‚Äù and so on establishes the text.

original: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra de ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i tha dad pa de brjod pa na don tha dad pa shing ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa 'phen pa lta bur 'jug go //
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba'i sgra de ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i tha dad pa de brjod pa na don tha dad pa shing ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa 'phen pa lta bur 'jug go //
translated: When the word tree appears to thought as the expression of that difference, it engages as if it were projecting the exclusion of other objects that are not the tree.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig la yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig la yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of something in one thing‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar shing gi khyad par seng ldeng la sogs pa kho nas shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ltar shing ma yin pa rnams kyang shing dag las de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar shing gi khyad par seng ldeng la sogs pa kho nas shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ltar shing ma yin pa rnams kyang shing dag las de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the particular tree, such as a teak tree and so on, is different from non-trees, so also non-trees are different from trees.

original: tha dad pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is based on duality.

original: de la shing zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig la yod pa'i shing gi don la yod pa'i tha dad pa rnams gcig pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la snang ba brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa bzlog pa 'phen pa de med pa yinüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shing zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig la yod pa'i shing gi don la yod pa'i tha dad pa rnams gcig pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la snang ba brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa bzlog pa 'phen pa de med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, the expression ‚Äútree‚Äù is the appearance in the conceptual cognition of the difference that exists in the referent of the word ‚Äútree‚Äù as existing in one thing. That is the exclusion of the other, which is the absence of that.

original: de bas na shing gi don las gzhan pa shing ma yin pa bzlog pa gang yin pa de med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
