produced again,‚Äù or that, having been produced

original: gal te nus pa dag ci'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dag ci'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed ce na ma yin te /
translated: If you ask why they do not produce other things, they do not,

original: de kho na la nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na la nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are capable of producing only that.

original: gcig po de nyid bskyed par bya bar nus kyi gzhan dang gzhan bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig po de nyid bskyed par bya bar nus kyi gzhan dang gzhan bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: They are capable of producing only that one thing, not other things.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu gcig skye na rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu gcig skye na rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one effect arises from the different intrinsic natures of the eye and so on, which are co-emergent causes, then the effect would be different due to the difference in the cause.

original: 'bras bu nyid ji lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba'i khyad par 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ji lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba'i khyad par 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because the effect is connected to the difference in its intrinsic nature, just as it is, and the difference in its function is not confused due to its connection.

original: rdza mkhan dang / skud pa la sogs pa dag las bum par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: rdza mkhan dang / skud pa la sogs pa dag las bum par 'gyur ba las /
translated: A pot arises from a potter, thread, and so on.

original: 'ji ba'i gong bu las ni 'ji ba'i gong bu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i gong bu las ni 'ji ba'i gong bu ma yin pa shing la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: From a lump of clay, a pot arises, not from a lump of clay that is different, such as a piece of wood and so on.

original: rdza mkhan las ni 'ji ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de nyid dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid de las gzhan pa dag las tha dad pa /üîΩskud pa las ni 'ji ba dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gi @145a * //
analyzed: rdza mkhan las ni 'ji ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de nyid dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid de las gzhan pa dag las tha dad pa / skud pa las ni 'ji ba dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gi @145a * //
translated: The potter is not the nature of the clay, but is a different nature from that, a different nature from the various shapes.

original: bdag nyid can de nyid 'khor lo la sogs pa las rnam par phye ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid can de nyid 'khor lo la sogs pa las rnam par phye ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba lta bu ste /
translated: The clay and the various shapes are not the nature of the thread, but are different from the wheel, etc.

original: de ltar na rdza mkhan las ni 'ji ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la 'ji ba las kyang dbyibs kyi bye brag ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rdza mkhan las ni 'ji ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la 'ji ba las kyang dbyibs kyi bye brag ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the potter is not the nature of the clay, and the clay is not the various shapes.

original: gnyis kyis nus pa'i bye brag gi yul tha dad kyang des bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis nus pa'i bye brag gi yul tha dad kyang des bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag ma yin no //
translated: Although the two have different capacities and different objects, they are not different in the particularities produced by them.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the effect is not different,

original: 'ji ba dang dbyibs dag phan tshun gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid kyis de gnyis dbyibs dang 'ji ba'i ngo bo dag tu mi snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ji ba dang dbyibs dag phan tshun gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid kyis de gnyis dbyibs dang 'ji ba'i ngo bo dag tu mi snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the clay and the shape are not each other‚Äôs nature, it follows that those two would not appear as shape and clay.

original: gal te yon tan dbyibs ni rdzas las gzhan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te yon tan dbyibs ni rdzas las gzhan pa kho na yin te /
translated: If the shape of the qualities is something completely different from the substance,

original: de bas na rdza mkhan dang 'ji ba'i nye bar sbyor ba'i yul ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rdza mkhan dang 'ji ba'i nye bar sbyor ba'i yul ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the potter and the clay would be different in nature, in terms of their application.

original: 'di la bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang 'ji ba las dbyibs tha dad pa zhig yin na rdza mkhan gyis ci'i phyir logs shig tu mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'ji ba las dbyibs tha dad pa zhig yin na rdza mkhan gyis ci'i phyir logs shig tu mi byed /
translated: Moreover, if the shape were different from the clay, why would the potter not make it separately?

original: gal te yon tan ni rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pas logs shig tu mi byed do //üîΩgal te rang bzhin rdzas de dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yon tan ni rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pas logs shig tu mi byed do // gal te rang bzhin rdzas de dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'am /
translated: If the qualities are dependent on the substance, they would not be made separately.

original: dbyibs de la rag las pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na rdza mkhan la ltos ci dgos she na ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs de la rag las pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na rdza mkhan la ltos ci dgos she na ma yin te /
translated: If the nature of the substance is the basis of that shape, or if it is dependent on that shape, why would it need to depend on the potter?

original: de las phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it obtains the mutual suitability from that.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang 'ji ba'i gong bu dbyibs kyi khyad par dang 'brel du rung ba nyid gcig yin na ni dbyibs kyi khyad par 'brel pa'i khyad par du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang 'ji ba'i gong bu dbyibs kyi khyad par dang 'brel du rung ba nyid gcig yin na ni dbyibs kyi khyad par 'brel pa'i khyad par du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the lump of clay were suitable to be connected with a particular shape only by the nature of the thing itself, then it would follow that the particular shape would be the particular connection.

original: de lta yin na ni 'o na rdzas 'ji ba'i rung ba de rdza mkhan las 'gyur bar 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'o na rdzas 'ji ba'i rung ba de rdza mkhan las 'gyur bar 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then the suitability of the lump of clay would be due to the potter, and these two would not be different in nature.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were different, then the absurd consequence would be as before.

original: re zhig ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid la yang rkyen du mas khyad par du bya ba 'ga' yod pas 'ji ba dang dbyibs dag ngo bo nyid du bsgrub par mi 'bad do //
analyzed: re zhig ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid la yang rkyen du mas khyad par du bya ba 'ga' yod pas 'ji ba dang dbyibs dag ngo bo nyid du bsgrub par mi 'bad do //
translated: Even in the case of a single nature, since there are many conditions that make a difference, we do not strive to establish the clay and shape as natures.

original: de bas na dngos su 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dngos su 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if there is a single effect in reality, the co-operating conditions do not have the same object.

original: ji ltar 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu @145b gcig pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu @145b gcig pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang rigs par bya ste /
translated: Just as the effect is not the same because the objects that are the different causes are different, so too, the arising of eye consciousness from the eye faculty and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mig gi dbang po las ni gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid du so sor nges pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mig gi dbang po las ni gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid du so sor nges pa yin na /
translated: Thus, from the immediately preceding condition, eye consciousness is the nature of the observed object. From the eye faculty, that observed object is ascertained as the suitability to apprehend form.

original: yul las ni de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo can nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul las ni de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo can nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: From the object, it is the nature of that.

original: dngos su 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid ma yin yang rgyu'i ngo bo tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa kho na dag tu 'gyur bas rgyu tha dad pa yin yang des byas pa'i khyad par tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid ma yin yang rgyu'i ngo bo tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa kho na dag tu 'gyur bas rgyu tha dad pa yin yang des byas pa'i khyad par tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Although the effect is not actually different, it is different from causes that are different in nature. Since it is only different in specific attributes, even though the causes are different, the specific attributes produced by them are not different.

original: rgyu'i nus pa tha dad pa de dag kho na skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin so so'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa tshogs pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid gnas pa'iüîΩgzhi dag yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa tha dad pa de dag kho na skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin so so'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa tshogs pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid gnas pa'i gzhi dag yin zhes bya ste /
translated: The collection of causes that exist in this way is the basis for the existence of the effect.

original: 'di ltar de ni de mtha' dag las dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa dang / yul gyi ngo bo can zhes bya ba so so'i khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid cig skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni de mtha' dag las dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa dang / yul gyi ngo bo can zhes bya ba so so'i khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid cig skyes so //
translated: Thus, the effect arises from the collection of causes as a single entity that has the nature of being perceived by all of them, that is determined to be the apprehender of form, and that has the nature of the object.

original: gal te nus pa 'gog pa med pa 'bras bu mjug thogs skad cig pa khyad par du bogs dbyung du med pa dag gi rkyen rnams la phan tshun byed pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa 'gog pa med pa 'bras bu mjug thogs skad cig pa khyad par du bogs dbyung du med pa dag gi rkyen rnams la phan tshun byed pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If the potencies are not blocked, what is the purpose of the conditions that are the subsequent, momentary, and unaugmented effects?

original: lhan cig byed pa ni thams cad du bogs 'byin pa bskyed pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ni thams cad du bogs 'byin pa bskyed pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: Co-operative causes are not always productive of an augmentation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then are they?

original: mang po dag don gcig byed pa gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: mang po dag don gcig byed pa gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: It is that which causes many to perform one action.

original: dper na tshogs pa tha ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa tha ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the final moment of the collection.

original: 'di nyid dngos su lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid dngos su lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is the actual co-operation of the co-operating causes,

original: tha ma de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that final moment is the cause.

original: skad cig ma de la ngo bo nyid gcig la dbye ba med pas khyad par du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: skad cig ma de la ngo bo nyid gcig la dbye ba med pas khyad par du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because in that moment, one nature is undifferentiated and cannot be distinguished,

original: khyad par du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of another nature is the characteristic of arising.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung ba ni tha mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung ba ni tha mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The arising of another nature is not the final moment,

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: therefore it is not the cause of the direct perception.

original: de lta bas na lhan cig byed pa rnams las rgyu'i khyad par 'byung ba ma yin no //üîΩgang @146a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na lhan cig byed pa rnams las rgyu'i khyad par 'byung ba ma yin no //üîΩgang @146a * //
translated: Therefore, the difference of the cause does not arise from the co-operating causes.üîΩWhat is the difference between the co-operating cause and the immediately preceding condition?

original: dag la sngon dang phyis dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo med pa gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rkyen tha ma ngo bo nyid kyis nus pa skad cig pa de dag lhan cig skye ste /
analyzed: dag la sngon dang phyis dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo med pa gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu 'byung ba'i rkyen tha ma ngo bo nyid kyis nus pa skad cig pa de dag lhan cig skye ste /
translated: They arise simultaneously.

original: de la bya ba gcig pa kho na lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la bya ba gcig pa kho na lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they have the same action, they are co-operating causes.

original: gal te nus pa de dag ga las byung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa de dag ga las byung zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhere do these capacities come from?‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu dag las so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dag las so //
translated: They come from their own causes.

original: gal te de dag gis 'di'i rkyen gzhan dang nye ba med pa kho nar ci ste mi skyed de /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis 'di'i rkyen gzhan dang nye ba med pa kho nar ci ste mi skyed de /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt they produce the effect when the other conditions are not present?‚Äù

original: de res 'ga' gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de res 'ga' gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not produce it sometimes, even when the other conditions are present.

original: de'i phyir la lar gcig pus kyang bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir la lar gcig pus kyang bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you might think that sometimes a single cause would produce the effect.

original: 'du byed brgyud ma gzhan dang gzhan gyi rkyen dang ldan pas skad cig ma re re la nus pa can dag 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pas ngo bo 'dra bar shes mod kyi de la 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed brgyud ma gzhan dang gzhan gyi rkyen dang ldan pas skad cig ma re re la nus pa can dag 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pas ngo bo 'dra bar shes mod kyi de la 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, because the series of compositional factors has the other conditions, some of the momentary capacities are similar in being the same. Therefore, they are recognized as having the same nature. However, they are different in their own natures.

original: des na 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, some are causes of some.

original: de la gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa can gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa can gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Among them, that which possesses the collection of form, faculties, etc., without an obstructed object, etc., is the cause that is able to generate consciousness.

original: de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu bskyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu bskyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is the special condition of their mutual approach, etc., is not the cause that is able to generate that.

original: de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med /
analyzed: de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med /
translated: Those are not prior, nor are they subsequent,

original: so so na yang med pas nus kyang sngon dang phyis dang so so na yod pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos so //
analyzed: so so na yang med pas nus kyang sngon dang phyis dang so so na yod pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos so //
translated: nor are they individual. Therefore, even though they are able, they are not tainted by the faults that arise from being prior, subsequent, or individual.

original: des na 'di dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i nus pa'i rgyu yin pas de la nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'di dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i nus pa'i rgyu yin pas de la nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, that which is the cause of their mutual approach, etc., is the cause of their ability. Therefore, they never become different.

original: tshul 'dis thams cad la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor so sor nges par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'dis thams cad la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor so sor nges par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand that all causes and effects are definitely ascertained as distinct.

original: dngos po'i nus pa skad cig ma re re la ngo bo nyid kyis bye brag gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba can dag la yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa skad cig ma re re la ngo bo nyid kyis bye brag gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba can dag la yin gyi /
translated: The potency of things is in each moment, by its very nature, either following after another specific thing or not.

original: dngos po brten pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brten pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not in things that have a single nature that endures,

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur pa med pas nus pa dang mi nus pa'i ngo bo nyid dag la byed pa dang mi byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur pa med pas nus pa dang mi nus pa'i ngo bo nyid dag la byed pa dang mi byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for a thing that does not change its nature to be either potent or impotent, to be active or inactive.

original: gal te lhan cig pa byed kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig pa byed kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is active when it is together with something else, but not when it is alone,

original: ci 'ba' zhig gis 'bras bu bskyed par @146b nus sam /
analyzed: ci 'ba' zhig gis 'bras bu bskyed par @146b nus sam /
translated: then is it able to produce an effect when it is alone?

original: mi nus so //
analyzed: mi nus so //
translated: No, it is not.

original: ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
translated: Why does it not produce it?

original: mi skyed na ji ltar nus /
analyzed: mi skyed na ji ltar nus /
translated: If it does not produce it, how can it be able?

original: gal te thag pa la sogs pas ras yug la sogs pa bya bar nus mod kyi thams cad du mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thag pa la sogs pas ras yug la sogs pa bya bar nus mod kyi thams cad du mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that a rope, for example, is able to produce cloth, but does not do so in every case,

original: rtse ba'i ngang tshul can blun po lha rnams dga' ba skyed de bar bskyed pa skyed pa ni byas shing byas pa la yang dang yang du 'jug ste /
analyzed: rtse ba'i ngang tshul can blun po lha rnams dga' ba skyed de bar bskyed pa skyed pa ni byas shing byas pa la yang dang yang du 'jug ste /
translated: The gods delight in the foolish who are disposed to play, and who, having done and done again, engage in the same activities over and over again.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sa bon la sogs pa nye bar 'god par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sa bon la sogs pa nye bar 'god par dpyad zin to //
translated: Thus, the planting of seeds, etc., has been analyzed.

original: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de'i chos can gyi ngo bo de lta bu ni tha ma'i gnas skabs bzhin du ldog tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de'i chos can gyi ngo bo de lta bu ni tha ma'i gnas skabs bzhin du ldog tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because there is no transformation of an intrinsic nature, the intrinsic nature of that which possesses the characteristics is not capable of being stopped, just like the final moment.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs na rkyen nus pa med pa las nus pa skye na nus pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni sngon med pa skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs na rkyen nus pa med pa las nus pa skye na nus pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni sngon med pa skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: If, in the final moment, potency arises from a condition that is without potency, and if that potency is of the intrinsic nature of that , then it is just the arising of what did not previously exist.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de byed pa po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de byed pa po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If it is not of its intrinsic nature, then it is not the agent of that .

original: nus pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect arises from a thing called ‚Äúpotency.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang re zhig de nyid lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa 'bras bu ji ste skyed /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig de nyid lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa 'bras bu ji ste skyed /
translated: Moreover, how could that which is endowed with all the conditions at a certain time generate an effect?

original: skyed pa mthong ste des na bskyed do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: skyed pa mthong ste des na bskyed do zhes smra'o //
translated: We see that it generates, therefore we say it generates.

original: mthu chen po can gyi mthong ba dngos po de'i mtha' nyid ma yin pa dag kyang rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bya ba sna tshogs pa rnams la sbyor pa ni nus pa chen po can yin no //
analyzed: mthu chen po can gyi mthong ba dngos po de'i mtha' nyid ma yin pa dag kyang rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis bya ba sna tshogs pa rnams la sbyor pa ni nus pa chen po can yin no //
translated: Even though the seeing of one who has great power is not the limit of that thing, it is of great power in that it is applied to various actions by its mere nature.

original: brgya zhig la 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar 'dir khyod kyi mthong ba'i lam las 'das na kye ma mi bskyed pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: brgya zhig la 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar 'dir khyod kyi mthong ba'i lam las 'das na kye ma mi bskyed pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: If by some chance something were to escape your seeing here, alas, it would be a non-generative phenomenon.

original: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur bas bsam pa 'di ni sems la gdung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur bas bsam pa 'di ni sems la gdung ngo //
translated: Since it would be causeless, this thought torments the mind.

original: kho bo ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa las bdag gis mthong bas 'bras bu bskyed do zhes mi zer ba nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa las bdag gis mthong bas 'bras bu bskyed do zhes mi zer ba nyid do //
translated: We do not say that which is not its nature generates an effect because we see it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dag nyid kyis de bskyed pa'i chos yin la de dag mthong na 'di dag ni skyed pa po yin no zhes bya bar shes par zad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis de bskyed pa'i chos yin la de dag mthong na 'di dag ni skyed pa po yin no zhes bya bar shes par zad do //
translated: and they are the causes of that effect. When they are seen, one understands that they are the causes.

original: 'di yang yod bden na de dag 'bras bu bskyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa des na rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams ma bskyed par btang snyoms su 'god do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //üîΩci de dag gi mi sdod par bskyed pa'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid de tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i gnas de tshe 'byung ngam /
analyzed: 'di yang yod bden na de dag 'bras bu bskyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa des na rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams ma bskyed par btang snyoms su 'god do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no // ci de dag gi mi sdod par bskyed pa'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid de tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i gnas de tshe 'byung ngam /
translated: But if they really exist, then since they are by nature the causes that produce the effect, it is not the case that they are indifferent to the effect, that is, that they do not produce it, when all the conditions are present.

original: 'on te sngon yang yod /üîΩma nyams ma byung ba brten pa gcig bu'i ngo bo nyid can rnams @147a * //üîΩla rnams kyang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med pa 'ga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te sngon yang yod / ma nyams ma byung ba brten pa gcig bu'i ngo bo nyid can rnams @147a * // la rnams kyang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med pa 'ga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Do they have the nature of producing the effect only at the final stage, when they are complete, or do they have that nature even earlier?üîΩIf they have that nature even earlier, then why do they not always produce the effect?üîΩIf they have that nature only at the final stage, then they are not the causes of the effect.

original: de ni ci de ma yang yin mo gsham yang yin nam /
analyzed: de ni ci de ma yang yin mo gsham yang yin nam /
translated: If they are not the causes of the effect, then why do they exist?

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la mi skyed pa yang yin no zhes smras pa 'di'i chos ci yin /
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la mi skyed pa yang yin no zhes smras pa 'di'i chos ci yin /
translated: But you have said that it is the nature of things not to endure and to generate, and also not to generate! What does this mean?

original: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that its nature is to be simultaneous, not alone,

original: 'o na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la lhan cig pa yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la lhan cig pa yang gzhan yin te /
translated: then it is one thing to be alone and another to be simultaneous.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristic of different things is different natures.

original: lhan cig pa nyid yin yang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa po ni ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid yin yang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa po ni ma yin la /
translated: Even if it is simultaneous, it is not a generator by the nature of another.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ni sngon yang de kho nar zad la /üîΩji ltar res 'ga' bskyed pa dang bral /
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ni sngon yang de kho nar zad la / ji ltar res 'ga' bskyed pa dang bral /
translated: And its own nature is just that, even before.üîΩHow is it sometimes a generator and sometimes not?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po skad cig pa yin pa de'i ltar na yang ji ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po skad cig pa yin pa de'i ltar na yang ji ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed /
translated: If it is a momentary thing, then why does it not generate alone?

original: gal te yin na ni bskyed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te yin na ni bskyed pa kho na'o //
translated: If it does, then it generates only.

original: ji ltar de ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de ma yin /
translated: How is it not?

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is momentary.

original: ji lta bu zhig bskyed pa ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig bskyed pa ni bshad zin te /
translated: We have already explained what is generated.

original: skad cig ma de las 'byung ba can de ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: skad cig ma de las 'byung ba can de ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: It arises from that very moment, and it is just like that.

original: gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni de nyid ma yin pas thal ba'i 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni de nyid ma yin pas thal ba'i 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that which is different is not that very thing, so the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / de'i rgyu dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / de'i rgyu dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the agent and the nonagent and their causes are mutually exclusive.

original: gang zhig de'i ngo bo nyid de ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na yin pas de ni lhan cig pa nyid la mi ltos so //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i ngo bo nyid de ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na yin pas de ni lhan cig pa nyid la mi ltos so //
translated: That which is its nature is a nonarisen phenomenon, so it does not depend on being simultaneous.

original: 'bras bu ni rkyen gzhan la ltos pas lhan cig pa kho na las skye'i 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rkyen gzhan la ltos pas lhan cig pa kho na las skye'i 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the effect arises only from the simultaneous conditions, not from the mere conditions,

original: de'i ltar na yang ji ltar de 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i ltar na yang ji ltar de 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed pa kho na yin la /
translated: then in that case, how is it that it is generated by the mere conditions?

original: 'bras bu yang de las mi skye ste zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de las mi skye ste zhes bya ste /
translated: And how is it that the effect does not arise from that?

original: gnas skabs de ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni 'gal lo //
translated: That state is contradictory.

original: gal te 'ba' zhig gis bskyed pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig gis bskyed pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is not generated by the mere conditions,

original: da ni ji ltar na mi sdod par skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na mi sdod par skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Now, how can it be that it has the nature of not enduring and arising?

original: 'di skad du bskyed pa kho na'o zhes yongs su bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di skad du bskyed pa kho na'o zhes yongs su bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it taught that it is only produced?

original: 'ba' zhig kyang nus pa yin na 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na ji ltar btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang nus pa yin na 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na ji ltar btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
translated: If it is capable of only that, how can it be indifferent when it depends on another result?

original: gzhan la mi 'chol ba 'di gsal bar bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'chol ba 'di gsal bar bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is clear that it is not independent.

original: de ltar na 'dis bdag nyid kyi nus pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis bdag nyid kyi nus pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it has the nature of being capable of only that.

original: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni de 'ba' zhig gis @147b kyang mi skye bar smras pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni de 'ba' zhig gis @147b kyang mi skye bar smras pa yin la /
translated: When it is said that it depends on another result, it is said that it is not produced by that alone.

original: de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de las skye bar smras pa gang yin pa 'di dag gcig la ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de las skye bar smras pa gang yin pa 'di dag gcig la ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: When it is said that it has the nature of being capable of only that, it is said that it is produced from that alone. How can these two be in the same thing?

original: de lta bas na phrag dog gi zug rdus gnad du brgyab pa can 'di 'chal cing mkhang  bar zad pas btang snyoms su 'dor bar 'os so //
analyzed: de lta bas na phrag dog gi zug rdus gnad du brgyab pa can 'di 'chal cing mkhang  bar zad pas btang snyoms su 'dor bar 'os so //
translated: Therefore, this is just the pain of jealousy striking a vital point. It is confused and pointless. It is fit to be abandoned with indifference.

original: de lta bas na gcig skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid ni dngos po skad cig pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi skad cig pa ma yin pa so so na yod pa srid pa can rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid ni dngos po skad cig pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi skad cig pa ma yin pa so so na yod pa srid pa can rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the state of being a cooperative condition that has the characteristic of generating a single effect is only for momentary things, not for non-momentary things that exist as enduring realities,

original: so sor bskyed pa srid pas lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor bskyed pa srid pas lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to ascertain that they are cooperative conditions since it is possible that they generate individually.üîΩWhen things are shown to be conditions by means of a continuum that benefits, for example, like fire, water, earth, etc., for the production of the effect, such as a sprout, from a seed, etc.,

original: gang rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pas dngos po rnams rkyen nyid du ston pa dper na 'bras bu thug po che dang / sa bon la sogs pa las 'bras bu can dang / myu gu la sogs pa 'byung ba la me dang chu dang sa la sogs pa lta bu de la de ni rgyun la brten nas khyad par 'byung ba la rkyen rnams kyis lhan cig byed par bshad kyi /
analyzed: gang rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pas dngos po rnams rkyen nyid du ston pa dper na 'bras bu thug po che dang / sa bon la sogs pa las 'bras bu can dang / myu gu la sogs pa 'byung ba la me dang chu dang sa la sogs pa lta bu de la de ni rgyun la brten nas khyad par 'byung ba la rkyen rnams kyis lhan cig byed par bshad kyi /
translated: it is said that the conditions are cooperative in the arising of a difference that is based on a continuum,

original: rdzas la brten nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas la brten nas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not based on a substance,

original: rdzas skad cig ma khyad par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas skad cig ma khyad par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a momentary substance does not have a difference that arises.

original: 'bras thug po che la sogs pa me la sogs pas rim gyis ngo bo nyid khyad par gyur pa mi 'byung na 'bras chan la sogs pa 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras thug po che la sogs pa me la sogs pas rim gyis ngo bo nyid khyad par gyur pa mi 'byung na 'bras chan la sogs pa 'grub pa'am /
translated: If the nature of boiled rice, etc., does not change gradually through the fire, etc., then boiled rice, etc., would not be produced.

original: snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa'i dbang po la rang gi phan 'dogs pa dag las rgyun gyis khyad par mi 'byung na don rtogs pa skye ba med do //
analyzed: snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa'i dbang po la rang gi phan 'dogs pa dag las rgyun gyis khyad par mi 'byung na don rtogs pa skye ba med do //
translated: If the sense faculty of one who has gone from light into darkness does not change through its own benefit, then the arising of the understanding of the object would not occur.

original: thogs pa med par skyed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la ni phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: thogs pa med par skyed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la ni phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba med de /
translated: In the case of a sense faculty, etc., that produces without obstruction, there is no change from mutual benefit.

original: der ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen rnams kyis rung ba'i yul la sogs par gnas pa can skyes pa de dag lhan cig ngo bo grub pas shes pa'i rkyen nyid du shes pas don gcig byed pa kho
analyzed: der ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen rnams kyis rung ba'i yul la sogs par gnas pa can skyes pa de dag lhan cig ngo bo grub pas shes pa'i rkyen nyid du shes pas don gcig byed pa kho
translated: In that case, the conditions that are the basis of mutual approach, etc., are established as the nature of the arising of those that abide in a suitable place, etc., and they are established as the nature of the simultaneous arising of consciousness. Therefore, the condition of consciousness is only the performance of the same purpose.

original: na lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: na lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is the nature of the simultaneous cause.

original: gang du khyad par skyed pas lhan cig byed pa rnams rkyen nyid yin pa der rgyu'i rgyun rkyen la ltos pa yin pas de las gzhan 'thob po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang du khyad par skyed pas lhan cig byed pa rnams rkyen nyid yin pa der rgyu'i rgyun rkyen la ltos pa yin pas de las gzhan 'thob po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the conditions are co-operating causes because they generate a special effect, the continuum of the cause depends on the conditions. Therefore, it is said that the effect is obtained from them.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis skad cig ma snga ma rang gi dang gis log na de dag kho na las skad cig ma khyad par can 'byung ba'i phyir rim gyis @148a * //üîΩkhyad par du gyur pa dang ldan pa rgyu'i tshogs las 'bras bu'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis skad cig ma snga ma rang gi dang gis log na de dag kho na las skad cig ma khyad par can 'byung ba'i phyir rim gyis @148a * // khyad par du gyur pa dang ldan pa rgyu'i tshogs las 'bras bu'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: In this regard, if the prior moment ceases by itself due to the causes and conditions, then the subsequent special moment arises from them alone. Therefore, the continuum of the cause gradually arises up to the effect, possessing a special quality.

original: lhan cig byed pa las khyad par yang dag par 'byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye na ni khyad par nyid 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa las khyad par yang dag par 'byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye na ni khyad par nyid 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: If the effect arises from the cause, which is the special arising from the co-operating causes, then it is not suitable for the special quality to arise.

original: khyad par can ma yin pa las khyad par skye na ni 'bras bu yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa las khyad par skye na ni 'bras bu yang 'gyur te /
translated: If the special quality arises from the non-special, then the effect would also arise.

original: lhan cig byed pa phan tshun khyad par 'byung ba la mi ltos pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa phan tshun khyad par 'byung ba la mi ltos pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the co-operating causes do not depend on the arising of the special quality of each other, they would not generate the effect.

original: des na skad cig pa ma yin pa lhan cig byed pa las mi ltos pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na skad cig pa ma yin pa lhan cig byed pa las mi ltos pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, those that are not momentary and do not depend on the assemblage of causes would be causes.

original: ltos par bya ba rnams las ngo bo nyid khyad par du 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba rnams las ngo bo nyid khyad par du 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no arising of an intrinsic nature from those that are dependent.

original: 'on te khyad par 'byung na yang lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par kho na nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par 'byung na yang lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par kho na nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: But if there is an arising of a distinctive feature, then only the distinctive feature produced by the assemblage of causes would remain.

original: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na 'di dag phan tshun nas byas pa'i khyad par dang rtag tu rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba phan tshun nas 'bras bu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par skyed par rung ba rtag tu gnas pa can yang ma yin
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na 'di dag phan tshun nas byas pa'i khyad par dang rtag tu rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba phan tshun nas 'bras bu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par skyed par rung ba rtag tu gnas pa can yang ma yin
translated: The assemblage of causes is not such that it always remains with a distinctive feature produced from each other, such that it would be fit to produce a distinctive feature that is compatible with the arising of the effect from each other.

original: te / de yod pa dang med pa dag gis 'bras bu gsal ba dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / de yod pa dang med pa dag gis 'bras bu gsal ba dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the presence and absence of the effect are seen to be associated with and disassociated from the presence and absence of the assemblage of causes.

original: des na khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa'i yin par mi 'thad do zhe'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa'i yin par mi 'thad do zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the first distinction is not tenable as the non-assistance of the cooperating causes.

original: kho bo ni yang dang yang du smra ba la skyon 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: kho bo ni yang dang yang du smra ba la skyon 'ga' yang med de /
translated: We do not commit any error in repeating ourselves again and again.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'jig rten gyis rigs pa go bar 'gyur ba ltar na yang dang yang smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'jig rten gyis rigs pa go bar 'gyur ba ltar na yang dang yang smra bar bya'o //
translated: Even though that is so, we will speak again and again, as if the world were to understand the reasoning.

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na de med pa'i phyir khyad par skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba khyad par bskyed pa kho nas lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na de med pa'i phyir khyad par skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba khyad par bskyed pa kho nas lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The cooperating causes are not cooperating causes merely by producing a distinction, because of which they would not be cooperating causes if they did not assist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: don gcig byed pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: don gcig byed pas kyang yin no //
translated: They are also cooperating causes by performing a single action.

original: gal te phan tshun nas khyad par med pa rnams la de yang med do //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun nas khyad par med pa rnams la de yang med do //
translated: If they do not have a distinction from each other, then that also does not exist.

original: 'on te yod na ni so so la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yod na ni so so la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does exist, then it would be for each.

original: de lta na ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then the effect that arises from that specific cause would arise from a single cause.üîΩIn each moment, how is it that a specific effect arises in the continuum of things due to other conditions, and how is it that those specific states such as being suitable as an object generate an effect?

original: skad cig re re la rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag gis ji ltar dngos po'i rgyun la khyad par skye ba dang / yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs @148b kyi bye brag pa dag 'bras bu bskyed pa de dag kyang gang las skye ba dang /
analyzed: skad cig re re la rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag gis ji ltar dngos po'i rgyun la khyad par skye ba dang / yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs @148b kyi bye brag pa dag 'bras bu bskyed pa de dag kyang gang las skye ba dang /
translated: From what do they arise?

original: so sor nus kyang ji ltar 'ba' zhig gis mi bskyed de //
analyzed: so sor nus kyang ji ltar 'ba' zhig gis mi bskyed de //
translated: Even though each is capable, why does a single one not generate it?

original: byed pa po'i khyad par so so na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis po lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa'i khyad par 'byung ba'i chos can dang / gzhan te myu gu la sogs pa lta bu dang / mi sdod par bskyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: byed pa po'i khyad par so so na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis po lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa'i khyad par 'byung ba'i chos can dang / gzhan te myu gu la sogs pa lta bu dang / mi sdod par bskyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lta bu ste /
translated: Because the specific agent exists and does not exist, and because the two types of effect are different: the effect that arises from the specific cause that is generated by the collection of causes and conditions, such as a sprout, and the effect that is generated by the sense faculty and so on without abiding, such as a sense consciousness.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba thams cad bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba thams cad bshad zin to //
translated: The response is the same as above: the effect and the cause are different in nature.üîΩThe cause of the effect that is dependent on the assistance of a series of conditions is the first condition that is a cooperative condition.üîΩThe first condition that is a cooperative condition is not the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition, like the effect that arises immediately after the cause.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.

original: de lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba la lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pas khyad par las skye ba can ma yin 'bras bu mjug thogs can lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba la lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pas khyad par las skye ba can ma yin 'bras bu mjug thogs can lta bu'o //
translated: The special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.

original: de phan chad kyi khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni de las skye ba can yin te /üîΩde dang de dag ni de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te khyad par dang po'i rgyu bzhin du skad cig pa ma yin pa'i dngos po khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de phan chad kyi khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni de las skye ba can yin te / de dang de dag ni de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no // gal te khyad par dang po'i rgyu bzhin du skad cig pa ma yin pa'i dngos po khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.

original: skyed pa ni rag ste /
analyzed: skyed pa ni rag ste /
translated: The special nature of the effect that arises after that is the cause of the effect that arises from the special nature of the cooperative condition.üîΩThe special nature of the effect that arises after

original: gal te 'di'i ngo bo nyid de mi sdod par skyed par byed pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni so so na yod pa srid pas 'ba' zhig gis kyang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gal te 'di'i ngo bo nyid de mi sdod par skyed par byed pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni so so na yod pa srid pas 'ba' zhig gis kyang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: If the nature of this is not to remain, and it is a phenomenon that produces, then it is possible that it exists individually, and it would be like that even by itself alone.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de'i tshe yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni de'i tshe yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If it is not its nature, then at that time it is not a producer.

original: de lta bas na yang rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba can yang med ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba can yang med ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, it is also said that ‚Äúthere is no absence of concomitance.‚Äù

original: de la bye brag 'gog pa ni ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bye brag 'gog pa ni ldog pa yin la /
translated: In that regard, the negation of a distinction is an exclusion.

original: de la shugs kyis lhag ma rtogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de la shugs kyis lhag ma rtogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The understanding of the remainder by implication is a concomitance.

original: gcig rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed de /
analyzed: gcig rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed de /
translated: ‚Äú In the concomitance of one‚Äù and so on is the establishment of the text.

original: gcig rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba ni gcig bsgrub pa la yongs su spang bar bya ba med cing rnam par gcad par bya ba med na brjod pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba ni gcig bsgrub pa la yongs su spang bar bya ba med cing rnam par gcad par bya ba med na brjod pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚Äú In the concomitance of one‚Äù means that if there is nothing to be eliminated and nothing to be excluded in the establishment of one, then the statement is fruitless.

original: gal te shing chod cig ces smras na /
analyzed: gal te shing chod cig ces smras na /
translated: If one says ‚ÄúCut the tree,‚Äù

original: de la shugs kyis shing ma yin pa rnam par mi gcod na de'i tshe shing zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta bas na ldog pa dang bral ba can gyi rjes su @149a * //
analyzed: de la shugs kyis shing ma yin pa rnam par mi gcod na de'i tshe shing zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro // de lta bas na ldog pa dang bral ba can gyi rjes su @149a * //
translated: if the non-tree is not excluded by implication, then at that time the use of the word ‚Äútree‚Äù would be fruitless.

original: 'gro ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni med do //
translated: Thus, there is no pervasion that is not accompanied by exclusion.üîΩSimilarly, in the case of the negation of one,

original: de bzhin du gcig yongs su spangs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni gcig dgag pa la yang dgag pas yul du ma byas pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la gnas pa med na brjod pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig yongs su spangs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni gcig dgag pa la yang dgag pas yul du ma byas pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la gnas pa med na brjod pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: if there is no entity that is not the object of negation, then the expression would be fruitless, because the negation of one would also be so.

original: 'di ltar chang gi yul can gyi btung ba bkag pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chang gi yul can gyi btung ba bkag pa la /
translated: For example, in the negation of drinking with regard to beer,

original: gal te chang las gzhan pa la yang btung ba mi gnas par gyur na ni de'i tshe yul thams cad la btung ba bkag pa la khyad par du 'god pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te chang las gzhan pa la yang btung ba mi gnas par gyur na ni de'i tshe yul thams cad la btung ba bkag pa la khyad par du 'god pa don med pa yin no //
translated: if drinking does not exist in anything other than beer, then at that time it is pointless to establish the negation of drinking with regard to all objects.

original: de la chang mi btung ngo zhes chang btung ba tsam dgag pa la tshig gi don dpyad zin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa btung bar sgras mi bsgrub mod kyi 'on kyang chang las gzhan pa la btung ba gnas par gzung ba yin pas shugs kyis rjes suüîΩ'gro ba rtogs so //
analyzed: de la chang mi btung ngo zhes chang btung ba tsam dgag pa la tshig gi don dpyad zin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa btung bar sgras mi bsgrub mod kyi 'on kyang chang las gzhan pa la btung ba gnas par gzung ba yin pas shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
translated: In that case, since the meaning of the words is already analyzed in the mere prohibition of drinking alcohol, namely, ‚ÄúDo not drink alcohol,‚Äù although the word does not affirm the opposite of that, namely, drinking, nevertheless, since drinking is understood to be present in what is other than alcohol, one understands the implication.

original: tha dad pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la re zhig tha dad pa gcig ni ldog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la re zhig tha dad pa gcig ni ldog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: That difference, etc. First, one difference is the mere exclusion that is the intrinsic identity of something,

original: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from that which is of the same type and that which is of a different type.

original: tha dad pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This difference is the intrinsic identity of something, and thus it is just as it is, endowed with an entity.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa ngo bo gcig lta bu sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa log pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir tha dad pa zhes brjod pa de yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa ngo bo gcig lta bu sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa log pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir tha dad pa zhes brjod pa de yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi
translated: Also, the aspect that appears to thought, which is the same entity as the sound that expresses it, is called ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù because it is posited as the object of expression of sound and because it arises from seeing a thing that is a falsity.

original: shes pa de las tha mi dad pa nyid bsams pas rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang ldan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de las tha mi dad pa nyid bsams pas rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang ldan pa kho na yin te /

original: yin no // de ni phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos pa nyid kyis dngos po med cing ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: yin no // de ni phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos pa nyid kyis dngos po med cing ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: It is, because it is dependent on external things, unreal and essenceless.

original: phyi rol gyi la de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi la de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no external object of that kind.

original: 'di la dngos po dang ldan pa nyid du phyi rol gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba'i blo'i @149b bslad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po dang ldan pa nyid du phyi rol gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba'i blo'i @149b bslad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Here, the error of the mind is just the seeing of the nature of external things as having real substance.

original: 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smos pa ni phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smos pa ni phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust that‚Äù is for the purpose of refuting external objects as causes.

original: blo'i bslad pa nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: blo'i bslad pa nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: It is just the error of the mind.

original: dngos po nyid du bya ba'i phyi rol gyi rgyu ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du bya ba'i phyi rol gyi rgyu ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is not the slightest external cause that is a real entity. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo'i bslad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo'i bslad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the error of the mind.

original: don dam pa min na ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa min na ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: If it is not ultimate, it is unreal.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tha dad pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tha dad pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is the difference as it has been explained.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by way of its own characteristic,

original: de ni don dam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don dam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that exists ultimately.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi 'dod na'o //

original: dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: If a thing were a universal, it would be a thing that is a universal, and it would be a universal that is a thing.

analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnam par rtog pa'i blos 'dra ba nyid du spyir 'gyur ba nyid kyi sgro btags pas dngos por gyur pa de'i tshe dngos por 'gyur ba ldog pa'i ming can gyi spyi'i sgo
translated: If you do not accept that, then a thing would be a universal.üîΩIf you accept that, then it would be impossible to distinguish between the two.

original: nas dngos po de dag rigs mi mthun pa las log par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: nas dngos po de dag rigs mi mthun pa las log par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: If you do not accept that, then a thing would be a universal.üîΩIf you accept that

original: de la shing thams cad kyi tha dad pa shing ma yin pa las ldog pa spyir gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po nyid du 'dod pa de ni gal te shing pa la sha gcig gi tha dad pa las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe pa
analyzed: de la shing thams cad kyi tha dad pa shing ma yin pa las ldog pa spyir gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po nyid du 'dod pa de ni gal te shing pa la sha gcig gi tha dad pa las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe pa
translated: If the difference of all trees from non-tree is asserted to be a universal that is a real entity, then if it is not different from the difference of palasha,

original: la sha gcig pu nyid shing ma yin pa las ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: la sha gcig pu nyid shing ma yin pa las ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then only palasha would be the opposite of non-tree.

original: shing dha pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shing dha pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But dhava and so on would not be.

original: ldog pa spyir gyur pa gang gis shing dha pa la sogs pa ma lus pa shing ma yi pa las ldog par 'dod pa de ni shing pa la sha las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du
analyzed: ldog pa spyir gyur pa gang gis shing dha pa la sogs pa ma lus pa shing ma yi pa las ldog par 'dod pa de ni shing pa la sha las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du
translated: Because by what universal is the difference of all dhava and so on asserted to be the opposite of non-tree, that would not apply to others because it is not different from palasha.üîΩThis is the meaning of the statement.

original: byas pa'o // 'on te pa la sha las gzhan yin na /
analyzed: byas pa'o // 'on te pa la sha las gzhan yin na /
translated: But if it is different from palasha,üîΩthen it would not be a universal.

original: de la yang shing ma yin pa las ldog pa la sha las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir shing ma yin pa las ldog pa de las kyang pa la sha ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la yang shing ma yin pa las ldog pa la sha las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir shing ma yin pa las ldog pa de las kyang pa la sha ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, since the exclusion of non-tree is different from the exclusion of tree, the exclusion of tree would also be excluded from the exclusion of non-tree.

original: shing ma yin pa las ldog pa las kyang pa la sha ldog par 'gyur ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa nyid de zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa las ldog pa las kyang pa la sha ldog par 'gyur ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa nyid de zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the exclusion of tree would also be excluded from the exclusion of non-tree, but it would not be different from non-tree.

original: tha dad par 'dod pa de dag kyang 'di 'di las tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par 'dod pa de dag kyang 'di 'di las tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Those who assert difference also say, ‚ÄúThis is different from that,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni pa la sha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni pa la sha'o //
translated: This is tree.
This

original: las ni shing ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: las ni shing ma yin pa las so //
translated: is different from non-tree.

original: tha dad ces bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba ni de ltar brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means that it is expressed in that way.

original: smras pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is spoken of.

original: dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad pa yin te /
translated: He explains with ‚ÄúThe thing . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni don dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni don dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúown nature‚Äù is ultimate.

original: gal te tha dad pa ni gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ni gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i ldog pa'o //
translated: If difference is a negation that is conceptually superimposed,

original: dngos por gyur pa ni rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa ni rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then it would be the nature of an entity.

original: de zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: That is, it is an entity that is the negation of what is not a tree.

original: de'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gang yin pa de ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gang yin pa de ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The entity of that, or that which is the negation, is the identity of the intrinsic identity of a palm tree.

original: de'i dngos po ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It would not be the entity of that, that is, it would be different from that.

original: dngos po de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that an entity does not go beyond being that or being different.

original: de'i dngos po nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs dang po'i nyes pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs dang po'i nyes pa smras pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf it were the entity of that . . .‚Äù and so on explains the error of the first option.

original: spyir gyur pa'i ldog pa gang gis shing thams cad kyi tha dad pa shing ma yin pa las ldog par 'dod pa de ni de'i dngos po pa la sha las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pas na /
analyzed: spyir gyur pa'i ldog pa gang gis shing thams cad kyi tha dad pa shing ma yin pa las ldog par 'dod pa de ni de'i dngos po pa la sha las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pas na /
translated: In general, the exclusion that is asserted to be the difference of all trees from non-trees is accepted as being nothing other than the entity of tree.

original: de nyid pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas shing ma yin pa las pa la sha kho na tha dad pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas shing ma yin pa las pa la sha kho na tha dad pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, with respect to the real thing, tree, the exclusion is only the particular characteristic of tree.

original: gzhan ni shing dha pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni shing dha pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Other than that are the dhava and so on.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: From that means from non-tree there is no difference.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, because the entity of that and so on.

original: pa la sha ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa pa la sha nyid kyi dngos po yin gyi de'i dngos po dha ba la sogs pa gzhan gyir ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la sha ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa pa la sha nyid kyi dngos po yin gyi de'i dngos po dha ba la sogs pa gzhan gyir ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The entity of tree is the exclusion of non-tree, it is only tree. It is not the entity of another, such as dhava.

original: de nyid ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs gnyis pa nye bar 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs gnyis pa nye bar 'god pa yin no //
translated: The second position is set forth by ‚ÄúThat is not so, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid ma yin pa ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù means that it is not the intrinsic identity of a palasha.

original: de ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yin na'o //
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is a different thing.

original: dngos po yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang bzhin yang ste tha dad par 'dod de bas na gzhan nyid ni pa la sha las ldog pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang bzhin yang ste tha dad par 'dod de bas na gzhan nyid ni pa la sha las ldog pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúA thing‚Äù here means a nature, and it is asserted to be different. Therefore, difference would be the nature of the reversal of a palasha.

original: de bas na zhes bya bas ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya bas ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the cause of difference.

original: dngos po ni pa la sha'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni pa la sha'i bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúA thing‚Äù is the nature of a palasha.

original: de las bya ba ni shing ma yin pa @150b las ldog pa'i ngo bo las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las bya ba ni shing ma yin pa @150b las ldog pa'i ngo bo las ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAn action‚Äù is the nature of the reversal of the reversal of a non-tree.

original: de'i phyir ni rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of that reason.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom this‚Äù means from a non-tree.

original: 'di ni pa la sha ste /
analyzed: 'di ni pa la sha ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is a palasha.

original: tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is different‚Äù would not be so.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po gang zhig gang las tha dad pa ni gang yin pa de las ldog par 'gyur ba de nyid der 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po gang zhig gang las tha dad pa ni gang yin pa de las ldog par 'gyur ba de nyid der 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because whatever thing is different from something else, it is just that which is the opposite of that.

original: shing ma yin pa la ldog pa las shing nyid kyi mtshan nyid ldog pa ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni shing ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa la ldog pa las shing nyid kyi mtshan nyid ldog pa ni pa la sha'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni shing ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the definition of a tree is the opposite of the opposite of a tree, and the definition of a palasha is not a tree.

original: gal te yang shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa 'di ni pa la sha las gzhan du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa 'di ni pa la sha las gzhan du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if this is different from a non-tree, then it is different from a palasha.

original: de ste 'di shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa dang pa la sha 'di 'brel pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste 'di shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa dang pa la sha 'di 'brel pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it would not be the case that this palasha is related to and possesses that which is different from a non-tree.

original: gzhan gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'god pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'god pa'o //
translated: The text presents this very point with ‚ÄúIf it is different from another . . .‚Äù

original: 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa khas blangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa khas blangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if there is a relation‚Äù means if a relation is accepted.

original: 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The relation is the fact of cause and effect, which must be accepted.

original: tha dad pa dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma gtogs par 'brel pa gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma gtogs par 'brel pa gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, apart from the fact of cause and effect, no other relation is tenable for different things.

original: de ldog pa can ni rgyu yin la ldog pa 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ldog pa can ni rgyu yin la ldog pa 'bras bu'o //
translated: The cause is that which has cessation, and the effect is that which has cessation.

original: yin pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yin pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: de las skyes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa can des bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa can des bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù means produced by that which has cessation.

original: dngos po ni dngos po gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po gzhan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThing‚Äù means another thing.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don gzhan gyi ming du byas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don gzhan gyi ming du byas par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba tshig gi don las gzhan yang bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba tshig gi don las gzhan yang bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni ldog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the word ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is not different from the meaning of the word ‚Äúother,‚Äù whatever is the effect of causes has cessation.

original: tha dad par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were different, it would not be so.

original: de ltar gzhan du yang tha dad par 'dod pa'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du yang tha dad par 'dod pa'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even in other cases, a difference that is asserted to be different would not be a different convention.

original: tha dad pa'i don gzhan yin par khas blangs pa 'di ni don gzhan yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don gzhan yin par khas blangs pa 'di ni don gzhan yin no //
translated: This assertion that a different object is different is a different object.

original: de las ldog pa dang ldan pa kyang tha dad pa 'di tha dad par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de las ldog pa dang ldan pa kyang tha dad pa 'di tha dad par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The possession of the opposite of that is also different. This difference exists as different.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na tha da pa'i don gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na tha da pa'i don gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
