translated: Otherwise, a different object would not be different.

original: de bas na shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni pa la sha las gzhan yin @151a * //
analyzed: de bas na shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni pa la sha las gzhan yin @151a * //
translated: Therefore, that which is different from a non-tree is different from a palasha tree.

original: zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Taking that as the basis,

original: shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa pa la sha dang 'brel pa can pa la sha las tha dad pa bdag nyid dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par te bye brag yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir shing ma yin pa las 'di tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa pa la sha dang 'brel pa can pa la sha las tha dad pa bdag nyid dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par te bye brag yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir shing ma yin pa las 'di tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: the difference that is connected to a palasha tree, which is different from a non-tree, is the distinction or particularity that is connected to itself, which is different from a palasha tree. Because of that cause, it is different from a non-tree.

original: rdzas gzhan dang 'dra bar pa la sha ni tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan dang 'dra bar pa la sha ni tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But a palasha tree would not be different as if it were a different substance.

original: dper na rdzas gzhan bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa la ltos nas tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir pa la sha'i tha dad pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na rdzas gzhan bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa la ltos nas tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir pa la sha'i tha dad pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: For example, a post is not different from a vase, etc., which are other substantial entities, because it is different from them.

original: de bzhin du shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa yang pa la sha las tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir pa la sha tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa yang pa la sha las tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir pa la sha tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And likewise, a post is not different from a tree, because it is different from what is not a tree.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Only difference‚Äù is the establishment of the text of this treatise.

original: 'di ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: This is different from what is not a tree.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni shing ma yin pa las so //
translated: ‚Äú From this‚Äù means from what is not a tree.

original: 'di zhes bya ba nyid la ltos pa yin pas na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba nyid la ltos pa yin pas na 'di lta ste /
translated: Since it is dependent on ‚Äúthis,‚Äù it is like this.

original: pa la sha tha dad pa 'di ni shing ma yin pa 'di las zhes bya ba de ltar khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa la sha tha dad pa 'di ni shing ma yin pa 'di las zhes bya ba de ltar khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This difference is taught in this way: ‚ÄúThis post is different from that tree.‚Äù

original: de skad du gal te pa la sha'i shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du gal te pa la sha'i shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, whatever is different from a non-≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is an entity,

original: pa la sha las kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: pa la sha las kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: and it is different from a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree. Thus, it is endowed with the difference of being different.

original: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar don gzhan de nyid skyes pa kho na yin na shing ma yin pa las pa la sha 'di tha dad pa 'di ni zhes bya ba shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa 'di ni
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar don gzhan de nyid skyes pa kho na yin na shing ma yin pa las pa la sha 'di tha dad pa 'di ni zhes bya ba shing ma yin pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa 'di ni
translated: In that case, like a pot and so on, it is just that other object that is produced. If this ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is different from a non-≈õim≈õapƒÅ, then whatever is different from a non-≈õim≈õapƒÅ

original: / de bzhin du pa la sha yin zhing /üîΩde las kyang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de bzhin du pa la sha yin zhing / de las kyang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.üîΩIn that case, it would be taught that it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree and also different from that.

original: de bas na 'di ltar bzlog pa'i phyogs tha dad pa'i yang tha dad pa gang yin pa de yang dngos po can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar bzlog pa'i phyogs tha dad pa'i yang tha dad pa gang yin pa de yang dngos po can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, whatever difference there is of the reversed position is also an entity.

original: de yang rang gi rten las tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na tha dad pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang tha dad pa'i khyad par gyis bdag nyid tha dad pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: de yang rang gi rten las tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na tha dad pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang tha dad pa'i khyad par gyis bdag nyid tha dad pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro
translated: Therefore, nothing would be different.

original: // de nyid ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: // de nyid ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: In response to this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi dngos po med pa la zhes bya ba ldog pa'i mtshan nyid chos su gyur pa'i khyad par gyis dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dngos po med pa la zhes bya ba ldog pa'i mtshan nyid chos su gyur pa'i khyad par gyis dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of a thing that is distinguished‚Äù means that it becomes an absence that is distinguished by a property that is a characteristic of a negation.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin gzhan du @151b gyur pa nyid kyis chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ni dngos po med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin gzhan du @151b gyur pa nyid kyis chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ni dngos po med par 'gyur la /
translated: Because all things are the subjects of the transformation of their nature, difference becomes an absence.

original: de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig smra'o //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig smra'o //
translated: Because that is the intrinsic reality of a property, some say this.

original: gzhan dag ni tha dad pa'i khyad par bzhin du tha dad pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'i gzhung gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tha dad pa'i khyad par bzhin du tha dad pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'i gzhung gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: Others explain the passage ‚ÄúThey are not different from the difference‚Äù as if it were a different text.

original: gal te khyad par dang / khyad par dang ldan pa dang / phyogs gzhan nyid la nyes pa brjod pa na /üîΩgzhan dag la de ltar na yang khyad par de dang ldan pa dag gcig nyid yin pa de bas na 'di la nyes pa med do zhes smras pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang / khyad par dang ldan pa dang / phyogs gzhan nyid la nyes pa brjod pa na / gzhan dag la de ltar na yang khyad par de dang ldan pa dag gcig nyid yin pa de bas na 'di la nyes pa med do zhes smras pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If someone says that the error is stated in regard to the difference, that which possesses the difference, and another side,üîΩothers might say, ‚ÄúEven so, that which possesses the difference is one. Therefore there is no error here.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par de dang ldan pa de nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par de dang ldan pa de nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In response to that, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúThat which possesses the difference that is different is itself different.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni 'di las zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di las zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference ‚Äúthis from that‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid la sogs pa nyid kyis phyir drug pa'i don gyi lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid la sogs pa nyid kyis phyir drug pa'i don gyi lnga pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis from that‚Äù is the fifth case, the dative, by the rule ‚Äúthis from that.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste khyad par dang ldan pa yin la 'di ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste khyad par dang ldan pa yin la 'di ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is qualified, and this is a different thing. In order to teach this difference, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that they are the same.‚Äù

original: de bas na khyad par dang de dang ldan pa dag gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa de'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba de bas na khyad par gyi dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par dang de dang ldan pa dag gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa de'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba de bas na khyad par gyi dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the difference and that which possesses it are not the same, the previously explained error would apply. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe thing that is the difference does not exist.‚Äù

original: gzhung ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //üîΩgal te spyir gyur pa ldog pa dag ni spyi'i dngos po nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhung ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o // gal te spyir gyur pa ldog pa dag ni spyi'i dngos po nyid dam /
translated: The text should be explained as before.üîΩIf you do not assert that the exclusions that are universals are the nature of universals,

original: gzhan gyis kun btags pa spyi nyid du yang mi 'dod pa de lta na spyi'i dngos po nyid brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun btags pa spyi nyid du yang mi 'dod pa de lta na spyi'i dngos po nyid brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or that they are universals imagined by others, then the nature of universals would be something to be expressed.

original: de la yang skyon ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la yang skyon ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In that regard, the error is this. He says, ‚ÄúIn that case, how could it be said that . . .‚Äù?

original: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'i dngos po sgras brjod na'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'i dngos po sgras brjod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-difference‚Äù is the expression of a partless entity by a word.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa de ltar rtags kyi sgo nas khong du chud par byed pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa de ltar rtags kyi sgo nas khong du chud par byed pa na yang ngo //
translated: This is an illustration. In the same way, when one causes understanding by means of a reason,

original: de nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa med pa gcig las tha dad pa ni gzhan dag las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa med pa gcig las tha dad pa ni gzhan dag las kyang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that very thing is non-different from one entity, and it is different from other entities.

original: de ltar na rang gi ngo bo gang gis sgra ma byas pa nyid las tha dad pa de nyid lus can yin pa dang rtag pa las kyang tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi ngo bo gang gis sgra ma byas pa nyid las tha dad pa de nyid lus can yin pa dang rtag pa las kyang tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by its own nature, it is different from sound, which is not produced, and it is also different from a body and from permanence.

original: de ni cha med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩcha med pa'i dngos po yang byas pa'i sgras ma byas pa las tha dad pa gcig @152a * //
analyzed: de ni cha med pa'i phyir ro // cha med pa'i dngos po yang byas pa'i sgras ma byas pa las tha dad pa gcig @152a * //
translated: Because it is partless.

original: brjod pa na /
analyzed: brjod pa na /
translated: And a partless entity is expressed by the word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù as different from what is not produced,üîΩand it is also different from what is not permanent.

original: de bzhin du rtags kyi sgo nas khong du chud par byed pas na tha dad pa thams cad rtogs pas de la cha med pa dngos po sgra dang tshad ma gzhan don med par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtags kyi sgo nas khong du chud par byed pas na tha dad pa thams cad rtogs pas de la cha med pa dngos po sgra dang tshad ma gzhan don med par ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, since it is understood by means of a reason, then since all differences are understood, how could the partless thing, the word, and the other means of knowledge be purposeless?

original: sgra gcig gis brjod pa na sgra gzhan dag dang rtags gcig gis khong du chud par byed pa na tshang ma gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra gcig gis brjod pa na sgra gzhan dag dang rtags gcig gis khong du chud par byed pa na tshang ma gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is expressed by a word, the other words and the one reason by which it is understood are purposeless.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúBecause of that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gang zhig chos //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gang zhig chos //
translated: Therefore, what is the difference of that property

original: gang gis go bar gyur ba de //
analyzed: gang gis go bar gyur ba de //
translated: By which it is understood?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang rgol ba 'di nyid kyi lan btab nas don lhag bar brjod pa'i phyir yang bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang rgol ba 'di nyid kyi lan btab nas don lhag bar brjod pa'i phyir yang bkod pa yin no //
translated: Having responded to this very objection with ‚ÄúThat . . .‚Äù and so on, he also sets it forth again in order to state the meaning in excess.

original: don rnams la rnam pa gzhan du sgro btags pa ni 'dres pa'i don to //
analyzed: don rnams la rnam pa gzhan du sgro btags pa ni 'dres pa'i don to //
translated: The superimposition of a different aspect on objects is the object of mixing.

original: de la 'dres pa'i don gcig rnam par gcod pa ni gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dres pa'i don gcig rnam par gcod pa ni gsal ba yin te /
translated: The exclusion of the one object of mixing is the manifest.

original: sgra gcig gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra gcig gi bya ba'o //
translated: The function of a single word.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni blo so sor snang ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni blo so sor snang ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: There refers to the object of cognition, which is the subject.

original: de nyid sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yang de nyid la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yang de nyid la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of expression of the word because the common locus and so on are possible for it alone.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang gang dang 'dres pa med la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang gang dang 'dres pa med la /
translated: The characteristic of an external thing is not mixed with anything,

original: 'dres pa dang tha dad par gyur pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'dres pa dang tha dad par gyur pa yang med de /
translated: and there is no mixing or separation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dam pa'i don gyi don rnams ni //
analyzed: dam pa'i don gyi don rnams ni //
translated: The objects of ultimate reality

original: rang gi 'dre dang tha dad med //
analyzed: rang gi 'dre dang tha dad med //
translated: are not mixed with their own.

original: ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ces bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: 'dres pa'i don gcig rnam par gcod pa ni rtags kyi yang bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i don gcig rnam par gcod pa ni rtags kyi yang bya ba yin no //
translated: The exclusion of a single mixed object is also the function of the reason.

original: de la sgro btags pa gzhan rnam par gcod pa na sgra dang tshad ma gzhan dag 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa gzhan rnam par gcod pa na sgra dang tshad ma gzhan dag 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: When other superimpositions are excluded, the word and other valid cognitions have a result.

original: dngos po ste phyi rol gyi brjod par bya ba gcod pa rnam par shes pa las bzlog pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po ste phyi rol gyi brjod par bya ba gcod pa rnam par shes pa las bzlog pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is the opposite of consciousness, which is the exclusion of an external object, that is, an external object of expression.

original: dngos po gang gi brjod par byed pa las dngos po'i ngo bo ma lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang gi brjod par byed pa las dngos po'i ngo bo ma lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the thing is completely expressed by the expression of the thing.

original: dngos po'i nus pa'i dngos po ni stobs las so //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa'i dngos po ni stobs las so //
translated: The thing that is the capacity of the thing is from the power.

original: dngos po'i cha med pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i cha med pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the apprehended object and apprehending subject are in a partless thing.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par gcod pa brjod par bya ba yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa byed pa ni sgra 'bras bu du ma can dang rten gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par gcod pa brjod par bya ba yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa byed pa ni sgra 'bras bu du ma can dang rten gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the reason for the expression of the exclusion is that, therefore, the maker of the exclusion is the sound that has many results and one basis.

original: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid ni sgra'i don gzhan sel ba nyid la rigs so zhes smras pa @152b yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid ni sgra'i don gzhan sel ba nyid la rigs so zhes smras pa @152b yin no //
translated: This is the explanation: ‚ÄúThe common locus is reasonable in the meaning of the sound exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed de /
translated: For example, etc.

original: blo la yongs su gnas pa phyi dang nang tha dad pa 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: blo la yongs su gnas pa phyi dang nang tha dad pa 'dres pa ste /
translated: The internal and external different mixed,

original: gcig tu gyur pa lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang la yod pa de la'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang la yod pa de la'o //
translated: as if they were one, is the conceptual mind.

original: rang nyid kyi snang ba la sgra'i don te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi snang ba la sgra'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the sound is in one‚Äôs own appearance.

original: sgra'i brjod par bya ba nye bar sbyor bar byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra'i brjod par bya ba nye bar sbyor bar byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to and establishes the object of expression of the word.

original: tha snyad kyi yul ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yul ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is the object of conventional usage?

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid dang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po'i tha snyad du rung ba'o //
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid dang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po'i tha snyad du rung ba'o //
translated: It is the object of conventional usage of universals, co-presence, particulars, and substrates.

original: ji ltar zhe na don byed par rung bar nges par byas nas te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na don byed par rung bar nges par byas nas te /
translated: How is that? Having ascertained the suitability of the object for effective action.

original: don gyi bya ba mi byed pa yin du zin kyang don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid du bzung nas so //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba mi byed pa yin du zin kyang don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid du bzung nas so //
translated: Even though it does not perform the function of the object, it is taken as if it did perform the function of the object.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la'o //
translated: In that very thing means in the object of the conceptual consciousness.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa na zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa na zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu de dang de dag gis 'dres pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu de dang de dag gis 'dres pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang ba ste /
translated: It appears as if mixed with those and those causes of error.

original: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyus brtags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dres pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang bar 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyus brtags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dres pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang bar 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: It is when there is the appearance of a nature that is mixed with the aspects of the superimpositions of the causes of error, such as the arising of another similar entity.

original: brda ji lta ba bzhin du gang la rnam par gcod par byed pa'i brdar byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra de dag gi byed pa gang yin no //
analyzed: brda ji lta ba bzhin du gang la rnam par gcod par byed pa'i brdar byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgra de dag gi byed pa gang yin no //
translated: The function of those words such as impermanent is the exclusion of the opposite, which is the exclusion of what is not that, in regard to that which is designated by the word in accordance with the convention.

original: brda dang rjes su mthun par bstan par bya ba'i phyir gcig gis bsgrub pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: brda dang rjes su mthun par bstan par bya ba'i phyir gcig gis bsgrub pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to teach in accordance with the convention, he says, ‚ÄúEven when one is established by a single word,‚Äù and so on.

original: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir brdar ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa de'i phyir sgra gcig gis sgrub pa na sgras gzhan rnam par gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brdar ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa de'i phyir sgra gcig gis sgrub pa na sgras gzhan rnam par gcod par mi byed do //
translated: Because one acts in accordance with the convention, when one is established by a single word, the word does not exclude others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda so sor nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brda so sor nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the convention is individually determined.

original: gcig cig rnam par gcod pa la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig cig rnam par gcod pa la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a word is applied to the exclusion of one thing.

original: tha snyad la yang rnam par gcod pa de dang de nyid khong du chud par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad la yang rnam par gcod pa de dang de nyid khong du chud par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that exclusion is understood in conventional usage as well.

original: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas rtags kyis kyang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas rtags kyis kyang zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since the word ‚Äúword‚Äù is merely an illustration, it should be understood that the word ‚Äúsign‚Äù is also included.

original: gzhan rnam par gcod pa tsam brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcod pa tsam brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that mere exclusion of other is to be expressed.

original: 'on kyang de dngos po khyad par can yin pa de bas na sgra'i don gzhan sel ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par brjod pa de'i gnas @153a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dngos po khyad par can yin pa de bas na sgra'i don gzhan sel ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par brjod pa de'i gnas @153a * //
translated: However, since that is a particular entity, the expression of the entity of the exclusion of other by the power of the word occurs in that context.

original: skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the word ‚Äúentity‚Äù should be stated.

original: dngos po rnam par gcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par gcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says ‚Äúby the exclusion of entity,‚Äù and so on.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: sgra 'am rtags kyi dngos po cung zhig rnam par gcad pa 'phangs pa med pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgra 'am rtags kyi dngos po cung zhig rnam par gcad pa 'phangs pa med pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: It is indeed the case that a word or sign does not imply the exclusion of some other entity.

original: dngos po gang gi rjod par byed pa dang / dngos po'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: dngos po gang gi rjod par byed pa dang / dngos po'i stobs kyis te /
translated: The expression of any entity is by the power of the entity.

original: dngos po 'phangs pa ni dngos po'i cha med pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po 'phangs pa ni dngos po'i cha med pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The entity is projected, because of the non-differentiation of the entity. All dharmas are realized,

original: chos rnams de las ma log pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par rnam par bzlog pa yang //
analyzed: chos rnams de las ma log pa'i phyir ro // khyad par rnam par bzlog pa yang //
translated: because the dharmas do not turn away from that.üîΩThe reversal of the distinctions

original: khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i //
analyzed: khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i //
translated: is the reversal of the distinctions of the various benefits.

original: yan lag nus las mi gzhan pa //
analyzed: yan lag nus las mi gzhan pa //
translated: The parts are not different from the capacity.

original: bdag nyid kun tu bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad gzung ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kun tu bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad gzung ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe self is apprehended as all‚Äù and so on proves the apprehension of all.

original: ci'i phyir sgra dag gis dngos po 'phangs pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra dag gis dngos po 'phangs pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the words do not project the entity?

original: sgra rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe words . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo snang ba'i rnam pa dngos po med pa'i phyir blo bslad pa'i yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo snang ba'i rnam pa dngos po med pa'i phyir blo bslad pa'i yin no //
translated: The words are of a confused mind, because the aspect of the appearance of the conceptual mind is not an entity.

original: gal te ci'i phyir blo'i bslad pa'i brjod par bya ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir blo'i bslad pa'i brjod par bya ba'i dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you ask why, it is because the object that is the basis of expression is not understood in its entirety by the power of the object.

original: snang ba'i rnam par yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the aspect that appears is not different from consciousness,

original: shes pa dang 'dra bar dngos po de brjod pa na dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par rtogs pa 'thob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa dang 'dra bar dngos po de brjod pa na dngos po'i stobs kyis ma lus par rtogs pa 'thob pa ma yin nam /
translated: when that object is expressed as being like consciousness, is it not the case that one obtains an understanding of it in its entirety by the power of the object?

original: thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thob pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not obtained.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe shes pa de las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe shes pa de las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Because when it is the intrinsic identity of that consciousness by being nondifferent from it,

original: shes pa dang 'dra bar rang rig pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes pa dang 'dra bar rang rig pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: it is reflexive awareness, like consciousness.

original: de ni phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not an object of expression, like an external intrinsic identity.

original: de ni phyi rol gyi don nyid du zhen par byas nas phyi rol gyi spyi zhes bya bar snang ba na sgra las skyes pa'i blo la snang ba'i phyir sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi don nyid du zhen par byas nas phyi rol gyi spyi zhes bya bar snang ba na sgra las skyes pa'i blo la snang ba'i phyir sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Having conceived that it is an external object, when it appears as an external universal, it is not the referent of a word because it appears to the awareness produced from the word.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de ni de brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de ni de brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not the referent of that word from the perspective of being the nature of consciousness.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir //üîΩrang rig nyid la rtog mi 'dod //
analyzed: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir // rang rig nyid la rtog mi 'dod //
translated: Because it is a conception of an object,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: it is not asserted to be a conception of reflexive awareness.

original: gal te sgra thams cad blo'i bslad pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra thams cad blo'i bslad pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: If all words are the domain of the contamination of awareness,

original: ji ltar byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i @153b sgra dag yang dag pa'i don la ma 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i @153b sgra dag yang dag pa'i don la ma 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: how are words such as produced and impermanent unmistaken with regard to their real object?

original: de'i phyir tha snyad 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThis conventional expression,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma byas pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa de de las don tha dad pa nyams su myong ba'i sgo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa de de las don tha dad pa nyams su myong ba'i sgo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the experience of that which is not produced, permanent, and so on is different from that.

original: 'di ni tha snyad ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is what is called ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: chos du ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos du ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúmany and one,‚Äù etc.

original: du ma yang yin la gcig kyang yin pas na du ma dang gcig go //
analyzed: du ma yang yin la gcig kyang yin pas na du ma dang gcig go //
translated: Since it is many and also one, it is many and one.

original: de yang yin la chos kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la chos kyang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since it is that and also a phenomenon, it is a phenomenon.

original: de nas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i sgra dag tshig gsum zlas dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de nas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ma yin pa'i sgra dag tshig gsum zlas dbye ba ste /
translated: Then, the words ‚Äúnot different‚Äù and ‚Äúnot non-different‚Äù are a threefold repetition.

original: chos du ma dang gcig dang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos du ma dang gcig dang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The phenomena are many and one, different and not different.

original: blo la so sor snang ba'i phyir snang ba'o //
analyzed: blo la so sor snang ba'i phyir snang ba'o //
translated: Since they appear individually to the mind, they appear.

original: de nyid 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'khrul pa ste /
translated: That itself is delusion.

original: bslad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bslad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since it is itself adulterated,

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam pa des 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam pa des 'jug pa'o //
translated: its consequence is the engagement of that aspect.

original: phyir ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: de ste tha snyad der 'brel par gyur pa de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid der brgyud pas 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod na de ma 'khrul te /
analyzed: de ste tha snyad der 'brel par gyur pa de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid der brgyud pas 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod na de ma 'khrul te /
translated: If there were such a relation of inherence in the intrinsic identity of that which is related to the convention, then it would not be erroneous.

original: dngos po la ma 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ma 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: It would not be erroneous with respect to the thing.

original: ji ltar byas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sgra la ma bslad pa yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sgra la ma bslad pa yin pa de ltar /
translated: Just as the word having the aspect of ‚Äúproduced‚Äù and so on is unmistaken,

original: dngos po dag kyang byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor don dam par yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ma 'khrul par blta bar bya ba'i sgra la 'jug pa na gdon mi za bar dngos po dang phrad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dag kyang byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor don dam par yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ma 'khrul par blta bar bya ba'i sgra la 'jug pa na gdon mi za bar dngos po dang phrad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: so too, things would be seen as unmistaken in the aspect of having the nature of the produced and so on ultimately. When the word is applied, it is not necessarily in contact with the thing,

original: dngos po med par yang 'dod pa'i rgyu can gyis sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang 'dod pa'i rgyu can gyis sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to apply it through the power of desire even in the absence of a thing.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya pa'i phyir de bzhin du ma yin pa de las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya pa'i phyir de bzhin du ma yin pa de las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, it is not so from that which is not so,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way, it is not so‚Äù means from error.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni blo'i bslad pa'i yul sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las so ;
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni blo'i bslad pa'i yul sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las so ;
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the convention that arises from the object of the contamination of the mind.

original: /'jug pa'i mthar te /
analyzed: /'jug pa'i mthar te /
translated: ‚ÄúAt the end of engagement‚Äù means

original: 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs na yang dag pa nyid kyi dngos po yin gyi ma byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs na yang dag pa nyid kyi dngos po yin gyi ma byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: that when engagement is complete, it is a real entity, not an unreal entity such as nonaction.

original: 'dis ni ma 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: This teaches the nature of nonerror.

original: shes pa ma bslus pa'i phyir te /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i @154a * //
analyzed: shes pa ma bslus pa'i phyir te / rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i @154a * //
translated: Because it is nondeceptive cognition,

original: shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates cognition that apprehends its own characteristics.

original: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba 'di nyid kyang gzhi mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra'i don gzhan sel ba 'di nyid kyang gzhi mthun pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this exclusion of other, the meaning of words, is a common locus of proof but is not a real thing, he says,

original: rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is the apprehension of different aspects.‚Äù

original: rnam pa tha dad pa ni yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag ni dngos po gcig gi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa ni yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag ni dngos po gcig gi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The different aspects are the object of a single thing, because the cognition and the word that apprehend the cause of the application of the word, such as quality, class, etc., have the same object.

original: gal te rnam pa tha dad pa can gyi shes pa dngos po gcig gi yul la 'jug pa de bas na de'i rjes su 'brangs nas sgra yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba da ltar na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa tha dad pa can gyi shes pa dngos po gcig gi yul la 'jug pa de bas na de'i rjes su 'brangs nas sgra yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba da ltar na /
translated: If the cognition that has different aspects engages the object that is a single thing, then following that, the word would also be like that.

original: sgra 'bras bu du ma can rten gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sgra 'bras bu du ma can rten gcig pa ste /
translated: The word would have multiple effects and a single basis,

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang med de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang med de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but that is not so, because that is contradictory.

original: de ltar na autpala dang sngon po'i sgra dag dngos po gcig gam du ma brjod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar na autpala dang sngon po'i sgra dag dngos po gcig gam du ma brjod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, the words ‚Äúlotus‚Äù and ‚Äúblue‚Äù would be said to be either one thing or many.

original: phyogs dang po ni gcig kho nas dngos po cha med pa bdag nyid thams cad brjod pa'i phyir sgra gnyis mi 'jug pa'am 'jug pa rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu du ma can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang po ni gcig kho nas dngos po cha med pa bdag nyid thams cad brjod pa'i phyir sgra gnyis mi 'jug pa'am 'jug pa rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu du ma can nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the first case, since a single thing is said to be the nature of all things, the two terms are not used, or if they are used, they are synonymous. Therefore, the word does not have many effects.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la rten gcig pa med de bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la rten gcig pa med de bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du sna tshogs pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the second case, there is no single basis, because the word is like the words pot and cloth, etc., and has a variety of objects.

original: ci ste sngo ba'i sgras sngon po'i yon tan khyad par can gyi rdzas dang autpala la'i sgras autpala nyid rigs khyad par can gyi rdzas de yang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste sngo ba'i sgras sngon po'i yon tan khyad par can gyi rdzas dang autpala la'i sgras autpala nyid rigs khyad par can gyi rdzas de yang smras pa yin no //
translated: If one says that the word blue refers to a substance that is a special quality of blue, and the word lotus refers to a substance that is a special type of lotus,

original: de bas na khyad par dag tha dad pa 'bras bu du ma'i sgra khyad par gzhi tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rten gcig pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de yang bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par dag tha dad pa 'bras bu du ma'i sgra khyad par gzhi tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rten gcig pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de yang bden pa ma yin no //
translated: then the difference in the terms is not due to a difference in the basis of the terms, because the word has many effects. Therefore, the assertion that the word has a single basis is not true.

original: de ltar na sngon po'i yon tan khyad par can gyi rdzas sngo ba'i sgras brjod par 'gyur ba na bdag nyid thams cad bstan par 'gyur te cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po'i yon tan khyad par can gyi rdzas sngo ba'i sgras brjod par 'gyur ba na bdag nyid thams cad bstan par 'gyur te cha shas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Thus, when the word blue expresses the substance that is the special quality of blue, it would indicate the entire nature of the substance, because it is partless.

original: de bas na rdzas autpala nyid kyi rigs kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i bdag nyid ma brjod pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de bas na rdzas autpala nyid kyi rigs kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i bdag nyid ma brjod pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Therefore, what is it that is not expressed by the substance itself, which is distinguished by the type of lotus?

original: gang autpala la'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir de ltar na rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang autpala la'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir de ltar na rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is argued that it is the substance that is distinguished by the type of lotus, then it would be a mere synonym.

original: 'on te khyad par tha dad pas khyad par gyi gzhi rdzas tha dad pa de lta na yang rten gcig pa nyid du mi @154b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par tha dad pas khyad par gyi gzhi rdzas tha dad pa de lta na yang rten gcig pa nyid du mi @154b 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the substance is distinguished by a different distinction, then even though it is different, it would not be different in terms of its basis of distinction.

original: gzhan sel ba smra ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba smra ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show that there is no fault for the proponents of other-exclusion, it says as explained and so on.

original: sgra'i don gang la blo'i snang ba la brten pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don gang la blo'i snang ba la brten pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the word is that which is based on the appearance of cognition.

original: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no fault, he says:

original: gcig cig rnam gcod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig cig rnam gcod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When one exclusion is indicated by a single word,üîΩthe exclusion of another is not engaged.

original: sgra gcig gis sngon po ma yin pa gcig cig rnam par gcad pa ston pa na gzhan autpala ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa spong ba la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sgra gcig gis sngon po ma yin pa gcig cig rnam par gcad pa ston pa na gzhan autpala ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa spong ba la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: When one exclusion of non-blue is indicated by a single word, the exclusion of non-lotus is not engaged, i.e., it is not made.

original: sel bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sel bar mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúit does not make.‚Äù

original: des ni ste sngo ba'i sgras so //
analyzed: des ni ste sngo ba'i sgras so //
translated: By that, i.e., by the word ‚Äúblue,‚Äù

original: de ni autpa la ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de ni autpa la ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa khyab pa ste /
translated: there is the pervasion of the exclusion of non-lotus.

original: gnod par gyur na autpala ma yin pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba la ni blo gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod par gyur na autpala ma yin pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba la ni blo gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: When there is no contradiction, the application of the word ‚Äúnon-lotus‚Äù will appear as a single cognition,

original: rnam par gcod pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig nyid rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig nyid rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i phyir /
translated: because a single property-possessor endowed with two exclusions appears to the conceptual cognition.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe blo'i ngo bor byas nas gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe blo'i ngo bor byas nas gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is the case, then having made it the nature of cognition, there is a common locus.

original: de skad du sngon po'i sgra'i sbyor ba la blos so sor snang ba can gyi chos can sngon po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du sngon po'i sgra'i sbyor ba la blos so sor snang ba can gyi chos can sngon po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the application of the term ‚Äúblue,‚Äù the entity that is the opposite of non-blue appears to the mind.

original: sngon po'i sgras autpala la ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa sgrub par yang mi byed spong bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sngon po'i sgras autpala la ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa sgrub par yang mi byed spong bar yang mi byed do //
translated: The term ‚Äúblue‚Äù neither affirms nor denies the exclusion of non-blue with regard to the lotus.

original: autpala'i sgra'i sbyor ba las kyang autpala ma yin pa ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: autpala'i sgra'i sbyor ba las kyang autpala ma yin pa ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the application of the term ‚Äúlotus,‚Äù the entity that is the opposite of non-lotus appears to the mind.

original: sgras sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa sgrub par yang mi byed 'dor bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sgras sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa sgrub par yang mi byed 'dor bar yang mi byed do //
translated: The term ‚Äúlotus‚Äù neither affirms nor denies the exclusion of non-blue.

original: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba gnyis pa las kyang /
analyzed: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba gnyis pa las kyang /
translated: In the application of the term ‚Äúblue lotus,‚Äù

original: sgro btags pa gnyi ga ldog pa gcig snang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa gnyi ga ldog pa gcig snang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: a conceptual cognition arises that has the appearance of the exclusion of both superimpositions.

original: sgra 'bras bu dum can dang / rten gcig par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: sgra 'bras bu dum can dang / rten gcig par 'gyur ba na /
translated: Therefore, when the term has two results, it has a single basis.

original: de ltar blo'i ngor byas nas gzhi mthun pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de ltar blo'i ngor byas nas gzhi mthun pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro//
translated: Thus, it is shown that there is a common locus from the perspective of the mind.

original: gzhan yang sgra ni sgro btags pa rnam par gcod par byed par khas blangs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra ni sgro btags pa rnam par gcod par byed par khas blangs par gyur pa na /
translated: Moreover, when one accepts that a word eliminates superimpositions,

original: dngos po chos tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i chos rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po chos tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i chos rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: one would know a property of a thing that is a different nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni de la yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni de la yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it exists in that.‚Äù

original: de yod pa ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pa ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: Its existence is different.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni @155a * //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni @155a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù means

original: dngos po ste /
analyzed: dngos po ste /
translated: in a thing.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po thams cad rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po thams cad rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By nature, all things are excluded from things of the same type and things of a different type.

original: spyi'i dngos po gcig rjod par byed pa'i sgra khas blangs pa na dngos po'i chos yang reg pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po gcig rjod par byed pa'i sgra khas blangs pa na dngos po'i chos yang reg pa ma yin te /
translated: When one accepts a word that expresses a single universal thing, one does not touch the property of a thing,

original: spyi'i dngos po gcig ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po gcig ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because a single universal thing does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo la snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo la snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the appearance to the mind.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù because of the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the object.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sgra'i don dngos po la skyon yod pa de'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i yul te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sgra'i don dngos po la skyon yod pa de'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i yul te /
translated: Since the meaning of the word is thus faulty in regard to the entity, therefore the object of the exclusion of other,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba'i yul can sgra dag dang blo dag slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bstan to /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba'i yul can sgra dag dang blo dag slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bstan to /
translated: the object of the cognition that appears in the form of a word, has been taught by Master DignƒÅga as the object of words and cognitions.

original: blo ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: blo ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition like?

original: spyi'i spyod yul can bstan te /
analyzed: spyi'i spyod yul can bstan te /
translated: It is taught to have a universal for its domain,

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúconceptual.‚Äù

original: khyad par de dag ni blo dag gi yin gyi sgra dag gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par de dag ni blo dag gi yin gyi sgra dag gi ni ma yin te /
translated: Those distinctions are of the cognitions, not of the words,

original: de dag ni spyi'i yul nyid du 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni spyi'i yul nyid du 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not mistaken in regard to the domain of universals.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po la de dag ste /
analyzed: dngos po la de dag ste /
translated: Because they are in regard to the entity,

original: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since words and conceptualization are impossible.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni 'dir zhes bya pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dngos po stobs kyis rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dir zhes bya pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dngos po stobs kyis rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here refers to all the topics that have just been presented. It follows that all of them would be established by the power of fact.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pa dang / tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pa dang / tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the nonexistence of the thing that is the basis of the distinction and the distinguished, the nonengagement of other valid cognitions, and so on.

original: mdzad pa po slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa po slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'o //
translated: The author is the master DignƒÅga.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni blo dang sgra'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni blo dang sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the mind and words.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad 'dod pa dag gis dngos po gcig yul du byed pa de ltar sgras kyang brjod par bya ba yin gyi de'i tshe sgra 'bras bu tha dad pa can dag rdzas gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad 'dod pa dag gis dngos po gcig yul du byed pa de ltar sgras kyang brjod par bya ba yin gyi de'i tshe sgra 'bras bu tha dad pa can dag rdzas gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur na /
translated: In this way, those who assert all aspects are saying that one thing is the object of the mind and is also expressed by words. At that time, because words that have different effects engage one substance, there would be a common locus.

original: de ni mi srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni mi srid par 'gyur te /
translated: That is impossible.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i brjod par bya ba de spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal ba las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i brjod par bya ba de spyi'i mtshan nyid gsal ba las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this way, the object of expression of words would be either different from or the same as the particular.

original: de la phyogs dang po ni dngos po ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgang las tha dad pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni dngos po ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir / gang las tha dad pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The first position is that because the entity is a single nature,

original: spyi'i @155b phyir khyad par gyi rnam pa tha dad par 'dod /
analyzed: spyi'i @155b phyir khyad par gyi rnam pa tha dad par 'dod /
translated: it is asserted that the different aspects of the particular are differentüîΩfrom the universal because of the generality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no /
translated: The universal is not different from the particular.

original: khra bo'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par khu yu'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par gang las ldog pa de nyid /
analyzed: khra bo'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par khu yu'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par gang las ldog pa de nyid /
translated: The particular that has the nature of variegated color is different from the particular that has the nature of a cow.

original: khra bo'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi pa lang nyid rjes su 'gro ba de ltar na ;
analyzed: khra bo'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi pa lang nyid rjes su 'gro ba de ltar na ;
translated: The universal that has the nature of variegated color is concomitant with the universal that is a cow.üîΩIn that case, it is not logical for the concomitant and the reverse to have the same basis in a single object.

original: don gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gzhi gcig pa can yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gzhi gcig pa can yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, ‚ÄúIt is not logical for the concomitant and the reverse to be the same,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang la don gcig pa'i spyod yul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang la don gcig pa'i spyod yul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the same object of operation for the concomitant and the reverse is called that.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúThat is . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gcig nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir cha med pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir cha med pa yin te /
translated: Because it is one, it is partless,

original: gcig la cha'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la cha'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a partless thing does not exist in one.

original: kun btags nas byas pa'i phyir na rnam pa ste blo'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: kun btags nas byas pa'i phyir na rnam pa ste blo'i snang ba'o //
translated: Because it is fabricated by imputation, it is an aspect, that is, an appearance to the mind.

original: de'i tha dad pa ni de la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro//
analyzed: de'i tha dad pa ni de la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro//
translated: Its difference is based on that.

original: tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Difference‚Äù means the diversity of things.

original: gal te rnam pa tha dad pa'i blo dag gis gzung na tha dad par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa tha dad pa'i blo dag gis gzung na tha dad par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were apprehended by different cognitions of different aspects, it would be different. But that is not the case.

original: dngos po de yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that thing is not different.

original: gal te sngon po nyid dang autpala nyid la sogs pa spyi tha dad pa gcig kyang tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i blos gzung ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po nyid dang autpala nyid la sogs pa spyi tha dad pa gcig kyang tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i blos gzung ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the difference of the universals such as blueness and lotuses and so on is apprehended by different cognitions of different aspects,

original: spyi ni de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi ni de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe universal is not . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid de ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid de ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that which has the nature of intrinsic reality is the same as that which is established and blissful.

original: de dang 'dra bar kho nar tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar kho nar tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Because it is just like that, it is non-different.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ro//
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: 'di ni gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: This is not the same basis, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun spangs pa ni gcig la gcig spangs pa dang / tha da par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa ni gcig la gcig spangs pa dang / tha da par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Mutually exclusive means mutually abandoned, up to the reason for engaging in difference.

original: rdzas gcig la brten pa'i don yul gcig la sgra 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig la brten pa'i don yul gcig la sgra 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a word to engage one object that is based on one substance.

original: gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha dngos po'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha dngos po'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: The part of the verse beginning with ‚Äúone is the same as‚Äù is explained by the part beginning with ‚Äúthe nature of reality.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe dngos po'i bdag nyid gcig kho na rnag gi mtshan nyid kho na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa @156a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po'i bdag nyid gcig kho na rnag gi mtshan nyid kho na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa @156a * //
translated: When the very identity of a thing is the very characteristic of the particular, and that is the characteristic of the universal,

original: de'i tshe / khra bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ba lang nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir khu yu de nyid la 'jug pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid la yang mi 'jug pa thob pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe / khra bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ba lang nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir khu yu de nyid la 'jug pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid la yang mi 'jug pa thob pa de'i tshe /
translated: then, because the universal cow is the characteristic of the particular cow with variegated color, it would follow that the universal would apply to the individual cow with variegated color, and because it is the characteristic of the particular, it would follow that the universal would not apply to the individual cow with variegated color.

original: de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so //
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of contradiction, because it is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: gal te gcig ni gcig la 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na spyi ni rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir gzhan du mi 'jug pa na yang spyi nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te gcig ni gcig la 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar na spyi ni rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir gzhan du mi 'jug pa na yang spyi nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
translated: If the universal were to apply to one thing and not apply to another, then because the universal would not be different from the particular, it would not apply to another. Therefore, because it does not apply to another, it would not be a universal.

original: gal te spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe universal . . . ‚Äù and so on,

original: de bas na gcig la 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa med do zhes bya bar la sems ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gcig la 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa med do zhes bya bar la sems ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no engagement or non-engagement of a single thing.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis te /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúNo, etc.‚Äù

original: grangs can gyis 'dod pa la spyi dang khyad par dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can gyis 'dod pa la spyi dang khyad par dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the universal and the particular are not different.

original: ngo bo gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //üîΩde ni autpala sogs pa'i dngos po ngo bo gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi gzhung 'dzugs pa'o // de ni autpala sogs pa'i dngos po ngo bo gcig pa ste /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúIf they are of one nature, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThat is, if the universal and the particular are of one nature, they are of one nature.üîΩIf they are of one nature, they are either a universal or a particular.

original: bdag nyid gcig par 'gyur ba spyi'am khyad par du 'gyur grang na ste khyad par ni spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir spyi nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig par 'gyur ba spyi'am khyad par du 'gyur grang na ste khyad par ni spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir spyi nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If they are a universal, then the particular is not different from the universal, so it is just a universal.

original: spyi khyad par can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir khyad par kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: spyi khyad par can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir khyad par kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: If they are a particular, then the universal is not different from the particular, so it is just a particular.üîΩBut if they are of one nature, then they are contradictory.

original: gcig la 'gal ba'i ngo bo ni yod pa na gang gi phyir ngo bo tha dad pa med pa 'di la ni rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gcig la 'gal ba'i ngo bo ni yod pa na gang gi phyir ngo bo tha dad pa med pa 'di la ni rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in this case, where there is no difference in nature, there is no division

original: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: called ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù and ‚Äúparticular.‚Äù

original: spyi dang khyad par dag gis rab tu dbye ba yod na yang tha dad pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dag gis rab tu dbye ba yod na yang tha dad pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: If there were a classification by way of the general and the particular, it would not be non-different. This has been explained above.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-differentiation‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout parts.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i bdag nyid do //üîΩgal te spyi nyid yin pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i bdag nyid do // gal te spyi nyid yin pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the nature of the entity.

original: gsal ba gzhan la 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is a universal, then it would be a universal that goes to another manifestation.

original: 'on te khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, if it is the nature of a particular, then it would not be a universal.

original: gcig pa 'gal ba'i chos gnyis po de mi srid do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gcig pa 'gal ba'i chos gnyis po de mi srid do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is impossible for those two contradictory properties to be in one thing.

original: de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /üîΩ// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so /üîΩ// / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: He says just that in ‚ÄúIt is also without a universal.‚Äù

original: gang yang zhes bya ba @156b ni bye brag pa la sogs pas sgra brjod par bya ba spyi ni rdzas las tha dad pa nyid yin par smra ste /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba @156b ni bye brag pa la sogs pas sgra brjod par bya ba spyi ni rdzas las tha dad pa nyid yin par smra ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù refers to the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc., who claim that the universal that is the referent of a word is a different substance from the particular.

original: spyi dag gsal ba las tha dad par khas blangs par gyur na /
analyzed: spyi dag gsal ba las tha dad par khas blangs par gyur na /
translated: If one accepts that universals are different from particulars,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad de gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad de gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the convention of nondifference and the convention of common locus would be without cause.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya bar ni zlos pa'i don gyi zad par mi 'gyur ba'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya bar ni zlos pa'i don gyi zad par mi 'gyur ba'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as they are‚Äù is a redundant statement that is used to indicate that the meaning of the word is exhausted.

original: de ltar autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phan tshun tha dad pa spyi brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phan tshun tha dad pa spyi brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus the words ‚Äúlotus‚Äù and ‚Äúblue,‚Äù etc., refer to the universal that is just like the lotus and blue, etc., in being mutually different.

original: gang gi tshe sngon po'i yon tan brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe don tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon po'i yon tan brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe don tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: When one wishes to refer to the quality of blue, then the referent is different.

original: don de yul dang gcig ste /
analyzed: don de yul dang gcig ste /
translated: That referent is the same object as the universal.

original: chos can blo gang la yod pa de ni don gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos can blo gang la yod pa de ni don gcig pa'o //
translated: That which exists in the mind that is the basis is the same referent.

original: don gcig pa yang de yin la blo yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don gcig pa yang de yin la blo yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The compound ‚Äúone object and one cognition‚Äù is a karmadhƒÅraya compound.

original: de'i rten te rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i rten te rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that be the basis or cause of that?

original: de bas na gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention of the opponent that there would be no common locus.

original: gal te autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi yul can gyi blo skyed par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te autpala dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi yul can gyi blo skyed par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the words ‚Äúlotus‚Äù and ‚Äúblue,‚Äù etc., generate a cognition that has as its object a single property possessor that possesses two attributes,

original: don gcig ston pas gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang med do //
analyzed: don gcig ston pas gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang med do //
translated: then there would be a common locus because they would indicate the same object, but that is not the case.

original: gsal ba la don gzhan ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba la don gzhan ni spyi yin te /
translated: A universal is a different object from an instance.

original: de brjod pa na yang de rtogs pas tha dad pa dag la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de brjod pa na yang de rtogs pas tha dad pa dag la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: When it is stated, it is understood, and therefore it does not depend on different instances.

original: de yongs su spangs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni ltos pa'o //
translated: It is said that it engages by way of excluding that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no doubt.

original: gang gi tshe shing gi sgras shing nyid rjod pa de'i tshe de'i khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar shing dha pa la sogs par gzung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shing gi sgras shing nyid rjod pa de'i tshe de'i khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar shing dha pa la sogs par gzung bar 'gyur /
translated: When the word ‚Äútree‚Äù expresses a tree, then because it is not a qualifier, since there is no desire to express it, how could it be apprehended as a dhava tree, etc.?

original: ma bzung na yang ji ltar shing gi sgra'i don tha dad pa dha ba la sogs pa yin /
analyzed: ma bzung na yang ji ltar shing gi sgra'i don tha dad pa dha ba la sogs pa yin /
translated: And if it is not apprehended, how could it be the referent of the word ‚Äútree‚Äù?

original: tha dad pa med pa de las kyang ji ltar shing dang shing sha pa zhes bya ba khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa de las kyang ji ltar shing dang shing sha pa zhes bya ba khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir 'gyur /
translated: And how could it be a qualifier and the basis of a qualifier, since it is not different from that?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgal te spyis khyad par du gyur pa'i rdzas brjod pa'i phyir ji skad du brjod pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te spyis khyad par du gyur pa'i rdzas brjod pa'i phyir ji skad du brjod pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is not different, how could it be a qualifier?‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the error stated does not occur because the universal expresses the substance that is qualified by it, that is not so.

original: khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rdzas brjod pa na yang dngos @157a * //
analyzed: khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rdzas brjod pa na yang dngos @157a * //
translated: Because when the substance that is to be qualified is expressed, the universal is not apprehended.

original: po'i stobs kyi sgra gcig gis kyang ma lus par rtogs pa'i phyir sgra gzhan de la 'jug pa'am mi 'jug pa rnam grangs su 'gyur ro zhes lan bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: po'i stobs kyi sgra gcig gis kyang ma lus par rtogs pa'i phyir sgra gzhan de la 'jug pa'am mi 'jug pa rnam grangs su 'gyur ro zhes lan bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the sound of a single word of the powerful one comprehends all, so the engagement or non-engagement of other words is a matter of enumeration.

original: de bas na 'di ltar dngos po'i sgra don brjod pa la gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa ji ltar yang mi srid la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar dngos po'i sgra don brjod pa la gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa ji ltar yang mi srid la /
translated: Thus, in the expression of the meaning of a thing, the common locus and so on are impossible in any way,

original: spyi yang de dag la mi srid do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: spyi yang de dag la mi srid do zhes bstan te /
translated: and also a universal is impossible in them.
