original: de ltar na gang gi tshe re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid las spyi tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir spyi ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid las spyi tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir spyi ma yin la /
translated: Thus, when a universal is not different from its particular, then, like the particular, it does not pervade other particulars, and so it is not a universal.

original: tha dad na yang ji ltar na gzhan gyi spyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad na yang ji ltar na gzhan gyi spyir 'gyur te /
translated: And if it is different, how could it be the universal of another?

original: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i yin no //
analyzed: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i yin no //
translated: Because that would be too extreme a consequence.

original: ldog pa smra ba la yang nyes pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa smra ba la yang nyes pa med dam zhe na /
translated: But is there no fault in the theory of exclusion?

original: ldog pa kun las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ldog pa kun las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion from all others‚Äù and so on.

original: nyes pa de dag ces bya ba ni spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de dag ces bya ba ni spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose faults‚Äù are the absence of a universal and common locus, and so on.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig po ni ba lang gi khyad par te khra bo'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig po ni ba lang gi khyad par te khra bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù and so on is the particular of a cow, namely, a cow that is multicolored.

original: de las de ba lang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang ste /
analyzed: de las de ba lang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the nature of a cow that is different from the nature of a non-cow. In the same way, ‚Äúothers‚Äù are cows that are black and so on.

original: khu yu la sogs pa yin pa de bas na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par thams cad du 'dra ba de ltar na ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i blos thams cad du ngo bo 'dra ba nyid du sgro btags pa la
analyzed: khu yu la sogs pa yin pa de bas na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par thams cad du 'dra ba de ltar na ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i blos thams cad du ngo bo 'dra ba nyid du sgro btags pa la
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe exclusion from dissimilar things‚Äù is the same in all cases. In that case, the difference that is the characteristic of the exclusion is the superimposition by the conceptual mind that is the same in all cases.

original: spyi med pa'i nyes pa'ang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi med pa'i nyes pa'ang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the absence of a universal does not exist.

original: nyes pa lhag ma pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa lhag ma pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe remaining faults‚Äù are the absence of a common locus, and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously taught‚Äù refers to the following.

original: gcig cig rnam gcod ston pa na //
analyzed: gcig cig rnam gcod ston pa na //
translated: If one is taught through exclusion,

original: gang tshe gzhan slong mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan slong mi 'jug pa //
translated: When you do not give to others,üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one does not engage in requesting from others,‚Äù and so on.

original: ldog pa thams cad la 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta na yang dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa thams cad la 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta na yang dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is said that ‚Äúall exclusions are similar,‚Äù there is no entity,üîΩbecause, apart from the single universal that is the entity, one does not accept a single word for many entities.

original: dngos por 'gyur ba'i spyi gcig pu ma gtogs pa mang po dag la sgra gcig mi 'dod do zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ba'i spyi gcig pu ma gtogs pa mang po dag la sgra gcig mi 'dod do zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúNevertheless,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to demonstrate its effect,

original: 'bras bu gcig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the single effect is demonstrated.

original: tha dad 'bras bu gcig dag la ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba dag @157b la'o //
analyzed: tha dad 'bras bu gcig dag la ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba dag @157b la'o //
translated: The exclusion of those that are different and have a single effect is from that which is devoid of a single nature.

original: mkhas pa brda shes pa rnams kyis sgra 'dra ba gcig brdar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa brda shes pa rnams kyis sgra 'dra ba gcig brdar byas pa'o //
translated: The learned who understand the convention make a single conventional symbol for a similar word.

original: de'i 'bras bu dag ste tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dag ste tha dad pa'o //
translated: Those are its effects, which are different.

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa can dag las ldog pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa can dag las ldog pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The exclusion of those that do not have that effect is based on that cause.

original: ci'i phyir so sor gsal ba smos pa tha dad pa nyid kyi brdar ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir so sor gsal ba smos pa tha dad pa nyid kyi brdar ma byas she na /
translated: Why is the term ‚Äúdistinct‚Äù not used as a symbol for the individual?

original: dka' pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dka' pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of difficulty, etc.‚Äù

original: dka' ba dang mi nus pa dang / 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba dang mi nus pa dang / 'bras bu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of difficulty, impossibility, and futility.

original: tha dad pa dag bstan pa ni tha dad pa mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag bstan pa ni tha dad pa mnyan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of distinctness is the hearing of distinctness.

original: de yang 'grel pas gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'grel pas gsal bar bya'o //
translated: And that is clarified by the commentary.

original: dngos po med pa ste spyi'i dngos por gyur pa 'dra ba mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ste spyi'i dngos por gyur pa 'dra ba mnyan pa'o //
translated: The hearing of similarity, which is the non-entity, the general entity, is the hearing of the universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all entities are based on the nature of their own essence.

original: khra bo'i ngo bo'i gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa bstan pa de'i phyir spyi tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khra bo'i ngo bo'i gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa bstan pa de'i phyir spyi tha mi dad pa ma yin no //
translated: He demonstrates the basis of their own essence with ‚Äúthe variegated nature, etc.‚Äù Therefore, the universal is not distinct.

original: tha dad pa yin na yang rang nyid kyi ngo bo la gnas pa de ltar na ji ltar gsal ba rnams kyi spyi'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na yang rang nyid kyi ngo bo la gnas pa de ltar na ji ltar gsal ba rnams kyi spyi'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Even if it were distinct, it would be based on its own nature. In that case, how could it be the universal nature of the individuals?

original: gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag mtshungs pa ma yin zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag mtshungs pa ma yin zhes bshad do //
translated: and others are not similar to others.

original: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is not the cause of a cognition having a universal aspect is not its effect.

original: de dag las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las ldog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of those.

original: gnyis po zhes bya ba ni khra bo dang ser skya dag go //
analyzed: gnyis po zhes bya ba ni khra bo dang ser skya dag go //
translated: The two are the variegated and the tawny.

analyzed: de bas na de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las ldog pa tha dad pa dag kyang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de nyid don tha dad pa med pa na /

analyzed: sgra'i tha dad mi rigs te spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThe one that is the effect of many is not seen to be different from that which is not its effect.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba'i spyi yang yod pa ma yin no //

translated: Even though a universal that is a real entity does not exist, it is not contradictory for a single word to apply to things that are not of the same type.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúFor example, the eye and so on are said to be the effect of consciousness.‚Äù

analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa gang gi tshe'o //

translated: The eye consciousness that has that universal as its object is the single effect of the collection of causes. When it is possible for that to manifest, at that time, the eye and so on manifest as the uncommon effect. At that time, the single listener

translated: object is expressed by ‚Äúbecause there is no application of a word to differentüîΩobjects . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe point is that in order to understand different objects with distinct natures,

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i go rims bzhin du rnam par 'grel pa yin no //

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it fruitless?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBut,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba po 'dis 'bras bu gcig @159b po 'di la don de dag gi rgyur gyur pa bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de tsam ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba po 'dis 'bras bu gcig @159b po 'di la don de dag gi rgyur gyur pa bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de tsam ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is this: the agent of the performance shows that these meanings are the causes of this single result.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po de dag sgra gcig gam du mas brjod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di la /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po de dag sgra gcig gam du mas brjod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di la /
translated: As for the expression ‚ÄúAre those things that are causes expressed by a single word or by many words?,‚Äù

original: smra ba po rang rgyud kyis yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po rang rgyud kyis yin no //
translated: the speaker is autonomous.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na de'i phyir brjod par bya ba mang po dag la smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rgyu yis 'jug par 'gyur ba na mnyan pa gcig pu 'di la klan ka rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na de'i phyir brjod par bya ba mang po dag la smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis rgyu yis 'jug par 'gyur ba na mnyan pa gcig pu 'di la klan ka rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that is the case, therefore, when many things to be expressed are engaged by the power of the speaker‚Äôs intention, it is not right to object to this single hearing.

original: gal te mang po dag la mnyan pa gcig pu 'jug par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mang po dag la mnyan pa gcig pu 'jug par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúMany things to be expressed cannot be engaged by a single hearing,‚Äù

original: 'di la zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: then in response to that, it is said,üîΩ‚ÄúHere, too, there is no fault.‚Äù

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni thos pa gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni thos pa gcig ste /
translated: Here means a single hearing.

original: gang la 'jug pa'i nus pa med pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la 'jug pa'i nus pa med pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That which is engaged is called ‚Äúthat which lacks the ability to engage.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir 'jug par nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug par nus she na /
translated: Why is it possible to engage in it?

original: smras pa 'dod pa la rag lus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa 'dod pa la rag lus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is said: because it depends on desire.

original: 'dod pa la rag lus pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la rag lus pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
translated: For someone who depends on desire has the ability to engage in it.

original: 'dod pa la rag lus pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rag lus pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove that it depends on desire, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is the case that‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis kun brtags pa spyi gcig nyid la yang dngos po'i nus pas thos pa gcig 'jug pa ni med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis kun brtags pa spyi gcig nyid la yang dngos po'i nus pas thos pa gcig 'jug pa ni med la /
translated: Thus, even in the case of a single universal that is imagined by others, there is no single hearing that engages it through the power of things.

original: 'on kyang smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin na de med par gcig la yang mnyan pa gcig pu 'di ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin na de med par gcig la yang mnyan pa gcig pu 'di ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: However, if it is due to the power of the desire of the speaker, then how could this single hearing engage in it, even if it does not exist?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: It is only that it does not engage in it.

original: de la gcig la yang 'jug pa nyid du 'dod pa gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de la gcig la yang 'jug pa nyid du 'dod pa gang gi tshe /
translated: In that regard, when it is asserted that it engages in a single universal,

original: rgyu'i dngos po'i nus pas ma yin pa de'i tshe mang po dag las yang gdon pa 'ga' zhig kyang med par bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po'i nus pas ma yin pa de'i tshe mang po dag las yang gdon pa 'ga' zhig kyang med par bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is not by the power of the cause, then even from many there would be no production of any at all.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf you assert that the one is the cause of the many, then the one would be the cause of the many.‚Äù

original: gcig la yang 'jug pa nyid du 'dod pa rgyu nyid du brtag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la yang 'jug pa nyid du 'dod pa rgyu nyid du brtag par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one would be the cause of the many.

original: 'di lta ste mnyan pa gcig la'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mnyan pa gcig la'o //
translated: For example, in the case of one listener.

original: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause there is no need for the many,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po gcig la ma gtogs par mang po dag la sgra gcig dgod pa 'bras bu med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la ma gtogs par mang po dag la sgra gcig dgod pa 'bras bu med pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is no point in applying one word to many things without exception,

original: gong du bstan pa ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What was demonstrated above?

original: de'i dgos pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde'i dgos pa med pa can gyis tha dad @160a * //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de'i dgos pa med pa can gyis tha dad @160a * //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no need for the many,‚Äù etc.

original: pas tha dad pa khra bo la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dag ni ba lang gi sgra gcig las khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas tha dad pa khra bo la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dag ni ba lang gi sgra gcig las khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no need for the many, the difference of the different things, such as the variegated, would be understood from the one word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: rta la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la ba lang gi khyad par gyi bsgrub par bya ba rmo ba dang ba bzho ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dgos pa med par 'gyur ba'i tha dad pas so //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la ba lang gi khyad par gyi bsgrub par bya ba rmo ba dang ba bzho ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dgos pa med par 'gyur ba'i tha dad pas so //
translated: and the effect of the purpose, such as plowing and carrying, of those things such as horses, etc., would be purposeless because of their difference.

original: dngos po rang gi ngo bo gcig nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi ngo bo gcig nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is the identity of the nature of a thing not stated?

original: smras pa rang gi ngo bo nyid la yang gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa rang gi ngo bo nyid la yang gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: because identity does not exist even in its own nature.

original: spyi'i dngos por gyur pa nyid la yang gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i dngos por gyur pa nyid la yang gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because identity does not exist even in the nature of a universal.

original: spyi de nyid ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: spyi de nyid ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa dang mi ldan pas /
translated: That universal is not endowed with the exclusion and non-exclusion,

original: mang po dag la mnyan pas gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: mang po dag la mnyan pas gcig nyid yin no //
translated: and is heard in many things, so it is one.

original: spyi tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the universal would become different,

original: de lta na yang rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa ma 'dres pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa ma 'dres pa kho na yin te /
translated: even so, it would be only unmixed, abiding in its own nature.

original: de nyid ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: That itself is stated as ‚Äújust as it is by nature,‚Äù etc.

original: gang zhig gang gi mtshan nyid de gnas pa gcan gyi rang gi ngo bo dag phan tshun ngo bo 'dres pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi mtshan nyid de gnas pa gcan gyi rang gi ngo bo dag phan tshun ngo bo 'dres pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the essence of the object and the essence of the characteristic do not mutually mix.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa dag sgra'i rang bzhin gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan can spyi'i rgyu can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa dag sgra'i rang bzhin gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan can spyi'i rgyu can du 'gyur te /
translated: How could different things be the basis of a single sound, which is the reason for a universal?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: It is definitely not so.

original: gzhan ni gzhan dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Another is not similar to another.

original: de skad du /üîΩgang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: de skad du / gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: As it is said:üîΩBecause all things

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
translated: Abide in their own nature by their very nature,

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs su bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs su bstan to //
translated: This is taught in the section beginning with ‚ÄúBecause all things‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba smra ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde'i dgos pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba smra ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir / de'i dgos pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show that there is no fault for the proponents of other-exclusion, it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no contradiction in the exclusion of what is not its purpose‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de'i dgos pa med pa can dag las ldog pa ni tha dad pa dag la yang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa med pa can dag las ldog pa ni tha dad pa dag la yang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: There is no contradiction in the exclusion of what is not its purpose with regard to different things.

original: de'i dgos pa med pa can dag las tha dad pa de nyid don tha dad pa de'i dgos pa can dag yin pa ni ldog pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i tha dad pa med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa med pa can dag las tha dad pa de nyid don tha dad pa de'i dgos pa can dag yin pa ni ldog pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i tha dad pa med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: But because the difference of that which has a purpose from that which does not have a purpose is not different from the difference of the purpose, it would be the cause of the non-difference of the word.

original: gang gi phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de bas na pa lang gi khyad par 'di de'i dgos pa can /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de bas na pa lang gi khyad par 'di de'i dgos pa can /
translated: Since it is not tenable in any way that a universal is a real entity, therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThis particular of a cow has the purpose of that‚Äù

original: rmo ba dang bzho ba'i dgos pa can zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa can ma yin pa rta la sogs pa dag las tha @160b dad pa nyid du bstan gyi /
analyzed: rmo ba dang bzho ba'i dgos pa can zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa can ma yin pa rta la sogs pa dag las tha @160b dad pa nyid du bstan gyi /
translated: teaches that it has a purpose, but it does not teach that it is different from that which does not have a purpose, such as a horse.

original: de dag ni gzhan du de'i 'bras bu can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan du de'i 'bras bu can yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is the effect of that in another way,

original: gzhan du gzhan las tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan las tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is different from another.

original: gzhan dag las log pa kho na rigs mthun pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gzhan dag las tha dad par khyad par med du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag las log pa kho na rigs mthun pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gzhan dag las tha dad par khyad par med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is not different from other homogeneous things, such as form, taste, and so on, it is different from other heterogeneous things.

original: de'i dgos pa yan lag nyid de chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu khyad par can gyi yan lag nyid kyis de gzhan dag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu de byed pa'i nus pa med pa dag las so //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa yan lag nyid de chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu khyad par can gyi yan lag nyid kyis de gzhan dag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu de byed pa'i nus pa med pa dag las so //
translated: The purpose of that is the very part, because of being the very part of the special effect of holding water, etc., from those other things.

original: 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa nus pa gcig cig bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de ltar gzhan dag kyang bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa nus pa gcig cig bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de ltar gzhan dag kyang bum pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Just as form, etc., are to be expressed by the word pot, because of having the same capacity to hold water, etc., so also are the others to be expressed by the word pot,

original: thams cad 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all have the same effect.

original: de bas ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las thams cad kyi tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gis tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las thams cad kyi tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gis tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the difference of all from those which do not have that effect is the non-difference of them from those which do have that effect.

original: tha mi dad pa de las zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa de las zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From that non-difference, means from that non-difference.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig las khyad par med pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras gcig las khyad par med pa ste /
translated: The word pot is not different from one.

original: spyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, all forms and so on are realized.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi de las ma yin gtogs pa'i rdzas ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi de las ma yin gtogs pa'i rdzas ni med do //
translated: Only forms and so on exist, not substances that are not included in those.

original: gal te bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it is possible to have an exclusion such as the form of a vase and so on,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is that which begins with ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la yang ldog pa gang yin pa de'i don ni bum pa'i rang bzhin dag gzugs la sogs pa la yin gyi snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la yang ldog pa gang yin pa de'i don ni bum pa'i rang bzhin dag gzugs la sogs pa la yin gyi snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: In this case, the meaning of the exclusion of the form of a vase and so on is that the nature of a vase is in forms and so on, but it is not in the nature of a cloth and so on.

original: de nyid 'chad pa ni chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'chad pa ni chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúwater‚Äù and so on.

original: chu 'dzin pa'i khyad par bum pa las gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa'i khyad par bum pa las gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of a vase is not established by anything other than the particularity of holding water.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bum pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gzhan dag kyang yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bum pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gzhan dag kyang yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes other effects that are established by a vase.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point here is this.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad kyi gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya @161a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad kyi gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya @161a * //
translated: All words such as ‚Äúform‚Äù teach only the mere effect that is to be established as form, etc.,

original: ba'i 'bras bu tsam gyis nus pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa khyad par med par bstan cing /
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu tsam gyis nus pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa khyad par med par bstan cing /
translated: and they do not teach any particular form, etc., that is capable of producing that effect.

original: bum pa'i sgras kyang khyad par du byas pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pas /
analyzed: bum pa'i sgras kyang khyad par du byas pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pas /
translated: But the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù teaches a particular form, etc., that is capable of producing an effect that is qualified by that particularity.

original: snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag las tha dad pas khyad par du byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag las tha dad pas khyad par du byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù teaches a form, etc., that is different from the nature of cloth, etc.

original: de bas na bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sgra gnyis kyi bya bas spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa'i blo skye ba'i spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po la tha dad pa'i rten can gyi drug pa sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sgra gnyis kyi bya bas spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa'i blo skye ba'i spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po la tha dad pa'i rten can gyi drug pa sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the expression ‚Äúthe form of a pot,‚Äù the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is a sixth case tatpurusa compound, which is based on a difference between a universal and a particular, because it generates an awareness of a universal and a particular by means of the activity of two words.

original: de nyid ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: He demonstrates just that in the passage that begins with ‚ÄúA universal is . . .‚Äù

original: spyi'i 'bras bu ni gzugs la sogs pa tsam du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i 'bras bu ni gzugs la sogs pa tsam du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The universal effect is to be established as mere form, etc.

original: de bsgrub pa ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the proof.

original: de dag nyid kyi ngo bos rab tu grags pa'o //üîΩde lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi ngo bos rab tu grags pa'o // de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: It is well known by the nature of those.

original: gtan tshigs kyi gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third is the characteristic or reason of that kind.

original: ngo bor de lta bur gyur pas sam gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bor de lta bur gyur pas sam gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: By the nature of that kind or by the reason.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra rnams byed par 'gyur ba rnams kyis rab tu grags pa yod na khyad par du byas pa'i 'bras bu bum pa kho na'i bsgrub par bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra rnams byed par 'gyur ba rnams kyis rab tu grags pa yod na khyad par du byas pa'i 'bras bu bum pa kho na'i bsgrub par bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the words form, etc. are well known by the agents, the effect qualified by that, such as the mere pot to be established, is the bearer of water, etc. because it is established by that.

original: gang la ming de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la ming de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the name of that kind is called that.

original: des khyad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: des khyad par byas pa'o //
translated: It is qualified by that.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is form, etc.

original: de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de skad ces brjod do //
translated: It is called that.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs sam /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs sam /
translated: This is the collection of form, etc.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la'o //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la'o //
translated: Or it is the convention called pot.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i rdzas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the characteristics that have been explained‚Äù refers to a substance that is the opposite of form, etc.

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike that‚Äù refers to the opposite of form, etc.

original: de ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: de ni yan lag can no //
translated: That is the whole.

original: pha rol po dag gis yan lag can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur par yang 'dod de /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis yan lag can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur par yang 'dod de /
translated: The opponent also maintains that the whole is characterized by perception,

original: rdzas ni mthong ba dang reg pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni mthong ba dang reg pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he claims that a substance is perceived by sight and touch.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de bas na khas blangs pa gzugs la sogs pa ldog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de bas na khas blangs pa gzugs la sogs pa ldog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
translated: Since the whole is characterized by perception, the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the nonperception of the cessation of form, etc., that is accepted by the opponent‚Äù is as follows.

original: ji ltar @161b yan lag can med par yang rdul phra rab kho na mngon sum gyi yul yin par de ni le'u gsum pa la 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar @161b yan lag can med par yang rdul phra rab kho na mngon sum gyi yul yin par de ni le'u gsum pa la 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will explain in the third chapter how the atoms alone are the object of direct perception, even though the whole does not exist.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs de dag kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs de dag kho na yin na /
translated: If the collection of form, etc. is the object of direct perception,

original: ji ltar na de dag tha dad pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag tha dad pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: How is it that they are not different from each other?

original: de dag gis ni de'i phyir de 'bras can nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha bshad pa yin no //üîΩdper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de dag gis ni de'i phyir de 'bras can nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha bshad pa yin no // dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: They explain the verse that begins, ‚ÄúTherefore, it has an effect‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na mig la sogs pas ni //üîΩgzugs kyi rnam shes 'bras gcig can //
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pas ni // gzugs kyi rnam shes 'bras gcig can //
translated: For example, it is like the eye and so on.üîΩThe eye and so on have a single effect,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par byed do //
translated: the consciousness of form and so on.üîΩThe meeting of the self, the sense faculty, the mind, and the object

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang / don dag phrad par 'gyur ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rab tu grags pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang / don dag phrad par 'gyur ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rab tu grags pa bstan to //
translated: is well known to others.

original: gang dag la gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu gcig yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu gcig pa can te /
analyzed: gang dag la gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu gcig yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu gcig pa can te /
translated: Those that have a single effect of the consciousness of form and so on are those that have a single effect.

original: de dag gi thun mong ni khyad par mad par 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi thun mong ni khyad par mad par 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: Their commonality is the capacity to produce a single effect without distinction.

original: de ston pa ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ston pa ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: That which reveals that is the clarifier.

original: de'i srid par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i srid par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is its existence.

original: skabs gang du de ston pa yang srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skabs gang du de ston pa yang srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: When is it indicated?

original: gang las gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang las gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is indicated in the passage beginning ‚Äúthe consciousness of form.‚Äù

original: bye brag med pa'i tshogs par 'gyur ba'i dri ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i tshogs par 'gyur ba'i dri ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is a question about the collection without distinction, that is the meaning of the passage.üîΩThe meaning of the light collection is the meaning of one indicating many.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.

original: tha snyad tshogs chung bar bya ba'i don ni gcig gis mang po bstan par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad tshogs chung bar bya ba'i don ni gcig gis mang po bstan par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the light collection is the meaning of one indicating many.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,

original: ya nas ra'i bar ram /
analyzed: ya nas ra'i bar ram /
translated: or from the last to the first.

original: sha nas sa'i bar zhes bya ba mnyan pa 'god par 'gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sha nas sa'i bar zhes bya ba mnyan pa 'god par 'gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad zor yang ba nyid 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad zor yang ba nyid 'chad par byed de /
translated: The cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.üîΩThe cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,üîΩor from the last to the first.

original: de'i rgyu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rgyu dag go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rgyu dag go //
translated: The cause of the consciousness of form is the collection of the eye, etc.üîΩThe order is from the first to the last,

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: or from the last to the first

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo gang gis mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gis skyed par byed pa de lta bur gyur pa'i spyi ni mig la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo gang gis mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gis skyed par byed pa de lta bur gyur pa'i spyi ni mig la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal that is the nature of the cause of a single visual consciousness does not exist in the eye, etc.

original: gal te yod pa nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: If existence exists,

original: de thams cad bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'brel @162a * //
analyzed: de thams cad bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro // 'brel @162a * //
translated: then all would be visual consciousness, etc., because of the absence of any distinction.

original: pa can tha dad pas yod pa nyid kyang tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa can tha dad pas yod pa nyid kyang tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The difference of the related is not the difference of existence,

original: rtag pa'i phyir shin tu khyad par du bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir shin tu khyad par du bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent and cannot be distinguished at all.

original: 'on kyang de'i don gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i don gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis so //
translated: However, the eye, etc., are distinguished by the fact that they are the causes of a single effect, visual consciousness, etc.

original: de'i don ma yin pa gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag las mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i don ma yin pa gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa dag las mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The eye, etc., are distinguished from those that are not its cause, i.e., from those that do not generate visual consciousness, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa nyid tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The result of the action is the opposite of that which is not the result of the action.üîΩ

original: de dag ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don te thams cad dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog par mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩdper na spyi gcig po med par yang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don te thams cad dag la de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog par mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // dper na spyi gcig po med par yang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúsense-object‚Äù is that they are the objects of the eye, etc. All of them are similar in that they are distinguished from those that are not their effects.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la sgra dgod pa ltar tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la sgra dgod pa ltar tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, in order to demonstrate the single effect of the eye, etc., even though they are not a single universal, the term ‚Äúeye‚Äù is applied to the collection of form, etc.üîΩIn the same way, in order to demonstrate the single effect of the collection of name-and-form, etc., the term ‚Äúname-and-form‚Äù is applied to the collection of name and form.

original: tshogs dang rgyu dang gnas skabs khyad par can rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni tshogs dang rgyu dang / gnas skabs khyad par can gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: tshogs dang rgyu dang gnas skabs khyad par can rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni tshogs dang rgyu dang / gnas skabs khyad par can gyi sgra'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is a term that expresses a collection, a cause, and a particular stage.

original: de la tshogs brjod pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la tshogs brjod pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With reference to the term that expresses a collection, the root text states, ‚Äúall of them,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma lus pa dag gi ste gzugs dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa dag gi ste gzugs dang dri dang ro la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll of them‚Äù refers to form, smell, taste, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The effect is the grasping of water, etc.

original: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those are form, etc.

original: thams cad dag gi 'bras bu gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: thams cad dag gi 'bras bu gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to the statement, ‚ÄúThe effect of all is one,‚Äù

original: 'bras bu de la byed pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de la byed pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because there is no difference in the activity with regard to that effect.

original: 'bras bu gcig byed pa de bas na khyad par med pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed pa de bas na khyad par med pa zhes bya'i /
translated: That is the activity of producing one effect. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout difference.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not because there is no difference in the intrinsic identity of the elements.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa ston pa tsam byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa ston pa tsam byed pa yin la /
translated: They merely demonstrate the capacity to produce one effect.üîΩThe statement of the difference is meaningless, because the different words have no effect in expressing form, etc. individually. Therefore, all the elements are simultaneously, i.e., at one time, applied to a single effect.

original: khyad par brjod pa don med pa can sgra tha dad pa gzugs la sogs pa so sor brjod pa'i 'bras bu med pa can yin pa'i phyir cig car te dus gcig tu thams cad kyi 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la sbyor bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten pa
analyzed: khyad par brjod pa don med pa can sgra tha dad pa gzugs la sogs pa so sor brjod pa'i 'bras bu med pa can yin pa'i phyir cig car te dus gcig tu thams cad kyi 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la sbyor bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten pa
translated: The world

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
translated: uses conventions in this way.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gcig gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa nus pa @162b dag la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gcig gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa nus pa @162b dag la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The single term ‚Äúpot‚Äù is applied to the pot‚Äôs specific features, such as its form, which have the capacity to hold water, etc.

original: gal te bum pa so so la gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bum pa so so la gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: If the pot‚Äôs form, etc., are different in each individual pot,

original: ji ltar bum pa'i sgra gcig la khyad par med par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i sgra gcig la khyad par med par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the single term ‚Äúpot‚Äù be understood without distinction?

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though they are many, etc.‚Äù

original: mang po dag la bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig gcig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mang po dag la bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig gcig yin zhe na /
translated: If the term ‚Äúpot‚Äù is one for many,

original: tshig gcig yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshig gcig yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though the term is one, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mang po dag la sgra gcig gi nus pa gcig yin pa'i don yin pa de ltar tshig gcig gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig la nus pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: ji ltar mang po dag la sgra gcig gi nus pa gcig yin pa'i don yin pa de ltar tshig gcig gis kyang gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig la nus pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir ro
translated: Just as the term is one for many, the term ‚Äúpot‚Äù has a single capacity for the many forms, etc., that hold water, etc.

original: // 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid kyis de dag gcig nyid du sgro btags nas tshig gcig bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid kyis de dag gcig nyid du sgro btags nas tshig gcig bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having superimposed oneness on them by way of the single effect, the single word is for the sake of the action.

original: gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa la brten nas kyang tshig gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du sgro btags pa la brten nas kyang tshig gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even though the single word does not come about in dependence on the superimposition of oneness,

original: 'on kyang phyi'i don la ltos pa med par brda'i gzhan dbang gis kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi'i don la ltos pa med par brda'i gzhan dbang gis kyang yin te /
translated: nevertheless, it is also due to the power of the convention without regard to the external object.

original: gang dag gi tshig dngos po'i dbang lhur brjod 'dod pa mi rten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang dag gi tshig dngos po'i dbang lhur brjod 'dod pa mi rten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Those whose words are said to be dependent on the power of the thing, not on the desire to speak, etc., have been explained previously.

original: rgyu brjod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rgyu brjod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the expression of the cause,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSimilarly, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: Cause and effect are cause and effect.

original: de'i khyad par rgyu dang rgyur bcas pa'i dngos pos rgyud gcig gi gnas skabs la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rgyu dang rgyur bcas pa'i dngos pos rgyud gcig gi gnas skabs la brten pa nyid do //
translated: The difference of that is the state of a single continuum by way of the thing with the cause.

original: de ltar gyur pa na thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na thob pa'o //
translated: When that is the case, it is obtained.

original: thob pa ni tshig tu 'gyur ba'i las dang bcas pa'o ste /
analyzed: thob pa ni tshig tu 'gyur ba'i las dang bcas pa'o ste /
translated: Obtaining is together with the action of becoming a word.

original: sgrub par byed pa byed pa dang ldan par zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa byed pa dang ldan par zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de'i skyes bu'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe agent of the act of producing‚Äù refers to the second of the two terms in the compound ‚Äúthe act of producing.‚Äù

original: gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ba grub pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ba grub pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is established as the effect of a cause‚Äù refers to the third of the three terms in the compound ‚Äúthe act of producing.‚Äù

original: gyur pa sgra 'og tu sbyar ba ni spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid kyi bar du gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur pa sgra 'og tu sbyar ba ni spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid kyi bar du gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is applied to the second term in the compound ‚Äúthe act of producing‚Äù because it is included in the collection of the act of experiencing, etc.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúa single effect‚Äù means that a single sprout, stem, leaf, etc., is the effect of a single seed.

original: gcig 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni dper na zhes bya ba la myu gu dang sdong bu dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig yin pa lta bu'am bsgrub par bya ba ste /üîΩdper na rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon gcig gis de dag nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: gcig 'ga' zhig sgrub par byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni dper na zhes bya ba la myu gu dang sdong bu dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig yin pa lta bu'am bsgrub par bya ba ste / dper na rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon gcig gis de dag nyid lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa single cause‚Äù means that a single seed is the cause of a single sprout, stem, leaf, etc.

original: skad cig ma du ma'i bdag @163a * //üîΩnyid myu gu la sogs pa de dag kyang //
analyzed: skad cig ma du ma'i bdag @163a * // nyid myu gu la sogs pa de dag kyang //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa single entity‚Äù means that the sprout, etc., which is a collection of many moments, is a single entity.

original: gcig car rtogs pa'i don du 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gcig car rtogs pa'i don du 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa single effect‚Äù means that the sprout, etc., which is a collection of many moments, is a single effect.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúa single cause‚Äù means that a single seed is the cause of the sprout, etc., which is a collection of many moments.

original: rgyu gcig pa nyid kyi spyi des 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra rgyud brjod pa rnams kyi brda'i dus su brdar byas pa dag phyis tha snyad kyi dus su tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gcig pa nyid kyi spyi des 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra rgyud brjod pa rnams kyi brda'i dus su brdar byas pa dag phyis tha snyad kyi dus su tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir bstan par bya'o //
translated: The universal of oneness is taught in order to make the expressions of the continuums of words such as ‚Äúgrain‚Äù and so on, which were made into signs at the time of the signs, easy to use as conventions at the time of the conventions.

original: tha dad pa de dag rgyun shes par 'dod pa ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa tha dad pas sgra du ma sbyor ba la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag rgyun shes par 'dod pa ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa tha dad pas sgra du ma sbyor ba la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who wish to know the continuum of those different things, because of the difference of seed, sprout, and so on, do not apply many words, because it would be fruitless.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni mig la sogs pa'i sgra bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni mig la sogs pa'i sgra bzung ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the words ‚Äúeye‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag gis kyang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa'i rgyun brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa'i rgyun brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not express the continuum of the differences of the child, youth, and so on.

original: 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra gzugs gcig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i sgra ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra gzugs gcig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i sgra ma yin nam /
translated: Also, the words ‚Äúgrain‚Äù and so on are the mere collection of the words ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on, so aren‚Äôt they words for a collection?

original: bden te 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rgyun rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rgyun rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: True, but it is said in this way because it is the continuum that is the basis of the distinction between cause and effect.

original: de skad du brjod pas nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pas nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: So there is no fault in saying this.

original: ji ltar bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig pa'i rgyu gang gis bstan pa de ltar 'bru'i gzugs la sogs pa la 'bru zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig pa ltar byed pa de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes smosüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la bum pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig pa'i rgyu gang gis bstan pa de ltar 'bru'i gzugs la sogs pa la 'bru zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig pa ltar byed pa de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Just as the word pot is applied to the form and so on of a pot by a single cause, so the word grain is applied to the form and so on of grains. Therefore, it should be stated as before.

original: gnas skabs kyi sgra'i dbang du byas nas gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi sgra'i dbang du byas nas gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: From the perspective of the term state, he says, whatever, and so on.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag go //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag go //
translated: Whatever refers to blue and so on, the particles.

original: so so zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: so so zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag go //
translated: Individual refers to blue, yellow and so on, which are mutually independent.

original: sdud pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig 'dus pa dag go //
analyzed: sdud pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig 'dus pa dag go //
translated: Collected refers to those that are assembled together.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa la'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa la'o //
translated: It is an obstruction to the arising of another object in its own place.

original: cig car shes pa nyid kyi don du zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig gis mang po dag nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car shes pa nyid kyi don du zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig gis mang po dag nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of the cognition of many at one time‚Äù is because of the determination of many by one word.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnas skabs khyad par can gyi tshig gis bstan du yod pa zhes brjod pa rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa gang yin @163b pa de dag
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnas skabs khyad par can gyi tshig gis bstan du yod pa zhes brjod pa rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa gang yin @163b pa de dag
translated: Among them, those that are applied to the eye consciousness are called demonstrable by the expression of a special state. Those that are an obstruction to the arising of another object in their own place

original: la ni thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: la ni thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan to //
translated: are taught to be impeded.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dag ni shin tu tha dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dag ni shin tu tha dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt blue, yellow, and so on very different?

original: de dag bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de dag bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra gcig gis ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How are they expressed by the word demonstrable and so on?

original: de'i phyir de dag gzhan dag las tha dad pa'i spyi nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gzhan dag las tha dad pa'i spyi nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThey are universals that are different from others,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni gzhan bstan du med pa dang thogs pa med pa dag las tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid dag gi spyi yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzhan bstan du med pa dang thogs pa med pa dag las tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid dag gi spyi yin te /
translated: That is the universal of those two, which is different from the other, which is not demonstrable and not impeded.

original: thams cad de dag las zlog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de dag las zlog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all are just the opposite of those two.

original: gtan tshigs de bas na'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de bas na'o //
translated: The reason is because of that.

original: gal te bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang rdul phra rab kyi tshogs brjod pa'i sgra kho na yin nam ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang rdul phra rab kyi tshogs brjod pa'i sgra kho na yin nam ma yin snyam na /
translated: If the words demonstrable, etc., are just the words expressing a collection of atoms, then are they not?

original: rdul phra rab gcig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even a single atom is to be expressed by the words impeded, etc.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas sgra'i 'jug pa bstan nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas sgra'i 'jug pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the application of the words from the point of view of the effect,

original: rgyu'i sgo nas bstan pa ni ji ltar 'bras bu gcig pa can ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas bstan pa ni ji ltar 'bras bu gcig pa can ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: he teaches from the point of view of the cause: Just as the effect is one, so is form, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bu brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it expresses the effect of that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa de'i 'bras bu gcig po yod pa de brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa de'i 'bras bu gcig po yod pa de brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it expresses the existence of the one effect of that capacity which holds water, etc., of form, etc.

original: nus pa gcig bstan par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa gcig bstan par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement I will teach the one capacity is that.

original: de bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gzhan las tha dad pa bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gzhan las tha dad pa bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so //
translated: The words pot, etc., refer to the pot, etc., which are different from the other, non-pot, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the words grain, etc.

original: brdar byas pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: brdar byas pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement the convention is taught is that.

original: de bzhin du rgyu la ltos pa dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu la ltos pa dag kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement in the same way, those that depend on a cause is that.

original: sgra gcig cig brdar byas pa bstan ces bya ba'i tshig rnam par bsgyur bar byas nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra gcig cig brdar byas pa bstan ces bya ba'i tshig rnam par bsgyur bar byas nas sbyar ro //
translated: The statement the convention is taught by a single word is to be construed as a passive construction.

original: tha snyad du byas pa'i don kho na ni tshogs chung bar zhes bya bar shugs kyis blta bar bya'o //üîΩba lang khra mo'i bu thams cad dag kho na la rgyu gcig gis khra mo'i bu'i sgras brjod cing /
analyzed: tha snyad du byas pa'i don kho na ni tshogs chung bar zhes bya bar shugs kyis blta bar bya'o // ba lang khra mo'i bu thams cad dag kho na la rgyu gcig gis khra mo'i bu'i sgras brjod cing /
translated: The meaning of the statement the object of conventional designation is easily understood is to be understood by implication.üîΩThe word all refers to the offspring of the tawny cow. The word tawny offspring refers to them by a single cause.

original: ser skya'i bu dag la ser skya'i bu'i sgras brjod la /
analyzed: ser skya'i bu dag la ser skya'i bu'i sgras brjod la /
translated: The word Kapila's offspring refers to the Kapilas.

original: skyes bu 'bad pa'i rgyus skyed pa'i ji tsam pa'i sgra de thams cad ni rgyu mtshungs pas bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir btsal ma thag tu byung bar bstan te /
analyzed: skyes bu 'bad pa'i rgyus skyed pa'i ji tsam pa'i sgra de thams cad ni rgyu mtshungs pas bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir btsal ma thag tu byung bar bstan te /
translated: All those sounds generated by the effort of a person are taught to arise immediately after the search, because they are generated by a similar cause.

original: @164a * // bya'o snyam du sems ni btsal ba'o //
analyzed: @164a * // bya'o snyam du sems ni btsal ba'o //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI will make a sound‚Äù is the search.

original: de'i de ma thag pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: Immediately after that is without interruption.

original: der byung bas na btsal ma zag tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: der byung bas na btsal ma zag tu byung ba'o //
translated: Because it arises there, it arises immediately after the search.

original: de dag gis ni rgyu'i khyad par la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rgyu'i khyad par la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Those teach the particularities of the cause and so forth.

original: rgyu tsam la rten gyi sgo nas byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam la rten gyi sgo nas byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mere cause is called ‚Äúproduced‚Äù from the perspective of the basis.

original: sgra la btsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / rgyu la ltos pa'i rkyen can la byas pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la btsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / rgyu la ltos pa'i rkyen can la byas pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that ‚Äúproduced‚Äù refers to sound that arises immediately after the search and to that which has conditions that depend on a cause.

original: de ltar re zhig sgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sgrub pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught by way of proof,

original: dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach by way of negation,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSimilarly,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa mig gis gzung bar bya ba de'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa de bkag pas /üîΩsgra ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mig gis gzung bar bya ba de'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa de bkag pas / sgra ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye sense faculty apprehends blue and so on, and the eye consciousness is the result of that sense faculty.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar na /
translated: Sound is not apprehended by the eye because it is not a potential of the eye consciousness.

original: spyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do ;
analyzed: spyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do ;
translated: In that case, the word ‚Äúnot apprehended by the eye‚Äù is stated in general.

original: / mi rtag pa'i sgra yang rtag pa rnam par gcod pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa na /
analyzed: / mi rtag pa'i sgra yang rtag pa rnam par gcod pas rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa na /
translated: Also, the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is established by the exclusion of permanence.

original: de 'bras bu bkag pa kho nas so //
analyzed: de 'bras bu bkag pa kho nas so //
translated: In that case, it is only the result of that which is excluded.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis rtag pa dngos por 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis rtag pa dngos por 'dod kyi /
translated: In this way, others assert that permanence is a thing,

original: med pa tsam ni ma yin te /üîΩde yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin na /üîΩtha snyad kyi lam mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'am /
analyzed: med pa tsam ni ma yin te / de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba ma yin na / tha snyad kyi lam mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'am /
translated: but it is not mere nonexistence.üîΩIf that is not established as the object to be established and the means of establishment,

original: sgrub par byed pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: then the path of convention would not be engaged, and therefore the object to be established or the means of establishment would have to be accepted.

original: de la rtag pa nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de la rtag pa nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not the probandum because of permanence.

original: de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no da ltar gzhan dag gis kyang 'dod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no da ltar gzhan dag gis kyang 'dod par bya ba'o //
translated: It is the very proof of that, and it is also to be accepted by others.

original: de ltar na rtag tu bdag nyid gnas sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu bdag nyid gnas sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: Thus, it is always the proof of one‚Äôs own nature,

original: gzhan bdag nyid la brten pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de rtag tu sgrub par byed pa de bas na /
analyzed: gzhan bdag nyid la brten pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de rtag tu sgrub par byed pa de bas na /
translated: or it is the proof of any other effect that is based on itself. Therefore,

original: de'i 'bras bu de rnam par gcad cing de rnam par bzlog cing mi rtag pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu de rnam par gcad cing de rnam par bzlog cing mi rtag pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
translated: its effect is excluded and it is excluded from that, and it becomes the word ‚Äúimpermanent.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig rang rgyud du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig rang rgyud du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate some effect as independent,

original: bdag gi sgrar yang byas pa yin pa de ltar na de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa rnam par gcad pas bdag med pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sgrar yang byas pa yin pa de ltar na de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa rnam par gcad pas bdag med pa'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is also made into the word ‚Äúself.‚Äù Thus, it becomes the word ‚Äúselfless‚Äù by excluding what is not its effect.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu dgag pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught by way of negating the effect,

original: rgyu dgag pa'i sgo nas @164b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dgag pa'i sgo nas @164b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach by way of negating the cause,

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúits‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag po dang bcas pa stong pa nyid ma yin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa de bkag pas sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di ni bdag po med pa dang / stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha snyad kyi don bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa stong pa nyid ma yin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa de bkag pas sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di ni bdag po med pa dang / stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha snyad kyi don bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúempty‚Äù is explained as follows: the negation of the cause of the non-emptiness of sound, etc. , which is the existence of an owner, is the meaning of the term ‚Äúownerless‚Äù and ‚Äúempty. ‚Äù

original: /'di ltar bdag la sogs pa'i rang rgyud kyis bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po dang bcas par gzhan dag 'dod de //üîΩbdag gir 'dod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: /'di ltar bdag la sogs pa'i rang rgyud kyis bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po dang bcas par gzhan dag 'dod de // bdag gir 'dod pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, others assert that that which is appropriated by a self, etc. , through its own continuum is ‚Äúthat which has an owner. ‚ÄùüîΩIf it were not empty,

original: stong pa ma yin du zin kyang de lta bur gyur par bdag gi byed pa pos bdag gir byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin du zin kyang de lta bur gyur par bdag gi byed pa pos bdag gir byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it would be appropriated by the agent of appropriation, the self, because it would be appropriated by the self.

original: bdag gi byed pa nyid kyang bdag gir bya ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi byed pa nyid kyang bdag gir bya ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The agent of appropriation is the cause of appropriation,

original: rnam pa gzhan du na bdag gir byed pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na bdag gir byed pa nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is the agent of appropriation in any other way.

original: de bas na gzhan dag gis bdag po dang bcas pa'i sgra ni rgyu'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dag gis bdag po dang bcas pa'i sgra ni rgyu'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, others assert that the term ‚Äúthat which has an owner‚Äù is used in terms of a cause.

original: dngos po skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i tshogs pa tsam la rag lus pa dag la /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i tshogs pa tsam la rag lus pa dag la /
translated: They are mere collections of things that disintegrate moment by moment.üîΩ

original: rang gi ngo bos gnas pa'i bdag gi byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos gnas pa'i bdag gi byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of things that are mere collections of moments that are destroyed in every instant, there is no self that is an agent that exists by its own intrinsic reality.

original: gang la rag las pa'i 'du byed 'jug pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang la rag las pa'i 'du byed 'jug pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since it is the case that conditioned things are engaged in dependence on that,

original: bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu bkag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu bkag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: selflessness and emptiness are established by the negation of the cause as it has been explained.

original: de ltar gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mgon med pa dang / mi ston pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mgon med pa dang / mi ston pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, with regard to others, such as suffering, impurity, helplessness, and non-teaching,üîΩas is appropriate.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig dgag pa dang / rgyu 'ga' zhig bkag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig dgag pa dang / rgyu 'ga' zhig bkag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that some results are negated and some causes are negated.

original: sdug bsngal dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu bkag pas yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu bkag pas yin te /
translated: Suffering, impurity, and so on are negated as results.

original: bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus byas thams cad ni log par smin pa'i chos can du rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus byas thams cad ni log par smin pa'i chos can du rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the results of the opposite, such as happiness and purity, are posited, and because all conditioned things are similar in having the nature of ripening.

original: mgon med pa dang mi ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bkag pas yin te /
analyzed: mgon med pa dang mi ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyu bkag pas yin te /
